Reviews.Title: “Rydges world square just gets better”
Reviews.Author: jesmar14
Reviews.Content: Last week I stayed ( 21st visit) and each time it just gets better. The professional, welcoming and smiling reception staff are continually superb. Nuria and the reception team are friendly to all guests and for regulars like me always remember my name and make me feel so special each arrival. The general manager, Tish Nyor went out of his way to ensure my length of stays were recognised with a lovely card and bottle of wine sent to my room with his compliments. But it gets even better! I celebrated my birthday with my son and daughter in law at the new and awesome seafood buffet ( Friday/ Saturday $40 - that is the true price at the time of my stay) A great new innovation nd so fresh and delicious ! On the 18 April I invited 14 guests from my conference to a last minute dinner plan. Called the restaurant at 5.30pm to check if it was ok and was told - of course it was!. By the time we arrived the number had grown to 22 - restaurant staff were very agreeable and made us all feel so welcome. A 3 course set menu was hurriedly put together, extra seating added, wine at the ready and meals served in a reasonable time- wow!!! Thanks soooo much Olivier, Vince and David, you are all true professionals and very gracious. I ask myself and colleageus why would you stay anywhere else Rydges wrold square has the X factor which money can't buy

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Chris W
Reviews.Content: I purchased two nights' mid-week accommodation as a mystery deal online. I chose the deal based on price and star rating - both in my favour. I travel a lot for work and have come to expect certain levels of satisafaction for certain star ratings. I was wholly let down on this occasion. I specifically requested a non-smoking room - I think the room became a non-smoking room upon my occupation of it. It wreaked of stale cigarettes, as did the whole corrdior getting there from the lift. The lift was an oven on every trip - when it worked properly. The labelling of floors is misleading - I was in Room 1211, and was informed it was on the 12th floor. Wrong. First floor above the lobby and right on a major cross-intersection hence quite noisy at all hours. The servicing of the room was woeful. My room was not attended to until sometime between 6.30pm and 9.30pm when I left for dinner out. For my 48 hour stay, the room across the hall did not have its room service tray and dishes and food scraps collectedm despite sighting several trollies in the hallway at various times. If it wasn't for the mystery price, I woud've been banging my fists at reception for a full refund.

Reviews.Title: “Good place in a great location”
Reviews.Author: avranga
Reviews.Content: Good place to stay right in the heart of Sydney. Though in a very busy area, once inside it's all clean , calm and quiet. Great spacious rooms, friendly helpful staff, good bar and dining, Perfectly located, close to all public transport, shopping and attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Rosemary W
Reviews.Content: Having had an outstanding stay at Rydges Wellington we booked to stay in this hotel a week later. The service was average, nothing at all outstanding, and the rooms were the same. The overall hotel was very run down and needed a good clean and lick of paint. The rooms are far from sound proof and you could hear every word from neighbouring rooms, including the crying of a baby across the corridor two doors down. We were given a complimentary wine and cheese platter on our first night, which was very pleasant and the highlight of the stay. However the platter, dirty glasses and bottle were left for two days before being removed. Outside the hotel is far from salubrious, in fact the extreme opposite. All very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay.”
Reviews.Author: Christine D
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights here and it was really great. Good size room with really big, comfy bed and terrific pillows!! The staff were very friendly and helpful and it is in a good location with plenty of cheap eaterys, good restaurants and the free green bus very handy. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not nearly as bad as some reviews suggest!”
Reviews.Author: mrssmith1368
Reviews.Content: We booked a mystery deal and on finding out the hotel name and checking out the TA reviews, we were a bit concerned as there were so many bad reviews. On arrival we took a good look at the bathroom and couldn't fault it for cleanliness. The hotel is in a great location and walking distance to all the city sights. The monorail and free tourist bus is just a short walk away. There are plenty of great places to eat nearby. (Try Macchiato for breakfast.) Look I'm not entirely sure I would agree this place is 5 star. I have stayed at 4 star places in Melbourne just as nice. However on the plus side we found all the hotel staff to be genuinely friendly and courteous. The bed was super comfy. There was a window that opened - which is very rare in multi-storey hotels. Also the bar is very swanky. The negatives...our first 2 nights we had trouble sleeping due to a strange vibrating sound that continued until the wee hours. At first we thought it was doof-doof from a night club downstairs but because it stopped and started we thought it might be from the lifts. Anyway it was very annoying. Our room faced the street whereas other rooms face an internal atrium. I'd suggest if you are a light sleeper, have a word with reception staff to get a room that is a bit quieter. The other thing that blew me away about this hotel was they allowed smoking in the rooms. Some floors are non-smoking and others allow it! I thought this was crazy. I can't remember the last time I was in a Melbourne hotel that allowed smoking. We were thankfully accommodated on a non-smoking floor but pity the poor woman we spoke to in the lift who had requested non-smoking but her family were put on a smoking floor and could smell smoke coming under the door. The hotel could not move her to a non-smoking room and offered a bottle of champagne and a fruit basket as compensation. I would have told them where to stick it if that were me!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: jenkeane
Reviews.Content: I booked on a last minute website, and part of the deal was an 8pm check-in. Good location, right in the heart of Sydney CBD. Near to Oxford Street, and Hyde Park, and equally close to the shopping hub. I was able to walk to Museum Station nearby to catch the airport train. Nice clean rooms. Bit busy on check-in, and also on departure. No complaints, a hassle free stay.

Reviews.Title: “represented good value.”
Reviews.Author: Ellemay
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight at Rydges World Tower due to my husband running a conference in the hotel for a week. Check-in - we arrived after work around 5pm & checked in without any hiccups. Room - Our suite consisted on a separate living room & bedroom which was spacious, clean & well equipped with a working desk, TV & mini bar. Bathroom - A very spacious bathroom with good fluffy towels supplied. Location - The Rydges World Square Tower Hotel is located in a handy spot to Chinatown & the business precinct in Sydney CBD. Its also walking distance to the main shopping district the Pitt Street Mall. I'm not a great fan of the location as IMO there are heaps better located hotels in Sydney without the 'seedy' area. Facilities - The best aspect of this hotel is the bar & restaurant. We enjoyed having drinks at the Square Bar which has a fab atmosphere. The Sphere Restaurant is also very enjoyable. Overall - we enjoyed our stay & found the hotel offering a comfortable stay with excellent amenities. A good hotel if wanting to be located near Chinatown or the Sydney Entertainment centre.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfy bed”
Reviews.Author: dougaloz
Reviews.Content: Overall not a bad Hotel and a good price. Quite a small room but a very soft and comfortable King size bed certainly helps. More good news is that there is a seperate shower and not one over a bath. Rooms are quiet, quite clean and well maintained - though the aircon is quite noisy. My only disappointment is the staff. Desk staff were friendly but as my room wasn't ready yet - I left my luggage with the Concierge. On my return, I went to collect my bags - only to be told that I had to go and get them myself ... AND that they were down a set of escalators??. There was no offer to collect them for me or to arrange for them to be taken to the room - in fact this rude man watched me struggle with my 2 bags up the escalator and across the foyer to the lift. I've travelled a good deal and never experienced this behaviour before ... not sure what he thought his job is?. Apart from this, the Hotel is well situated in the CBD but nearer China Town than the Rocks. The monorail is outside and Museum station is a 2 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Started off great...”
Reviews.Author: Rob N
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we were very happy with the service and the greeting with the front desk staff. We arrived early but they had a room for us. Room was huge, very clean and well appointed. Internet is pricey, no wifi just a cable option. The internet drops out as well which was a pain. DO NOT order room service, was the worst overpriced slop I have ever seen. It was disgusting. Location great, lots of restaurants and bars to go to. Had to ring the fron desk to have our room cleaned as they just forgot. When we left and rang to have our bags (we had many including car seats and prams) taken down we waited 45 minutes until we gave up and took it ourselves. Sad really, just some issues let the whole experience down. Would we stay again? Maybe, but if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Significantly Improved”
Reviews.Author: kevinpng
Reviews.Content: My most recent stay at Rydges World Square was a pleasant one. Rooms have been re-furbished since my last stay, and rooms are pleasant and well appointed. Bathrooms still look a little dated, but new shower fixtures are a bonus. Staff are friendly and accommodating, and the location of the hotel is very good and central. Hotel bar is somewhat overpriced (but then again, all hotel bars seem to be). For the right rate I would be happy to stay here again,

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: Scott M
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on the 23rd march one night for my birthday , I love the beds , wish I could take it home with me , it's close to everything that I wanted to do and see in Sydney and a short walk to central station for the train back home , I own a I pad free wi fi Internet would be good in rooms and house keeping should have mini skin moisturising lotion for after showering , me being a chef and working in many hotels the past 5 years , there is a good choice of room service menu , and room service staff were nice , would stay again

Reviews.Title: “MINI BAR WAS NOT TOPPED UP IN OUR 4 DAY STAY”
Reviews.Author: JodieG68
Reviews.Content: Terrible service and even though I had approached the front desk after the second and third day to let them know our mini bar had not been topped up, this was still not done on our last night. Stayed on Level 20, the Executive floor but the bathroom was still very small. The rooms were clean and modern with everything you would need for business. The blockout blinds were fabulous. Disappointed there was no pool for the price we paid. The room service was good. Great location for everything in Sydney City especially Darling Harbour where we walked to and from each day during our Expo.

Reviews.Title: “great location, middle of the city”
Reviews.Author: meltolnay
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a little bit out dated but location makes up for it! Staff were helpful and courteous, valet parking was amazing and best value in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Not too foul”
Reviews.Author: RobbedByCambridge
Reviews.Content: I've never had a problem with the Rydges World Square. Have stayed there many times and will stay many more :)

Reviews.Title: “Unhappy”
Reviews.Author: Liz R
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Sydney for a three day stay and were very disappointed in this hotel.Cleanliness was dreadful with scum on the basin and mould in the shower. The whole place needed a good scrub from the shower to the lift and dining room. The staff were pleasant but not very helpful or caring. The bed was comfortable and the room quiet but that for the price you paid it was poor. I would never go back, no excuse for staying in a hotel with other peoples dirt.

Reviews.Title: “Priority Guest ? ? ?”
Reviews.Author: weekend-escapist
Reviews.Content: Very disapointed in this Rydges Hotel . As a frequent business traveller, cleanliness, comfort and impecable service are the top of my priority list. My recent experience has made me wonder where is the hospitality in this hospitalty business and if "Priority Guests" really are! Upon arrival my fast web check in took 15 minutes as the computer system was down. This did not make me unhappy as I totally understand what chaos this can cause. I went to my "deluxe" room and it did not resemble anything "deluxe". I rang reception and enquired to see if there had been a mistake in allocating my room, perhaps, due to the computer problem. The female receptionist (french?)very rudely told me that this was the room I booked and hung up. The room was a smoking room on a smoking floor, being a non smoker I certainly did not book this. There were cigarette butts on the window ledge,the room stunk and the view was of a litter filled roof area. There was not 1 wall in this room that did not have something (wine?) splashed on it. I called reception again and asked to change rooms, this time I spoke to a very polite young man who explained again about the computer problems and advised that he would find me something else.Three hours later I rang again and was given another room. Very clean and fresh! Same furniture without the scuff marks and scratches. The good bits: Bed was like sleeping on a cloud. Lovely shower with good water pressure. Food ordered from room service was beautiful. Room service staff polite and courteous. Location very central to business district and china town. Overall not great value for money considering there are a few hotels in the same presinct to choose from.The management need to do a thourough room check in regards to small maintainence issues and cleaning. A little bit of TLC would go a long way. Parking is $50 a day flat rate -another hotel using the same car park $35 a day.

Reviews.Title: “Standards closer to a 'Motel' than 'Hotel'”
Reviews.Author: Steve H
Reviews.Content: If you've ever had the pleasure of staying at a Travelodge in the UK then this is what you can expect. Budget. The so called shower is a make-shift frame fixed to a corner of the bathroom. Two bath towels, one hand towel. Dirty black mould in numerous places & dust/skin caught up in the coving & extractor. Furniture in the room is inexpensive golden pine. Flat screen TV brand - SOYEA? Who? Says it all really. Only one plus, bed was comfortable but I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Scott H
Reviews.Content: Had a night out in town with the lads and stayed over here. The downstairs bar was fantastic with good music and attentive (and attractive) staff. Central location meant it was easy to kick on from there once it closed as well as get back. Awesome kebab place just around the corner too. My room was clean, quiet and a good size. All up an enoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Benjomusic
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel to be fantastic! My room was clean and very comfortable, and the service all round was impeccable. I would recommend Rydges World Square to anyone, and I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: TasDevils
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the recent reviews on here about this hotel, I was a little nervous on arrival. However, we had no issues with the room or service, in fact the staff were friendlier than at many other city hotels we have stayed in. We chose this hotel because of it's location, walkable distance to Central station, monorail right outside, and 5 minutes from the Westfield shopping centre and still within walking distances of Darling Harbour and Circular Quay if you're not too lazy! We booked a family room, which is basically 2 connecting rooms sharing one bathroom, it was adequate for a 3 night stay but any longer would have been a strain with 2 teenagers and 2 adults sharing!! The continental offered reasonable value for money ($20 per person) with a good selection of fruit, yoghurts, cereals, pastries and even a pancake machine which was popular with the kids! For that price I would expect a decent cup of coffee though but you had to pay extra for fresh coffee. The cooked selection was poor and I wouldn't recommend it. Overall we were happy with our stay, the location was handy and compared to the rates for other similar hotels over the weekend, the price was competitive.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, tired hotel”
Reviews.Author: languagestudent
Reviews.Content: Stayed because of location - great location and very central, but hotel is overpriced for what it was. Needs updating and attention to cleaning. Could have stayed at the Shangri-La for the same price! If only we had known :(

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT STAFF!!!Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JamaicanByBirth
Reviews.Content: Visited Sydney on a my vacation from Iraq/Kuwait with a few co workers, from the Concierge to the Shift manager was great. Friendly staff and courteous Customer Service, I had the pleasure to deal directly with A team Leader Mrs Mete, she made our stay so pleasant, she made every effort to make sure our stay was a great one! I am one for customer service and they have outdone my expectations from a hotel. Our rooms were made everyday (twice a day for that matter), nice gym, breakfast was superb! But the highlight for us was the Professional Customer Service we received from Mrs E, Mete. There were a minor issue which, we over over looked because of the great customer Service we received on both visits to Australia. IMPROVEMENTS: Consider lowering the cost for a bottle of water, also consider wifi in the room as well!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice room, room to improve”
Reviews.Author: Toby H
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel but feels a bit tired in terms of the service, tidiness and in particular maintenance - these all need to be worked on to bring it back up to a high standard that it could be, especially for the great location it has. Let's get the moan out of the way first. My main problem was a faulty lamp in the room, the kind that flickers on and off, makes that scary electrical buzz when you move the cable. It took THREE calls over two days to get this fixed! I felt like this was not taken seriously which in turn I regard as not caring about guest safety. Little things like the in room book did not show there was a gym (that was in the key card holder) show that there are inconsistencies and lack of attention to detail, this hotel needs to think more like they are just opening, it has all the potential to be really great instead of just quite good. The room itself was a nice size, had everything you would expect and had a nice comfortable bed. The location is really great, get off at Museum station if you are catching the airport train in to cbd, much quicker and closer than going all the way to Town Hall. There is a supermarket right underneath the hotel which has more than everything you could possibly need for a short break in Sydney. I'd recommend to stay at this hotel, but I have been to Sydney before and knew my way around, they could certainly improve and I felt quite let down by the slack approach to guest safety I experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Rydges World Square Sydney Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pam96
Reviews.Content: As a gift for Xmas, our eldest daughter gave all of us (5 adults) tickets for the Harry Potter Exhibition, plus airfares from Melbourne and accommodation. The fact that there were 5 adults seemed to be a little challenging finding somewhere where we could stay together. We booked through Hotels.com and received a two bedroom family room which consisted of one king size bed in main and two king singles in 2nd bedroom. We rang the Concierge regarding another bed for the fifth person and advised they would provide one at a cost of $80...We found this rude as our daughter was already paying $675 for one night. The room was nothing to get excited about, very basic. We also passed a tray full of dirty dishes outside the room next door, it was there when we booked in at 2pm and still there the next day at 11am. The other issue was the smell, we asked for a non smoking room if possible. They must not have had any because the room absolutely stunk of cigarette smoke. My husband and I also had problems with Rydges in Gladstone, Qld just after Xmas. We needed to find accommodation urgently for my cousins funeral. We had another adult staying with us so needed two bedrooms. We were lucky enough to actually get what I would call a suite, lounge, full kitchen, laundry and two bedrooms. Through Hotels.com we received great value at $275 per night. When we went to checkout, we were asked for $950, being advised that room is normally $475 per night. Thank goodness I had taken a print out of confirmation from Hotels.com. I don't know that I can honestly recommend Rydges to anyone. Location for Sydney is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located to most attractions”
Reviews.Author: Traveller2012-12
Reviews.Content: We booked a family room for our stay of 3 nights. We had requested a room with a view, though we were told there was no view's as such we were glad that both room had large windows overlooking busy Pitt St. Reception were very friendly and we did not have to wait for the room. The Rooms were big enough as the family room consists of one main room with a queen bed and an adjourning room that had 2 single room . Bathrooms were clean and had fresh towels every day. the dÃ©cor was a bit run down but the room was kept quite clean. Rydges hotel at world square is very centre to most of Sydney's attractions . The mono rail has a stop as well that makes it very convenient to get to darling harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Convienient location”
Reviews.Author: Chompchompblog
Reviews.Content: Fairly basic accommodation considering the price. House keeping would sometimes forget to clean my coffee mugs for example. Reception very friendly, and a vast area of eating options very close by.

Reviews.Title: “Needs management intervention”
Reviews.Author: RajZ
Reviews.Content: Not the best of experience to start of with. Made a booking thorugh Booking.com and called up 2 days in advance to check the procedure for checking in without the credit card originally used for the booking. I was informed that it would not be needed and any card can be used only to block an amount of $10.something. I checked this thrice on the phone and was given the same answer. When i landed a rather rude front desk rep straight away brought a dead end to my visit. She said i have to make a payment and when i said i checked this, she calmly said it was a mistake and nothing could be done about it. It was frustrating to hear a hotel with whom you have made a booking through one of their trusted partner had no option left for me. I did wonder if i did not check in at all, they would still charge the card the full amount for no show. They could have as easily checked me in. Finally after battling it out, manager did let me in seamlessly while explaining the way forward. But by then i already wasted 2 hours before i could get my room. The overall check-in process was a real nightmare and i hate to say this but a badly trained staff is the last thing i expected. Besides which, step out of the room and you will find cigarette butts lying in the passage. When i informed the staff about this, got a very mild response to it. Worst, business travellers, you are better off not relying on the wifi connection of the hotel, its available only in the lobby area. The rooms were clean and pretty well maintained, no complaints there. Overall, not a good experience from the staff. But a special thanks to David and the manager who's name i cannot recall for making it a bit easy for me. For the rest, YOUR STAFF NEEDS SOME SERIOUS TRAINING ON HOTEL POLICIES FOR GUESTS.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location”
Reviews.Author: vessie73
Reviews.Content: Rydges World Square is centrally located to all the shopping and sight seeing. Short walk to Darling Harbour and great restaurants. Breakfast has a great selection of food to suit all tastes. Great bar.

Reviews.Title: “Central location and lots of options in the centre”
Reviews.Author: cooksjourney
Reviews.Content: This was a Wotif 'mystery' deal as the trip was last minute and I had to take my chances in order to have a bed for the night! It was a nice surprise to find out it was a Rydges hotel as I've stayed in their hotels in Melbourne, Perth, Cairns and Brisbane and they've always been consistently good. This was no different. Helpful staff, reasonable sized rooms, huge towels, good restaurant, all the extras of a 4+ star hotel. The highlight though of any Rydges stay has to be the bed! They are truly one of the most comfortable I've ever slept on. The room was a little tired - clean but showing wear - there were scuff marks on the paintwork, the carpet was a little worn and the decor a bit dated. The shower pressure was a bit on the low side but on the plus it was a very generous bathroom with lots of room to move. The best thing about the hotel though is its location. If you stay make sure you venture out and down to the World Square food court - some good spots for breakfast, a couple of fresh juice bars, some reasonable looking Sushi places and so on - if you turn right when you walk out the front, the lower part of Pitt St offers a reasonable choice of places to eat and Hyde Park is just around the corner. I caught a taxi from the Airport but you could use the train - Museum Station is just a short walk. Cab fare was about $40 and took around 15 mins from the hotel to the airport - this can take longer if it's later in the day.

Reviews.Title: “A definite downgrade of accommodation!”
Reviews.Author: Oska
Reviews.Content: Until recently when in Sydney on business our company contract was with the Sofitel wentworth. Unfortunately for a few months we have had to be accommodated in the rydges world square & it is certainly a huge come down! The place is ghastly! On arrival it was immediately apparent that the location left much to be desired & that the new accommodation was not going to be up to scratch. The hotel entrance is located directly across from Eric's adult bookstore & the Chicago massage parlour...I was meeting a friend that evening & was not particularly comfortable standing outside waiting for her to pick me up. It was the sort of location a lone female would expect to get solicited for business in! The hotel rooms were bland & basic, the carpets were grubby & there was an overall smell of damp. The standard of cleanliness elsewhere was dreadful. There was a room service tray of half eaten food in the corridor which was still there two days later having never been removed. Had housekeeping bothered to actually come down that corridor at all in 48 hours or could they just not be bothered to remove it?! The gym was poor. No sweat towels provided, very poor quality & severe lack of equipment. Decor was like something from a prison. On a safety note I was horrified to find that the exit doors on each floor automatically locked behind you. When I needed to drop a note to a colleague on the floor below me I decided to take the stairs rather than the lift. However once I had entered the stairwell I could not get back into the hotel on any level! It is also worth noting that the stairwell was full of cigarette butt ends! I had to go all the way down & out of the fire escape to then re enter the hotel via the main door & then take the lift. Not only is this ridiculous but it is a safety hazard. Had the stairwell been full of smoke a few floors below I would have been stuck in a suffocating space unable to return to the non smoky floor that I had just left & the only escape would have been to throw myself through the fire or smoke to the exit door 15 floors below! I mentioned this to the hotel who did not seem remotely bothered & who remarked that it was a legal requirement...that is [--] about logic if ever I heard it but then we are talking about down under! Understandably the main exit door to the street should automatically lock to keep out the vagrants (of which the location presented many!) but guests should be able to use the stairs to transverse floors of the hotel....they are always banging on about being Eco friendly after all so why only allow use of the lift?! All in all a dreadful stay. I would never recommend it & hopefully our contract will return once again to the Sofitel before I ever have to go back to Sydney

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service, superb restaurant and cocktail bar”
Reviews.Author: Karen G
Reviews.Content: I travel often for work and when in Sydney, Rydges World Square is ALWAYS my first choice of hotel. Access to the city is easy with the monorail at your doorstep. The Entertainment Centre, Chinatown, Darling Harbour and endless shopping are all within walking distance. However, it is the exceptional first class service at this hotel which puts it a cut above the rest. The concierge staff are wonderful - very friendly and nothing is ever too much trouble. The restaurant and cocktail bar offer first class food and drinks, providing a nice place to relax. The atmosphere is perfect and the staff are incredibly attentive. Access to the internet is available in your room and a business centre is available downstairs. You wont find a more comfortable bed than the ones at Rydges! If you become a member of Rydges Priority Guest you will receive additional value for money discounts. Its the little extras at this hotel that make it a standout - do yourself a favour and experience it for yourself!

Reviews.Title: “One night stay at Rydges World Square”
Reviews.Author: newmummy26
Reviews.Content: I booked through wotif because the Rydges Priority Guest programme couldn't match that kind of deal, which I find amazing, I'd be certain they'd want to keep their customers, not push them away. Anyhoo go to check in, all good, only to be told the king bed I'd ordered through wotif wouldn't be available till 9.00pm Saturday night, I was tired and just wanted to check in so I was saddled with a room with 2 queen beds. Overkill to say the least. The mini bar is sparce, nothing to say wow. I was offered a late check out for 3.00pm but when I advised the desk clerk that I had to leave early Sunday morning, all I got was a shoulder shrug, instead they should have said to this Priority Rewards member was, well we could comp you 2 glasses of champers or a breakfast in the morning like other Rydges places I have stayed when I advised them of the early next morning start. Look after your Priority members Rydges World Square. I left a key at the reception for my beautiful other half to collect as he was tired as well, that didn't eventuate because I know for a fact the check in clerk wasn't listening to a word I was saying. Room was fine, I wouldn't pay full price for the stay what so ever. We ate out as the prices were exorbedent as per any hotel you stay in. For a night in the city for us it was ok, but we'll be going back to 4 Points and Sheraton on the Park where SPG rewards programme actually treat you well and listen. Won't be back to Rydges World Square, location is fine but there are greater places to stay in Sydney CBD.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: thumper123456
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, great food, brilliant bar, but the hallway outside our room had not been vacuumed, black marks on the door,and a stain on the ceiling, other than that everything else was good, very handy to transport and walking distance to the city

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: makeminealargeone
Reviews.Content: First of all, I feel mean giving this hotel just 3 stars - it's definitely better than average but not very good, so I will describe it as just good. The hotel is in Chinatown, where you will find a ton of bars and restaurants. I came back at 2am on Saturday night and it was still going full-swing. There is a lot of traffic but fortunately I couldn't hear it from my room on the 18th floor. Darling Harbour is only a 10 minute walk downhill and there are a number of shops, bars and restaurants there too. I dare say it's a little less lively there. My room was very comfortable with a view of the street below. The bed is great and there are also a range of pillows to choose from. The bathroom has a bath and separate shower cubicle, all of which worked perfectly well. I didn't like the wall-mounted hairdryer though. I didn't eat or drink in the hotel - there are far too many other places to go to outside. All in all, a comfortable stay. The rooms lack certain frills, but these are extras which put up the prices in other places. I wouldn't stay here for a romantic break, say, but for basic(ish) comfort and convenience, it's not bad at all. ps. I only gave it a 3 for cleanliness because although my room was perfectly clean, the carpets in the hallways could have done with being vacuumed.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing because faults are not fixed!”
Reviews.Author: gro05
Reviews.Content: Not often do I stay at a hotel in my own city ... I had 2 separate stays, of 1 night each. Where as the rooms are nicely furnished, except I did not like the aircon blowing on me in bed! Upon my very early morning check out of my 1st stay, I advised the Front Desk the soap holder in the shower was coming off the wall, so soap did not stay there! Not fun having to scramble around for the soap on the shower floor! Upon my return 5 days later, at check in, I find I am assigned the same room! You can imagine my disappointment at finding the problem in the shower had not been rectified! Again at checkout I informed the Front Desk of the problem .... maybe the next guest will find the problem fixed.... I hope p.s. room 1754 if Rydges are interested ....

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, comfortable sleep, need to work on cleaning”
Reviews.Author: MayaN91
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Rydes World Square in Jan 2012 for 3 nights. Staff were overall helpful and polite. My main complaint is with the servicing and cleaning of the rooms. The first night we arrived at the hotel quite late so we figured that the used room service food trays lining the corridor outside our room was simply due to the time of night. The same trays, with left over food sat in the corridor for a good 24hrs. The fridge in our room contained half empty drinks from the previous occupants. And after returning from a day out at 5pm our room still had not been cleaned. Some of the good aspects include the bed/pillows, super comfortable, probably the best I've slept on. The buffet breakfast food was top notch. We also ordered room service on one occasion which was great quality also. Location is very handy for accessing all the tourist hot spots in Sydney. We were concerned that we might be woken by the traffic or the monorail which ran right past our rooms window but were pleasantly surprised by how quiet it was.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great room”
Reviews.Author: aderfinn
Reviews.Content: We found Rydges world square to be in a fantastic location. So much around it from shops to food. Sydney at night was great to wander around, felt safe and no need to find transport. Walking distance to everything and monorail stop at hotel. We got great rates on special and could get the whole family of 5 in one hotel room which had a seperate room for the kids to us. The bed was fantastic! Would stay here again if I could get good rate. Didn't get any food here though as there was so much downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “quite expensive for what you get”
Reviews.Author: D B
Reviews.Content: I stay in sydney quite frequently due to work and this was one of my worst stays there. The location is great but the hotel itself is poor. The place is very expensive as compared to other places and this may sound funny but it smells. For whatever reason, maybe its a lack of airing to the halls rooms but the whole corridor and room i stayed in had a horrific odur. long story short, its an impersonal place and for the price there are nicer places!

Reviews.Title: “Though this review is long overdue but it was indeed worth of writing”
Reviews.Author: DNG6711
Reviews.Content: Though this review is long overdue but it was indeed worth of writing. This was our first time in Sydney & Rydges World Square. We stayed in the city because of an International Youth Gathering we were in and good place to stay just before the event started. The room price was reasonable. Rooms are spacious and clean. The breakfast buffet is nice. The food tasted so good and the freshly squeezed juices were so good as well. Very near to Metro and good restaurants and bars. Close to Malls too. The place itself is brilliant I may say for the price. Next time Iâ€™ll be in Sydney with no hesitation, Rydges World will be on my list.

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints”
Reviews.Author: Tes
Reviews.Content: We had a room facing Pitt St. Comfy bed, clean room & good location. Staff were all friendly and happy to help. Definately not a glitzy/luxury hotel, but good clean accommodation, with lots of cafes and restaurants right downstairs on street level & then a supermarket and more shops downstairs underground. On checkout I left my iPhone charger and had it quickly returned by post which was appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca2012
Reviews.Content: Hotel room was nice with a large king size bed. Bathroom was a good size as well. Not very modern but clean and tidy. Staff also very nice. Would recommend for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Would Not Stay At This Hotel Again”
Reviews.Author: Rob12375
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed with this hotel particulary since we paid more for a room here than we did at a much nicer five star hotel in Sydney. Room was in average condition and smelled musty. The hotel is located in the China Town section of Sydney and this location is very noisy until the wee hours of the morning and the hotel is not within walking distance of tourist sites and activities. The "concierge staff" consisted of bell boys and they had very little knowledge of places to see and to dine while in Sydney. When checking out, make sure that you look at your bill carefully. Our bill was loaded with over $200.00 in various charges for services that we did not receive. The front desk willingly removed the charges but couldn't explain why the charges appeared on our bill in the first place.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great family rooms, friendly staff, great pricing”
Reviews.Author: eileen m
Reviews.Content: Location can't be beaten, walk everywhere or close to all public transport. Chinatown, paddy's markets, darling harbour, circular quay city attractions all close by. Staff are outstanding and nothing was too much trouble and everyone was friendly. Did not eat in hotel as so many places just outside the hotel to explore! If you are a family go for the 'family room' option as this is two bedrooms/one bathroom with interconnecting door. Each room has TV so can keep everyone happy! All ammenties provided and replenished daily. Booked online and got a great three night rate for a hotel in CBD which was amazing. I like a quiet room to enable a good sleep and asked for a room on the quiet side of the hotel and I was amazed that there was no traffic or external noise at all. Would definitely come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: KeyImage
Reviews.Content: They say that location is everything and this hotel has it. From the time you walk through the door you are made to feel welcome. A free drink in the bar did us no harm and we loved the inside outside experience with a light breeze brushing past the window. The room needs a bit of a makeover but if you are in Sydney for the room then you should probably not go there....so much to do we barely saw the room. Love the Dream Bed and pillow menu and the lovely staff like 'Rafter' who had a laughing from when we checked in to when we left. Downstairs shopping, dining and nightclubs kept us busy although we had a lot planned in our short 3 night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Asufindit
Reviews.Content: This hotel is 2 mins from the Monorail and a short walk from the Town Hall and Central train stations. It was a pleasant walk to the Westfield Shopping Centre and the Sydney Tower Eye and then down to Darling Harbour (approx 30 mins.) The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful on several occasions. The first being when we discovered that our on line booking through a third party did not guarantee us an extra child's bed in the room despite our request. The hotel was fully booked (just before New Years Eve) but this was no problem for the Reception who gave us vouchers for complimentary drinks while we waited a short while for our room to be prepared and the spare bed appeared. An excellent start. Later we misplaced one of our room cards - no problem and the cards were quickly replaced. It was no problem to store our luggage after check out until we were ready for our flight. Our room was clean and very quiet - easy to have a sound sleep. The fridge was well stocked with reasonably priced items. There is a Coles superarket and a handy shopping centre with cafes directly under the building. The hotel security is good despite being in a bustling area. All in all, a pleasant experience and wouldnt hesitate to stay here again when next visiting Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and overall a pretty good experience.”
Reviews.Author: Trev H
Reviews.Content: No real complaints other than that lack of a swimming pool which I thought a Rydges hotel of this rating and location would have. We didn't eat or drink at the hotel as explored plenty of other areas thanks to the Monorail station right next to the hotel. Staff were very good. Paid for a three night stay through the Rydges site and overall it was reasonable value. After staying in the cupboards they call rooms at Ibis Darling Harbour it was relief to check in here and receive many times the value for a comparable price.

Reviews.Title: “Location+Service”
Reviews.Author: rien77
Reviews.Content: Great location with large, well appointed rooms. Relaxed yet attentive service. Loved the cool bar and a great dinner in Sphere Restaurant. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “A benchmark stay in value”
Reviews.Author: Lyrischer
Reviews.Content: Pros: Excellent location, quiet and beautifully appointed rooms, attentive genuine service Cons: none This was the 2nd time I have stayed at this property, and I was so impressed I have joined as a priority guest for future stays in the Rydges chain. The location is central to the CBD and an easy walk to shopping and attractions. The rooms are wonderfully appointed, and impeccably presented. All the staff who looked after us were very genuine and earnest in their service, and mention needs to be given to Marcin in Porter services and the bar manager, Giovanni who made sure that all was being attended to. Complemented by the excellent Sphere restaurant where we had breakfasts and lunch, this establishment exceeds its star rating for value, quality and service.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel we stayed in our Summer 2011 vacation”
Reviews.Author: ahm3itravel
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel we stayed in. Big room, with another room in within. My kids even run in the room. The room is clean, service is good. If you like nice hotel but not willing to pay for Marriot price, this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty. Won't be back.”
Reviews.Author: fakem
Reviews.Content: I stay in the CBD frequently, and gave the Rydges a go as my stay was close to NYE and it was good value. Check-in was alright, was waiting a fair while despite there being numerous Receptionists wandering around behind the desk, it's only when the queue started to grow that they began to pay attention. Other than that it wasn't overly friendly, but polite and efficient (once I got to the desk). The first room I was checked into was hot and the air conditioning panel appeared to be broken (knob to adjust fan speed was gone), it was a smoking room (didn't request one so that was my fault but wrongfully assumed hotels didn't even do these anymore as I havnt seen one in Australia in a long time). The desk had a large liquid stain (what appeared to be coke) which was still wet, despite there being a welcome letter in my room dated Dec 24, 5 days before my check-in. There was no note in the second room. The bathroom door was filthy with hand smudges. I phoned for a second room which was organized quickly and with no fuss, the second room was fine, however the walls were chipped and the desk and surfaces were covered in stains. There was liquid (again, like coke) behind the tv as well as crumbs. I note this has been mentioned before - hallways were absolutely putrid as well. Large amounts of visible dirt. I'm in no way a fussy traveller but I was left very underwhelmed by the Rydges, which superficially looks good but poke a little deeper and you'll find many faults. If you can forgive the cleanliness and judge on price alone, you'll probably be alright but there's no I'll be back again. Lesson learnt.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Diana1941
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 3 nights with my partner and 2 teenagers. We arrived about 10 am and were able to check in early at no extra cost! The hotel room was modern and spotless. The daily servicing of the room was of a high standard. The staff were very helpful. This is a good hotel if you want somewhere a bit nicer but not into the pretentious hotels where you feel you have to be dressed up to walk through the foyer. Hotel's position is perfect for CBD sightseeing. Monorail stop practically next door. Coles supermarket very close. We paid $562 I think for 4 people for 3 nights which I thought was awesome considering how nice and well located this hotel is. I have read through the previous reviews and there seemed to be quite a few poor ones which I find ridiculous. If you feel this hotel is beneath you then why didn't you book a 5 star on the harbour! Will definitely stay here every time we come to Sydney in future.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: mark o
Reviews.Content: room was good and clean, located close to shoping centre's,staff were friendly enough. although the restaurant is way to small for hotel,was told to eat breakfast in the bar area and is quite a walk to the buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, neglected room.”
Reviews.Author: tonirog
Reviews.Content: On our recent trip to Sydney, we stayed at this hotel, billed as a deluxe hotel by our travel company. Far from it. While the public areas are clean, the halls and elevators are filthy. Our room was adequate and fairly clean. Everything looked like it had only been superficially gone over. ( I.e.- Found food wrappers in inconspicuous places, flat screen tv had been wiped with something that left a huge smear. It was never cleaned during the 4 night stay.) The people manning the "concierge" desk were hard pressed to be able to answer any of the questions that we posed regarding directions, restaurants, public transportation. We were disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet room, great location.”
Reviews.Author: pinkflamingo88
Reviews.Content: Service not spectacular (tip to reception desk staff: mocking tired travellers who are slow to respond to your invitations to step forward is never a good look), but room was quiet and location very central and close to everything. Fixtures & fittings a little tired and the place feels a little unloved. And no wifi - except in the lobby - what is that?

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with great staff & location”
Reviews.Author: familytraveller007
Reviews.Content: We have just finished our stay at Rydges World Square and were impressed with both the hotel and the staff. Check in was fast and efficient. Our family room on the 17th floor was clean and perfect for two adults and two kids. Mention should be made of the concierge staff who are always helpfull with friendly smiles. All requests were handled promptly and professionaly. We would not hesitate to give the hotel our recomendation and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally Located”
Reviews.Author: newkindofsoup
Reviews.Content: Comfortable hotel with rooms on the smaller side of the scale. Well located for shops and transport. Efficient service for parking, luggage storage and check in/out.

Reviews.Title: “Not A Problem - Would Stay Again - Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Lachlan72 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Seems like this hotel is hit-and-miss depending on which room you get. I was staying in the CBD as it was our company Xmas party and I didn't want to get a cab home. Most hotels were in the "ridiculous" price category for this night (16 Dec) but I got a room online on the Rydges Website for $149.00 which seemed good value. Check-in was quick and efficient. The same staff member (Sheree? - A lovely Chinese girls anyway) served me the next morning and was friendly, smiling and helpful. Room was great. Excellent water pressure in shower. Responsive air conditioning. Rydges "super bed" or whatever it's called was very comfy and restful. Room was very clean. Only negative thing was the floor numbering of the hotel - it's deceiving. I was on the "15th" floor, but this is really the 5th floor - rooms start on floor 10, which is the 1st floor. Weird system. Also, when I wanted to sleep-in the next morning, housekeeping staff in other rooms doing their job were VERY noisy. I know they have work to do and need to do it quickly, but there seemed to be an army of them, and they were really chatty, noisy and banged things around a lot. Really minor detail but thought I'd mention it. Parking at $50 is way over-priced, but that's Sydney for you. Location is excellent, although can be difficult for cabs to stop outside the hotel at times. Mini bar priced quite well considering it's a 4-star hotel in downtown Sydney. Would stay again if I needed to. Just another Rydges Hotel - but consistent and nothing to really complain about.

Reviews.Title: “One night stay”
Reviews.Author: Julievince
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I booked a Mystery Deal on Wotif as we had his work Xmas party in the city. After booking we discovered we were staying at Rydges World Square which suited us as it was located 200mtrs from our party. We arrived at 230pm but drove around the block several times trying to work out where to stop for parking as it is not stated on their website that you have to pull over in the bus bay/ no stopping area and give your keys to the staff to park your cars. We finally got 5 min parking down the road and ran in to discover the above..This is when we also discovered it was $50 for parking, not from being told or reading it on the hotel's website as NOTHING is said about the price of parking, there was however a small sign in the corner of the door (outside) with a member of staff standing infront of. Very expensive and our "Mystery Deal" which we thought was excellent and cheap just became more expensive than the usual 4 star accommodation we stay at in the city for work functions (that has a $25 parking fee!) Whilst checking in we were told we had been given a complimentery room upgrade. We were impressed with that! And we were on level 19. We made our way to the lifts which are located to the left of reception when my fiance then asked were these the lifts we use. We were told "No, they are around the corner (opposite direction to what we went in, about 50 mtrs away). While the reception staff we dealt with were friendly, this information should be relayed to guests when checking in just out of courtesy. The levels are a bit misleading also. I anticipated level 19 would be quite high, however, ground floor is actually level 10...so you are really only up 9 floors. Not sure why they do this. Our room was small but nice. Bathroom was nice, but hot water is not all that ":hot", bedding was nice, pillows were amazing. Our room,1920, only had 1 bathrobe in it which we found a little strange. Whilst we didn't eat or drink anything in the mini bar we did have a look and find the Chips expired in September 2011 (When we were checking in an Overseas Flight Attendant complained to reception about the same issue in her room!) We went to our party and then returned at 12am. The room had an opening window but we did not open it as the nightclubs downstairs were quite noisy even with the window shut. This is not the hotels fault. At 2am, incase we missed the sign due to staff standing infront of it, a bill for $50 for parking was slipped under our room door. The next morning both my fiance and I awoke with spots/bites all over us. We assume it is from bed bugs in the room as we even have spots/bites on parts of our body that were covered by clothes when we were out at the function and at no point during the evening did either of us notice any mozzies about. I did send an email to the hotel notifying them of the spots and the chips, however, I did not even recieve an acknowledgement or reply of my email and I did include my contact number on the email. All in all, yes I would stay there again for a maximum of 1 night IF I could not get accommodation at my usual hotel (Bayview Boulevard), however I would leave my car in a Wilsons Car park close by and save the $50 parking fee. Would not return there as a first choice of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, old, smelly, late night accidental phone calls, yet very quiet and good location!”
Reviews.Author: Treska-n-Dave
Reviews.Content: We booked our night on wotif, for the nice price of $149 for a Saturday night! We checked in at 1:30, an checkin service wa great. Our room was on the 12/1st floor an unbeknownst to us, it was a smoking floor. I was unaware hotels I this class had smoking floors - but low and behold!! The room didn't smell so bad, but the corridor was awful! The room was rathe dirty, sprays of black spill down the wall and the lampshades were mouldy and foul. We had a bath and deprecate shower, which was good- but hot water was a little cold! Reception also accidentally called at 2am, which wasn't muh fun, but it was an accident! Overall, not a great stay, but oh we'll!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel at reasonable prices”
Reviews.Author: rc28
Reviews.Content: This was a good mid range hotel with comfortable bedding and clean rooms. The rooms are quite spacious with some cable TV channels available. The executive room I stayed in had the picture missing off the wall, and house keeping left a tray of sugar in the hallway for 3 days before someone collected it. Staff are friendly and most are reasonably helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: chlobo2
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for only 3 nights, but I wouldn't stay anywhere else in Sydney! It's located in a great spot right near shops and entertainment precincts! The room was fantastic very spacious and cosy, not to mention the dream bed which makes for the best sleep! I was upgraded to free breakfast which made my stay perfect because the restaurant at the rydges is really good and affordable! The hotel lobby is amazing and the views from my room looked out over the streets of Sydney! I'm looking forward to my stay here again in the new year!

Reviews.Title: “Worst stay ever!”
Reviews.Author: hollywoodChicago
Reviews.Content: This is probably one of the worst hotels we have stayed in. Customer service is zero. Upon check in I asked the desk the fastest way to get to Circular Quay, and after looking at my map he said "just walk". This is at least a 30 minute brisk walk. On our own we figured out the transportation. There is even a free bus that runs during the day. The staff were clueless in recommending restaurants. locations of major sights and where to buy certain items. I asked for a quiet room on a high floor. We most likely got the noisiest room in the hotel on a low floor. Their floor numbering is deceiving. It starts at 10, when in actuality this is the first floor. If you get a room on Pitt St it is directly across the street from a night club that stays open on the weekend until 2:30AM. People were screaming and hanging out the windows and the music was so loud it shook the windows. When I called the desk at 12:30AM to see if we could change roooms his reply was "you can come down for some earplugs!". This hotel caters to airline personnel and I'm sure they are placed in a quiet section, if there is one. The self laundry has a dryer that isn't vented, so your clothers never get dried and the whole room is wet from the steam. Sydney is a beautiful city and there are many good hotels. If you want to enjoy yourself and get a restful nights sleep, I would advise not staying at the Rydges.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Mary P
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Rydges World Square Hotel and we found it very clean the room and bathroom were a nice size, but I really recommend the beds, the king bed was so comfortable as were the pillows. It is very central to all the shops and just a short walk from the chinese gardens, cockle bay and Darling Harbour. I f you don't mind a longer walk, you can go down to the Rocks and Circular Quay also the Sydney Opera house and Sydney Harbour Bridge, it is quite a long walk but a pleasant walk. Also the best part there is a very nice cafe around the corner called Mama Rosa's the breakfast was delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: katsui
Reviews.Content: Got a higher room on a non-smoking level Only stayed overnight Everything you expect in a basic hotel No complaints

Reviews.Title: “Tired rooms, with some excellent front office staff”
Reviews.Author: Jesterinoz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 night in November. I arrived about midday and the room wasn't ready which was fair enough. After returning about 1.30pm the very well presented front desk staff offered a smoking room if I wanted that straight away if I wanted. I have stayed at this hotel a few times in the past and my impression is that the rooms are becoming awfully tired, if not grubby. The carpets in the hallways and rooms looked grubby. The rooms looked tired.... It definately wasn't the place I remembered. $50 a day for parking seems exhorbitant but I supposed that is Sydney these days. I would stay elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location - Very Average Service !”
Reviews.Author: ankit236
Reviews.Content: Concierge guys were great and they knew pretty much everything about Sydney, but breakfast and service was just about average. Location of the hotel is excellent - bang in the middle of the city and most places are around !

Reviews.Title: “Terrible, tired and dirty room ...Rydges Priority Club Guest !!”
Reviews.Author: John B
Reviews.Content: We paid AU$1150- for a room for four nights that had mold in the bathroom and shower, traces of blood on the tiles, cracked tiles, food fragments in the mouth- piece of the telephone. ..... This Not acceptable at any hotel. Don't stay here! The room was tired and dingy with no views, House keeping forgot to restock the coffee and milk. I am pleased we joined up as ' Rydges Priority Guests Club members' , I dread to think what the other guests received. Its not strictly true to say that Priority Guests get 20% discount off food. We were refused this point blank by the hotel staff. We were told it does not apply to breakfast or room service food. I guess this 'Priority Guest' 'marketing tool' has some small print, however both room service and breakfast were most defiantly consisted of 'Food' , ...we were made paid full price! Coutage ...excellent and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “More like 3 star than 4.5”
Reviews.Author: Lucas B
Reviews.Content: I travel extensively for business and this hotel is a cracker. First room: The bathroon sink was so cracked, it had about 6 cracks from drain to top of rim and they were black with grime. no mini bar price list. The Air conditioning wasnt working(about 32C in a sealed room) and after two phone calls about it, I was getting avoidance tactics. Being transferred and the phone just ringing out. In the end I had to go to reception and emand something be done After much perseverance it was explained that they were not prepared to have someone out on a Sunday to fix it. I was moved to another hot room but it has a little window i could open, but of course the city noise makes it impossible to sleep. Second room: I ws upgraded to the "executive club" Gees I wouldnt want to be payng for this! Toilet did not stop running. TV was turned off at wall and I had to pull out cupboard with fridge inside to find power points to turn the power on. Fridge was noisy and the bathrrom plug was black and mouldy. Everytime I showered the shower recess door would not lock closed, therfore water would flow across the floor of the bathroom. The next day, this was just icing on the cake: A reakfast tray on the floor in the corridor at room opposte stayed there until 8pm the next night. A vacuum was left in the middle of the corridore overnight. housekeeping had apprently cleaned my room, on return to the room i found: a towel drapped over toilet seat. new towels not folded just thrown on rack. ironing board and iron not put away, but laying over against desk with the iron on floor with the water all over carpet. no glasses or crockery cleaned at all, stll in same spot I left them, even with tea bags in them. no mini bar replenished. but bed made! phew something! Concierge brilliant, reception a nightmare as kept blaming conceirge for the issues with the air conditioning. Also no directions on arrival, eg how to use lifts, as this was a night mare as the sign says use card as shown, but there is no "shown" image and any of the lifts. no explantion about breakfast breakfast staff do nothing. you have to go to them behind counter. no one approaches or offers anything. they simply dont care. Its expenses and not very nice. Day after day the same thing, and compared to other 4.5 star and even 4 star, not much variety on offer. Just in front in Liverpool is a very nice, fast, efficent, very friendly, and inexpensive breakfast cafe. gym rules stat you must use towels supplied. I arrive around 6pm over 5 days, and there was not a towel to be seen. One day there wee lots f used ones overflowing out of the bin onto the floor. But this was just one day. Oh and the floor numbers are numbered 12 to 21. But they are actually 1 to 9. Would not recommend this hotel to anyone, everything is a con

Reviews.Title: “A dreadful hotel in a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: Phil M
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here. Prices are ludicrous -$300 for a room, then $50 to park the car, then a restaurant that overcharges. Gridlock around the hotel, poor valet staff... It just goes on. And the room. Dingy, cramped with no views or amenities.... Go to bondi, coogee, watsons bay ...do not go to the "world square'

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: JACKIE J
Reviews.Content: World Square hotel is in a brilliant location, so easy to get anywhere from there. The rooms are great and the staff look after you very well. They will assist with anything you want and nothing is a bother. Very highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “More 3.5 than 4.5 star”
Reviews.Author: Bebej1976
Reviews.Content: Very average hotel. Think the rating is definitely not 4.5*. More 3.5*. Good location, ten minutes walk from either Central Railway station or Town Hall station. Nice public areas. The rooms are very basic. My room was also quite dark as the window literally had a view of the back of another building. Un-impressed with the breakfast. Its not cheap and the offering are very limited. No eggs made to order, not even any cold cuts of meats and cheeses. Staff very friendly though. I'd only recommend this hotel if you manage to get a very good rate as it doesnt compare in standard with other 4.5*/5* hotels i've stayed at in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Good location & family friendly service”
Reviews.Author: LVL S
Reviews.Content: Our family chose to stay at Rydges World Square several times due to its convenient location, competitive rates and friendly staff. The rooms, service and atmosphere at the hotel are great, we have never had an uncomfortable night's stay at this hotel. The large foyer on the first floor provides easy access to reception, dining and lounge areas, perfect for families with small kids who need space to move about and been seen. The food and beverages are first class.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location - Lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: Mariana896
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at World Square a number of times because of its convenient location and brilliant staff. During each of my stays the staff have always been courteous and helpful. Excellent customer service from reception right through to housekeeping, nothing was ever an inconvenience, whether arranging a taxi to assisting with reservations and helping with theatre tickets. Fabulous, will keep coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel for families!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kim_Y66
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Rydges with our 2 children over the weekend. The room was big and the kids had lots of room to play. As a mum of young children I liked to have both a bath and a shower in the bathroom. We also liked to have a television in each room. The beds were the best I have ever slept in, and the room was quiet. Easy access in and out of the hotel with the pram, high chairs are available in the restaurant and kids are welcome for dinner! If you are going to watch a show at Capitol Theatre like we did, this is the best location. Also the Aquarium, Wildlife Park and Imax are close by! The staff was very helpful and we felt very well looked after. Great family Weekend, Thank You Rydges!

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service, Smelly rooms, zero care factor - a disgrace”
Reviews.Author: Meadow013
Reviews.Content: I have had the misfortune of staying here on business twice recently as I was unable to get into my normal hotel. The 1st stay was for 3 nights and I was put on a smoking floor, which I did not request. The place absolutely stunk and the smell permeated all my clothes. On my subsequent stay for a single night, the again tried to put me in a smoking room and said that as there was a balcony that the smell would not be an issue. I explained that this was exactly the same type of room as my previous stay and was unacceptable. I was forced to wait another 11/2 hours for another room to free up (an air crew was leaving), so could not check into my room until 8:30pm. The front desk staff could not give a damn. No apologies, no empathy and definately NO SERVICE. This hotel is a disgrace

Reviews.Title: “Great stay !”
Reviews.Author: hon12
Reviews.Content: Quick check-in, friendly staff, good central location. Rooms were very clean and quiet. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable bed, quiet rooms”
Reviews.Author: Tofu769
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 7 nights. Pros : Very comfortable beds, overall quiet room, responsive and friendly staff. Not far from Museum station which is along the airport train line. F&B outlets everywhere around the hotel vicinity. Cons : No wifi in room (Frankly its easy and cheap to get a pre paid mobile broadband in Sydney even for overseas vistors). 1.5% surchage for using credit card, 3% for AMEX! (was told this is not unusual in Sydney?)

Reviews.Title: “Average At Best”
Reviews.Author: StillPhone
Reviews.Content: There's really little to say about this hotel which is good... Breakfast was included on my package unless you wanted coffee at $5 or an omelet at $8. That's a bit of a joke. Then there's a fee for using a credit card! The room which looked like it was on the 13th floor was actually on the 1st floor. It was non-smoking but stank of smoke and was very noisy. The chap that runs the breakfast area is great but the rest of the place sucks frankly... There are much better hotels in Sydney and I wouldn't stay here again...

Reviews.Title: “Where's the WiFi? Under my squishy bed?”
Reviews.Author: spicezoe
Reviews.Content: Find it a bit unbelievable that a business hotel like the Rydges doesn't have WiFi in the hotel rooms - I was travelling with an iPad so there was no way to make that work in the room. Lobby WiFI is available at $5 for half an hour. Not a happy guest. The bed was way too soft for my comfort, marshmallow-like and the one closest to the door was even more squishy. Decor and cleanliness was all fine, bathroom/toiletries also fine. The hairdryer is fixed on the wall, which generally means a crappy performance, and this case, that was true. Location is great - right above a shopping centre with supermarket and only a few blocks from the main shopping precinct. Also good for CBD business. Would I stay here again? Probably not, just too many variables that didn't match my standards.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: johny_vegas
Reviews.Content: We are Rydges Member and always select the â€œweb check-inâ€� option so we are usually checked in super fast. I highly recommend to anyone to become a member as you can enjoy lots of great discounts. We had dinner twice in the Sphere restaurant and the food was a fantastic surprise, not the bland hotel restaurant food you can often find. The service was exceptional, the staff looked happy and nothing was too much trouble for them. The food was fresh and cooked in the open kitchen,fabulous chefs! Also, the location of this hotel is the real star factor, itâ€™s close to everything Sydney has to offer! Can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: Pablost
Reviews.Content: Great location, price wise, the most affordable within Sydney CBD. My room was good and bed comfortable enough. All in all, I stayed only for one night and I slept great... If I travel to Sydney in the near future, I may go back to the Rydges.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: sometimetravel
Reviews.Content: Right in the middle of everything made it convenient for our weekend. Staff helpful. Air-con noisy, but effective. Good value parking and great that we could leave the car for the rest of the day after we had checked out, made enjoying the day so much easier.

Reviews.Title: “Great location right in the middle of Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Alex_Roach
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel and the location is excellent. Close to restaurants and entertainment. Rooms are really nice (we stayed in one of the king suites). Staff are also helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: starbuck69
Reviews.Content: My stay at this hotel was for a business trip. The room was a comfortable size and the king size bed was a bonus. The hotel is located down near Chinatown and was surrounded by a pretty ordinary neighbourhood. While the bed was comfortable I don't think I would stay at this hotel for a personal trip. Certainly for a business trip it was convenient and comfortable enough.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located comfortable but over priced”
Reviews.Author: themurgs4
Reviews.Content: Paid for upgrade which used to include breakfast and some free drinks between 6pm and 730pm. All these features have been removed with no discount on price. The bed was huge and very comfortable and the room was clean and tidy. We had booked this room 2 months in advance but when we got there at 4pm we were told the room wasn't ready. They gave a a drink voucher each and we had to wait an hour in the bar till the room was ready. Great for a bussiness trip as you are in the heart of the town but I wouldn't take the family

Reviews.Title: “Rydges - to be avoided”
Reviews.Author: Minogue50
Reviews.Content: This is a shabby hotel with abysmal internet connectivity that is charged at $22 dollar a day ! To add insult to injury when I swapped my wife's laptop to the same cable and it needs a second $22 for the same time interval. So while you're waiting an eternity for web pages to load your second paid connection sits idle and unusable. There was litter around the hallways which stayed on view over 24 hours. The breakfast which we tried on the first morning provided the most vile cup of coffee it has been my experience to taste.

Reviews.Title: “Really dissapointing....couldn't wait to leave!”
Reviews.Author: uktraveltips
Reviews.Content: Although setting themselves as a top end hotel we didnâ€™t get that luxurious feel during our stay. World Square is central but is a rather run down neighborhood making it feel a little unsafe at night, they even lock the doors after a certain time and you have to remember some code to get in, which makes it feel more like a hostel or prison! The rooms felt more like a standard motel, basic and sparse but with a very rundown bathroom which through its age felt dirty. The hotel could have been anywhere, no views and dark. The staff were unfriendly, unhelpful bordering on rude and just didnâ€™t make you feel welcome, there were no redeeming features really, no special touches, you even have to pay quite a lot for wired internet. In our view it was at best a three star hotel and we wonâ€™t be going back there.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located in the heart of Sydneys Chinatown action”
Reviews.Author: shound1030
Reviews.Content: Well run large hotel great location. House bar is good Lots of great asian food is all nearby

Reviews.Title: “Not the best”
Reviews.Author: Thomas J
Reviews.Content: The gym is advertised as modern, Its actually filthy and the equipment is from the dark ages. Rooms need updating. Upolstry is dirty. Beds were comfy and shower in bathroom is good. The internet is very expensive and very very slow. The cost of breakfast is very over priced for what it was. Staff were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Mary W
Reviews.Content: Me and my fiancÃ© visited Sydney for our 1 year wedding anniversary for a week. The location of the hotel is superb. You are next to the bustling Pitt St, two minutes from Hyde Park, ten minutes walk from Darling Harbour. Lovely room, spacious and very clean. Staff in all areas of the Hotel were pleasant and very helpful. We will definitely come back and recommend Rydges World Square to our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but we wont be coming back”
Reviews.Author: Coral C
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Sydney by train in the evening and wanted some where close to Central station and the CBD which ths hotel certainly was. No problems with the location. However we were given a smokers room (didn't know they still existed). Although the room didn't really smell you did notice it in the bed. I also didn't know you could have 'roll together' in a king size bed! But you can, this was the most uncomfortable bed I've slept in in a while. The room was average sized and clean but when serviced no one checked the tea or coffee so thast never got replaced. Also unless you want a white knuckle ride to the airport DONT book the airport shuttle advertised at the hotel, not sure of the name but it cost $14. The driver appeared to be a race driver wanna be. He anticipated the light changing so much, we were over the intersection before before the lights turned green, he travelled centimetres from the car in front and honked if that driver wasn't also centimetres from the car he was behind. We constantly changed lanes into minimal gaps and at one set of lights we barely stopped in time. I'm sure the pedestrian's crossing in front of us also had doubts about surviving the day. My thoughts were that at least our holiday was over and we had insurance! Although the hotel was convenient and not that bad, we'll be trying somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad location but not great rooms”
Reviews.Author: tulsau
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not one of my favorites. The rooms needed updating as did the lobby. The location was within walking distance to the wharf area which was nice but other than that nothing spectacular. I would not stay here again and would look for something nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Booked a queen, upgraded for free to a suite!”
Reviews.Author: Mi33-Review
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in August for my 25th Birthday with my partner. We booked a queen room on the Rydges website and scored 20% discount on both nights. We arrived at the hotel around 3pm I lined up and was told by the lovely young woman at the desk that we had been upgraded to a suite for 2 nights but the room wasn't inspected so we patiently waited it only took 5 minutes and she brought the key over to us. And told us to enjoy, we made our way up to the room on level 15 room 51 Was lovely and very spacious. Lounge area with television, plenty of seating and huge window overlooking world square shops and restaurants etc. Bathroom was a big enough boosting a separate shower and bath, basin with plenty of space And the bedroom was great large king size bed, television, desk, telephone, internet, storage and bed side tables with lamps plus another large window - both with opening windows. The curtains by far kept majority of the light out which was great and sometimes very hard to find in hotels. Shower door is a little small I'm a bigger woman and had to squeeze through the opening, there was plenty if room to make the shower more square then the shape it is now, also the amount you pay for the Internet isn't really worth it as the internet is and can be very slow especially when your using your webcam. Other then that - we enjoyed our stay at Rydges and will defiantly stat here again sometime soon. Check-out was a breeze, yet again lovely staff. For that extra added room book a suite. I'm a priority member which entitles me to discounts on Internet and late check out of 1pm and more it's worth signing up for free. Check it out

Reviews.Title: “At this hotel, expect staff to walk in to your room at any time”
Reviews.Author: L F
Reviews.Content: I chose to stay here for my birthday as it is in a great location. The room was fine. However, staying for 2 nights paying approximately $500 for a standard room, I was not impressed at how many interuptions that we had during our stay, even though we had our 'Do not Disturb' sign on our door throughout our whole stay. The first night we woke up at 8am in the morning to banging on our wall. We reported it to reception after 30 mins. The noise continued. We called a second time and finally it had stopped after another 30 mins. I believe it was maintenance. The day of check out we asked for a late check out at $75.
