At about 12:30pm I hear a knock on the door, someone saying 'housekeeping' and then entering my room straight away. Mind you the housekeeper who opened the door saw me butt naked as I did not get a chance to even put a towel around me. Then after about 40 mins we get another knock on the door. Thinking someone was going to come in without real warning, I ran to the door to see it was now a minibar attendant. After talking to the duty manager, they were nice enough to try and make it up to me by taking off the $75 charge, however it does not make up for our now negative memory of my brithday stay. How much more do guests have to pay for privacy these days?!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant !!”
Reviews.Author: BLKRRSPORT
Reviews.Content: Each year a group of 6 or so head off to Sydney for a long weekend of part business and part pleasure. By far this is the best Hotel we have stayed at over the last 10 years. Staff were fantastic. Rooms (get as high up as you can) very clean, great bed and bathroom. We ate in and were pleasantly surprised by the food. Bar area was well laid out with plenty of space for quiet chat or watching the game. The boys working on concierge were the best we have come across ever. Thank you for a great 3 night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Central location”
Reviews.Author: wilko87
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the CBD of Sydney close to major attractions and transport, it is about 3 blocks from Central railway station and just around the corner from The Museum underground station.We used web check-in and it was very efficient. The room was excellent with a comfortable king bed, tea making facilities (with real milk), a separate shower and large screen tv. Breakfast was average for a 4 star hotel. Checkout was good and we left our bags with the concierge whilst we explored Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: seetheworld38
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night on a business trip. Good: Room was clean and comfortable. Hotel is close to shops, restaurants and cinemas (George street). Not so good: room rates high, unnnecesary charges (bottle water at bedside $4), limited choice TV channes.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Cheap, in the Middle of Sydney. What More Could You Ask For”
Reviews.Author: AussieSteve88
Reviews.Content: Another one of my favourite hotels, I absolutely love staying here!! Been here a few times with my partner and we have always enjoyed our time. A very nice, very classy hotel, set in World Square, which is in the heart of George Street, Sydney. It is very close to the movies, Broadway, Pitt Street mall, Sydney Harbour and the Rocks, so it is very central!! The service is as you would expect at a Rydges hotel, fantastic!!!! Nothing is too hard for them and there has only been one time that I can honestly say I was disappointed with, and that was only a tiny concern, which the staff made up for straight away. For a five star hotel, it is quite cheap!! I became a Rydges priority guest (which is free) and have been able to get rooms for as cheap as $99 in the past, and free parking thrown in as well. Finally, I've never had a bad night sleep here!! The bed is incredible, the best bed I've ever slept in, and the room has big, thick blinds, which makes the room really dark and easy to sleep in. To summarise, an excellent five star hotel, which ticks all the boxes. It is central, clean, tidy, cheap and service is impeccable. Honestly can't fault Rydges and I'm looking forward to coming here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Craig B
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a fantastic week at Rydges World Square. This hotel offers a convenient location downtown. The staff is very friendly and helpful (special mention for Yui at check-in). The rooms are clean and comfy. The bathroom is huge and clean and has a separate bath. Concierge was good too...We ended up booking all of our day tours through them. We look forward to returning in the middle of December.

Reviews.Title: “A shabby, tired looking hotel”
Reviews.Author: emileeetravels
Reviews.Content: The best thing I can say about this place is the good location - very close to the Museum train stop (just 15 minutse and a few stops away from the airport), downtown and Chinatown. Unfortunately, that's probably the only good thing I can say about this place. When we showed up to the room, there was only one towel even though we had a room reserved for two. Did they expect us to share a towel? Furthermore, the hairdryer would only work for 30 seconds at a room because after that it would overheat and turn off automatically. The room itself was worn and old. I always say, it's a bad sign when a hotel is sold off to new management. Hotels are usually sold off because they're too old and worn to properly represent the original brand.

Reviews.Title: “Standards have fallen but prices have gone up”
Reviews.Author: paueaus
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel about 20 times in the past two years due to its convenient location to my work. However I believe that I had paid my last visit. The executive lounge has been closed and the bar prices are exorbitant. A schooner of Asahi is $9.50. The glasses in the bathroom were dirty, the couch is well past its use by date and worst of all I had to keep stepping over the dinner tray left outside the neighbouring room for 5 hours. The room cost $300 per night so you'd expect it to be clean. The whole place looks very tired. Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “A little tired, but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Swamp_Donkey66
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Rydges for 2 nights for a residential course. Initial impression is nice enough, with the foyer area looking good. My room was on the 13th floor, which I discovered was a smoking floor despite a non-smoking request. (rooms only start at 12th floor) Views were pretty much non-existent, with taller buildings surrounding me. The rooms are a little on the tired side, everything is functional but the bathroom is a bit dated. Bed was comfortable enough but I wasn't a fan of the pillows. TV selection was about average with a few Foxtel channels. For me the Gym at a hotel is a big factor, and the Rydges one was pretty basic. A couple of old treadmills, bikes and some weights. There was enough to get a workout done but there are much better in the CBD (The Grace and Intercontinental for example) Food was OK, the coffee was on the weak side, so go for a double shot and we had a buffet dinner which was quite nice if reasonably limited in selection. Location is pretty good, with World Square shops and cafes immediately below the hotel. The Thai place directly below the hotel is reasonably priced, quick and excellent! (I forget what it's called) Conference facilities weren't bad, and the staff were very responsive when requesting priniting, power cords, water top ups etc. All in all, I wouldn't hurry back to the Rydges World Square, but if I was booked there by my company again it wouldn't be the end of the world.

Reviews.Title: “Superior comfort of beds and pillows!”
Reviews.Author: wencal_11
Reviews.Content: We appreciated the friendly, efficient service of all the staff and the high standard of comfort and facilities in our room. The room was quiet and the Dream mattress was exceptional for comfort. The Sphere Restaurant had a lovely ambience and a delicious menu. We enjoyed our stay and highly recommend Rydges.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: __hellyes
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through a mystery deal on wotif for my boyfriends birthday, about $140. We were upgraded to a king 1 bedroom suite, which was amazing for the price we paid! I was hoping for an upgrade from standard to deluxe king or similar, but all the way to suite! Service was great, concierge very helpful and friendly. Suite was humongous, with the bedroom being the size of a standard Sydney hotel room, seperate loungeroom with lounge and 2 single chairs and a bay window overlooking the inside of World Square. Room service looked reasonably priced in line with other similarly rates hotels. The bed was really fantastic, so comfortable. And the curtains were really good blackout ones, something which I value in a hotel! The location is the big winner, smack bang in the middle of World Square with a Coles downstairs, lots of restauarants and bars just metres from the door and only a few minutes walk to Oxford st, Pitt St Westfield and Darling Harbour. Slight issue with the cleanliness of the bathroom, there were what appeared to be blood splatters and a smear near the mirror...

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, friendly”
Reviews.Author: andymitcho
Reviews.Content: I stay here quite frequently, the rooms are always clean and fresh and the beds are very comfortable. The service from staff has been hit and miss in the past, however this time and my previous visit has seen this improve. This visit the staff were very friendly and helpful. Glad to see things always improving!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value but a few quirks...”
Reviews.Author: Islanda
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through the Rydges website and got an amazing deal for two nights accommodation. First impressions were interesting... now, this is going to sound VERY petty, but the reception staff did not look well presented (i.e. messy hair/clothes). This certainly isn't a deal breaker, but it just didn't create a good first impression. We had booked about a month in advance and had requested rooms side by side, so I was slightly annoyed that our rooms were allocated on completely separate floors (especially since we are Rydges members). However, we did get complimentary cot hire which was nice. I got the shock of my life entering the room to find a man standing there! At first I thought we had walked into the wrong room, but it turned out to be the housekeeper setting up the cot. Again, not a deal breaker but a bit strange! Overall we found the room to very well presented. The room was very clean upon check in, but the mid-stay clean was not that thorough (toilet still had paper in it so clearly had not been attended to). For the location of the hotel, the price was far below similar hotels in the area so it was good value. Overall, we were happy with our stay, and I think with a bit more attention to detail this place could be amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location near city center, views from the inside the room were terrible”
Reviews.Author: Sannydy
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel location, walking distance to shopping centers and 24 hour convenience stores, very near victoria station shopping center and the very big Apple store. Service is ok and the rooms are nice but the view from inside the room are terrible, i can only see the inside square of the hotel, cannot see anything outside. Breakfast is quite good and the rooms and amenities are quite complete. Nice hotel up to par to it's star rating and am quite happy with it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in the CBD”
Reviews.Author: Mi33-Review
Reviews.Content: Stayed in June with my partner. We booked a deluxe king room on www.Rydges.com.au I'm a member it's free to join and you get a lot of really good discounts. It's well worth it, check-in staff where very uplifting, smiled and wish us a lovely stay even know it was only for a night. Our room was lovely, the dream bed was so soft and lovely, felt like we were floating on a cloud! The room had a mini-bar, LCD, plenty of lighting, a wardrobe, opening windows, curtains that were good and kept majority of the light out of the room, air-con/heating, cardboard had - extra pillows, in-room safe and bathrobes. Bathroom - shower (that was large enough to fit both my partner and I in), bathtub big enough for 2, toilet and basin plus plenty of room to put things on and around it. The view was a building wall, but we didn't pay for a view of any sort, so it didn't really bother us too much. The room Also had a small table and 2 chairs, working desk - with phone and Internet cable. We ordered room service it took roughly 45mins but arrived a tad earlier which was great as my partner and I were starving. Ceaser salad and potato wedgies with sour cream and chilli both great meals, big proportions and cheap prices. Overall it was great. Would stay here again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Poppies99
Reviews.Content: There's no complaint about the location of this hotel. It is in Sydney CBD and a short walk to most attraction in the city. We stayed in an executive room which is on higher floor so street noise is not a problem. The bed is very comfortable and room seemed to be clean. As a member, late check-out is always automatically arranged without request. Decent continental breakfast.The only problem with the hotel is the issue with parking. If you drive your car there but there's only about 2 spaces of parking in front of the hotel which is often taken up by tour bus, you can't really park to check in. One time, we had to drive around the block around 5 times and rang the hotel but they kept telling us "You just have to find parking" ...ugh..Sydney CBD is not really the easiest place to find parking!

Reviews.Title: “A mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: MissAnd123
Reviews.Content: Accommodation in Sydney is expensive. So when we had to make an overnight trip to Australia's biggest city and couldn't arrange to stay with friends, we picked a Wotif 'mystery deal'. It delivered Rydges, and at AU$159 about half the price of the hotel's own website 'hot price' of $299. So far, so good. The hotel describes itself as "Luxury accommodation in Sydney city", and is rated at 4.5 stars. The location really is central - a short walk from great food at Chinatown in one direction, and and the shopping area of Pitt St Mall and QVB in the other. World Square is a shopping mall itself. Tourists can hop on a train at Town Hall Station below the hotel and ride around to Circular Quay for the Opera House and Harbour Bridge in just a few minutes. The 'luxury' bit is open to interpretation. Parts of the decor are very tired - the many decorative photos on the 18th floor are all badly faded. Room fittings and bathroom are all functional and very clean, but getting old. Shower and bath are separate which is great, but the water is barely hot enough for a bath. The TV was an old flat screen carrying just a Sky News feed with no access to the many digital free-to-air channels eg. ABC News 24 - a frustrating gap on a weekend when three big world news stories broke. No wifi in the rooms. The beds were very comfortable, a definite plus. One real disappointment - we had booked a king sized non-smoking room, but when we arrived the only non-smoking room was a twin room, which wasn't quite what we wanted. Some of the rooms should have an interesting street view, but ours looked out onto another building; good thing we weren't tourists looking for a one-off 'Sydney experience' with view. It was a nice room - but hard to see the value if paying $299 or more. While it might tick the 4.5 star boxes there isn't a 4.5 star feel about the place. What makes accommodation in Australia particularly expensive is the tendency to charge extra for everything. $49 a night for parking! $5 an hour for wifi, in the lobby only! The standard brand bottled water, conveniently located by the bedside, $4! You could go downstairs to the supermarket directly below the hotel and buy the water for a quarter of the price, except that Australian tap water is exactly the same and free. Verdict: okay, if you can get a discount deal. If driving, consider parking elsewhere. Tip: We made the mistake of arriving at about 6pm. Don't do it. Chaos: there were 7 kinds of idiot queued 3 deep at the check-in counter - probably all on cheap deals like us, I'll admit - all loudly demanding impossible things or being ridiculously difficult. The poor staff were polite but clearly frazzled. The guests did not make this a 4.5 star experience.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service Resturant & Bar”
Reviews.Author: jLSunshine2011
Reviews.Content: On Saturday night my family and I were attending Mary Poppins at the Capitol Theatre - in search for dinner that wasn't Asian inspired we found ourselves at Square Restaurant in the Rydges Hotel. The time was 5:55pm we approached the restaurant and asked if we could have dinner - the waiter said - Yes, but come back in 5 minutes dinner does not start till 6pm (5 minutes to wait). To look at the restaurant it was fully set it is open plan so no walls from the lobby area - but don't step on the carpet for another 5 minutes! We first asked if we could sit in the restaurant and have a drink - No its closed! then we asked if we can have a drink two steps outside the restaurant in the "lobby"; the answer is yes you can sit in the lobby and wait - there were four of us and all the tables in the lobby were set up for 2 people only; I go to move the chair and the waiter said please don't - so there was an expectation that we sit separately. I then asked if we could move chairs that weren't in the walk way - he said yes but was obviously not happy - So now we were sitting next to the toilets - nice!. When taking our order I asked for a bar food menu he suggested nuts we said no we want something more substantial with our drinks. He then brought out a bar menu and a restaurant menu and tossed them on the table and walked away. To order I went up to the restaurant to ask if I could order and they said No you need to go into the bar. Ok! So I go into the bar then someone tells me you can't eat food in the lobby you need to come into the bar - but they drinks you purchased had to drunk in the lobby first (they are form the restaurant...hold on isn't the restaurant closed?). I then asked "Well why give me a menu and not tell me that in the first place" he responded "Lady! (yes he called me lady whilst putting a stop hand up to my face) Calm down you asked for it so I gave it, you got what you wanted" By this stage I was so frustrated I dropped the menu (which was hard plastic so it made quite a sound) and informed him that his service had been terrible; he informed me he didn't care. When asking for his name "Sam" happily gave it to me and had a giggle about the whole situation. On way back to the lobby to finish my drink - I realised it was after 6 & people were sitting in the restaurant, yet not one employee came to inform my group it was now open they left us sitting by the toilet! Once in the restaurant even though it was quite expensive for the food you were served (I expected this we did decide to eat in a hotel restaurant, so no big deal) the young man that served us (dark brown/red hair fringe swept to the side) was very pleasant - did he anticipate our needs "no" - how do I know what the ice well food is? An explanation of the menu would've been nice; but when asked he was helpful and accommodating, and his table service was great - thankyou! Howeverâ€¦(even with such a positive service experience you are still taintedâ€¦) When being shoved in a corner and treated like a second class citizen you notice things - like lip stick marks on the glasses, all the newspapers thrown around and not tidied up, coffee cups that had been on table so long the liquid had gone hard in the bottom, chairs with stains and not lined up; finally our meals (3 steaks and a rack of lamb took over an 55 minutes to come out - only 9 other people in the restaurant) Plus not once did you see a manager or a staff member walk through or in our case someone to come and see if we were ok- after the situation we had been through. I know I can seem harsh with a service review - but seriously this one team member set the tone for the entire night - I have told anyone that will listen about the service and how we were treated and how everything was just to hard. Rydges World Square I want to apologise to you for being an inconvenience on your Saturday night.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: dynami
Reviews.Content: Somewhat disappointing experience to be had at this hotel - after my flight arrived I called the hotel to ascertain whether I could check in prior to the 2pm advised time and was told that some rooms were available. Despite this, once I arrived 40 minutes later I was told that this was not the case but could store bags until it was ready. While this did not overly affect my plans (I had originally planned to leave bags with concierge, anticipating that I could check in at 2pm) it was frustrating that this had apparently changed in such a short space of time. If for some reason I had made a dedicated trip to the hotel early believing I could check in a few hours early, and was told upon arrival that I couldn't, I would have been much more annoyed at being misinformed. Upon checking in a few hours later I unpacked (mistake - check basic amenities first!) and found a couple of issues - the window wouldn't close which was frustrating from a draught and noise perspective, and the shower would keep turning itself off due to a problem with the tap. However the room itself was nice enough and of decent size for one or two people to stay in, and I've certainly stayed in worse. Good: - Location is the key selling point here, and if you won't spend a heap of time in your room it's probably one of the best options. - The beds - one of the more comfortable options I've had to use. - When I eventually did check in, the process was quick and easy, with the front desk staff being quite helpful Bad: - Bathroom looks a little dated and had issues with the facilities. Could use an update. - Fitness centre barely qualifies, with a few machines that quite frankly are not enjoyable to use. Any more than two or three other travellers in there, and you have issues with waiting to use machines. While sharing is caring, it can double your workout time. Avoid. - Food seemed expensive and you can probably get better quality and cost in any dedicated restaurants within a few minutes walk. - My TV had one or two issues and had to reboot itself a few times - but not a big issue. - There was some rubbish left under one of the beds so I did question what else it was that they had not cleaned thoroughly... While I would consider staying here for a basic trip again, I would certainly look around for other hotels in suitable locations at similar prices and give them a try first, as for the cost I feel like this should provide a better offering.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible, do not go there.”
Reviews.Author: dominikPerth
Reviews.Content: I expected a nice clean apartment, but it wasn't. I dropped something under the bed, so I put my hand underneath and as I pulled it out my hand was covered with dust. Then I went to the bathroom to wash my hand and I could hear the toilet flush from the room over ours. we also expected a city view of sydney, but instead we faced the other side of the u shaped building. On one of the nights the false alarm woke us up at 3am. They then had some technicians replace our tv system and suddenly our camera charger went missing. After we reported it missing, our report was ignored. Oyeah and the wifi is expensive, the minibar drinks and foods are expensive and the tv movies are expensive.

Reviews.Title: “No sleep for the business traveller”
Reviews.Author: MCHK01
Reviews.Content: After an OK checkin experience, I called reception at 11pm to request a late check out and a 5am wake up call for work. All good and a polite member of staff said "no problem at all sir and good night". I then go to sleep. At 1145pm, the phone in my room rings waking me. It's the night duty manager now telling me I can't have the same time for late check out. I ask him if he realises he has just woken me up and he proceeds to tell me I had requested a call back. Fuming, I explain the situation and he decides to try and keep me on the line to press home his point rather than apologising. I have to say that this is by far the worst customer service experience I have had in the whole of AsiaPacific over the last 2 years.

Reviews.Title: “Quality for money”
Reviews.Author: JPDH2
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and comparing the rates with the other same areas 4-star hotels you can really call this as a cheap one. Rooms were nice and the breakfast was great, also for those who suffered allergies. The location was excellent, partly because the monorail line passed by the neighborhood of the hotel and the shopping mall where the hotel was. The service was, accepting one person in the breakfast room, absolutely terrible, but if you don't need any additional room services that is not a big problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great position but not great hotel”
Reviews.Author: BigH61
Reviews.Content: Long wait at check in, terrible room which was not what I booked for. Complained and got upgraded to a family room, which was also very ordinary. I very small room, 4 beds and one bathroom for four business women, you can imagine. Some upgrade! Breakfast not good and the waiter gave me back my dirty knife to use with my hot breakfast. waited 15 minutes for our tea's and coffee's and asked no less than three times for them. Not very impressed & felt terrible as I was the one who recommended this hotel. Stayed for two LONG nights. $550 per night. Don't care if it was Sydney, I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location though plain rooms”
Reviews.Author: MRyanPhotography
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in World Square, in the heart of the CBD. The room was not ready at 1415 when we went to check in, check in being 1400. Although the staff gave us two free drink vouchers for the in house bar, but it was only for basic spirits, beer and house wine. We had the Superior Double Double Room, we were lead to believe we were getting a two double beds in separate rooms with an en suite .... rather it was two double beds within the one room. The website claimed to have "inhouse movies and free cable channels" yet the only free cable channels were History and two news channels and you had to pay for the in house movies. The room was quite plain, yet the bed was very comfortable! The shower head was amazing! Overall I don't think it was worth the $300 for the night (at half the normal rate!)

Reviews.Title: “appaulingly slow internet !”
Reviews.Author: richard1234554321
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel and nice staff ... but the internet speed is diabolical .. .it might be fine if you just want to write a couple of emails but any serious business internet use is a nightmare. At 4am in the morning (ie when all the other guests are presumably asleep) I went to speedtest.net website which measured the internet speed at 1/2 a megabit per second. Ande they charged me AUD 130 for 6 days for it - cheek !

Reviews.Title: “Clean & comfortable”
Reviews.Author: SurfingGiraffe
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights on business in June. Checkin staff were friendly and helpful and the room was clean and tidy albeit a little dated. Location wise the hotel is close to Chinatown so there are plenty of options for dining and entertainment. Overall a good hotel delivering the service and standard you would expect for the price bracket and location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a good price”
Reviews.Author: happyworldtraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two weeks and loved the location. Initially, we booked for only a couple of days and were going to switch to another hotel if a deal came up elsewhere, but we couldn't find a better location for the price. Although a bit futher from the Opera house, it's about a 5 minute bus ride. The free bus rides along George St (it's the green bus numbered 555). The hotel staff were very friendly...the lobby is updated, but they could use a bit of updating in the washrooms. Would stay here again if the price is still reasonable!

Reviews.Title: “very central, good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: had-asim
Reviews.Content: We stayed there just before Christmas and enjoyed it a lot. The rooms are specious and clean. The location is very central and a bit busy at times. The restaurant menu has not many options but the food is at a good quality. As priority members we took the breakfast plus snacks and drinks before dinner package. It was great. We always enjoy staying at the ridges and this time it wasnâ€™t different. We look forward to our next stay at the ridges in QLD.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great room”
Reviews.Author: fitz11
Reviews.Content: First time staying here. Very happy with the service at reception. The concerge let me use his computer to pick seats and print my boarding pass for the plane flight home, no charge. Room was very clean, new carpet and the bed is actually a king bed !! Not 2 beds pushed together which we hate. Bed was the most comfortable I have ever slept on. Fully stocked mini bar, very reasonably priced. Shower and bath in ensuite. Mini safe in room, Coffee and tea facility. Caught the train from airport 10 min trip. 5 minute walk from Museum station to Rydges Capitol Square. Easy walk to Darling Harbour, plenty of restuarants nearbye. We were seeing a show at the Capitol Theatre which was a 8 minute walk to the theatre. We had breakfast included in our accommodation hot and cold selection, fresh fruit etc. The room was quiet, lifts were fast and efficient. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, a bit nosiy”
Reviews.Author: jdelor
Reviews.Content: Spent 1 night here for business, fantastic location in the heart of the CBD. Breakfast was brilliant & the staff were fantastic. My only complaint was that it was quite nosiy on the streets (as you would expect) but the noise wasn't filtered out effectively.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location”
Reviews.Author: Deisheri
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one week in this great hotel in December 2010. Was there for most of christmas including Christmas eve & Christmas day. Amazing location to explore location. Walking distance to Darling Harbour which is great given a lot activity happening down there esp around the festive season. Also walking distance (albeit a little longer) to the Harbour Bridge, The Rocks, Opera House & lots of other attractions too. Also near the monorail which is handy for doing a short loop around some of the sights. We had two separate bookings as we arrived earlier - which worked out well as we got a cheaper rate after first booking as you could become a Priority Guest which entitled you to cheaper room and breakfast/dinner rates. Very convenient laundry rooms available - which was brill as we were on a long trip. Staff very nice & concierges very helpful for touristy questions. Also, only a couple of meters from the Spanish qtr - with lovely tapas restaurants which opened quite late. Next to a shopping centre (with a Coles and lots of other shops) also - which was handy for stocking up the fridge in the room. Cinema, KFC, Irish & English bars all very close for the walk home after a few beers. Rooms very good size, with balcony for drying clothes or sitting on. Bathroom very clean and good size with a great shower and topped up everyday with toiletries. Ironing board and safe in room too. Didn't eat in the restaurant, as we went out most nights but was always busy - which is a good sign. Although on a very busy street - never heard a thing once we were in the room which is always good. Broadband internet connection in the room - but need to bring your laptop for the connection. Wireless available in the hotel lobby - but quite expensive to connect. Room rates were actually quite reasonable - given the central location. Register as priority guest to get the best rates. Def recommend as an excellent base to explore sydney...

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon splash out - dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: knoble070511
Reviews.Content: Whilst visiting sydney on out honeymoon, we decided to splash out a bit on hotels. After reading reviews I decided on the rydges world square. Initially the location was ideal, (right near China Town, 20 mins walk from circular quay and 10 mins walk from Darling Harbour) however the noise from the street was unbearable! We were on the 18th floor and there was so many loud exhausts, sirens and people shouting in the street that I did not get a good night sleep the whole time we were there. The staff were not attentive at all, either in the hotel or the restaurant. In fact the restaurant was the most uncomfortable meal I have ever had! All over the hotel there were posters advertising 2 courses for $35 in the restaurant. We decided to go down one night and eat there. We ordered our meal however when it came (and it took ages) it was the smallest meal I have ever seen and it did not come with sides. I complained that we should have been asked if we wanted sides with our meal and promptly ordered the sides. It was then that the meal got uncomfortable, the sides took approx 10 mins to come, in the mean time we were left with our meal on the table in front of us getting cold. The staff did not even offer to keep it warm for us or take it away, I felt as though everyone in the restaurant were looking at us and that all the staff were talking about us. Desert was nothing to write home about either and actually (even with the addition of sides) we were both left very hungry after the meal! When we came to pay, the sides were $11 each so in fact if you wanted to feel like you had been fed you needed to spend at least $46 for 2 courses. I did complain about this and the staff did remove the cost of the sides and our drinks from the bill but even still $75 still felt like a complete rip off and I couldn't get out of there quick enough! Overall, I wish we had saved a bit of our money on the hotel and gone a bit more down market with the hotel in sydney as the hotel was just a noisy room really. The write up sounds good on this hotel but unless you have got loads of money to spend on extras do not book this hotel! If I did it again I would stay in the outskirts of sydney and pay less as the public transport is fanstastic and you could be in the city centre very easily.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: bluemountainkiwi
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many Sydney CBD hotels and have to rate this the best yet. When anybody writes a criticism remember this; this place is priced somewhere between $180.00 and $200.00 a night which is excellent value considering it is right in the heart of Sydney, has lovely clean rooms with good bed, fantastic staff that are happy to help and a really good buffet breakfast. Unless you look for fault in Rydges World Square or believe you are the Sultan of Brunei this place is a perfect place to stay when in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: sventhor
Reviews.Content: Rydges World Square is a very nice hotel. No complaints about the rooms or the facilities. What I love about this hotel is the location. Very close to trains, shops, restaurants, China Town, Darling Harbour, etc. Another nice touch is that some of the rooms have balconies.

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything but far from luxury”
Reviews.Author: monkeyface09
Reviews.Content: For those who prefer to be in the hub of action, World Square is a great choice as guests are steps from cafes, restaurants, shops and even a supermarket downstairs. Exploring the rest of Sydney is also convenient from Rydges, with easy access to the downtown monorail and several train stations in the vicinity. Despite its multi-million dollar revitalization plan, the hotel still leaves much to be desired. The hallways were filled with paint fumes and faded photographs while the room itself had a broken window, a filthy air vent, and a separate shower without any room to place toiletries. Rydges may be offering a discount on internet access through their free membership program, but the process is tedious, ensuite wifi access is not available, and the room safe is also too small for standard laptops. The only luxuries to be found at this hotel were their dream beds, which thankfully lived up to expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: FamilyoffiveEssexUK
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed staying at the Rydges WS Sydney. Breakfast was excellent and th exec lounge drinks service was very good in the evening although the canapes were limited in quality. Staff were excellent and very helpful. Rooms a liitle tired but generally we felt more than happy with our accommodation. We would recommend this hotel and would definitely go back. Thank you Rydges for making our holiday positive.

Reviews.Title: “There are plenty of other hotels at this price who might actually care.”
Reviews.Author: TravellingMax
Reviews.Content: Frankly disappointing beyond belief. The location is OK, the service simply basic and uncaring. Given a smoking room, revolting but unable to change, was a poor start. It was difficult to find a fluently english-speaking staff member to complain to about the air-conditioning (rattled all week), laundry (expensive even by upmarket-hotel standards) or even getting a taxi to the airport (disinterest and eventually I hailed my own). Frankly, the staff's disinterest must reflect management, and this is a property that really needs 50,000 volts putting through it. It does well, as all Sydney hotels do, and its location close to the convention centre will assure full rooms. However, the level of institutional disinterest is beyond cynical. We may have to stay at the property for commercial reasons, but we don't need to be reminded of this at every turn.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - handy middle location to Oxford St & City”
Reviews.Author: Jonnie27
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at the Rydges during Mardi Gras. My decision to go to Sydney was last minute (the night before) and given it was Mardi Gras weekend, I was surprised to find the Rydges was one of the affordable options that was still near Oxford Street. It is about 10 minutes walk to Oxford Street, but also handy to the CBD. Room itself is very comfortable. Its not luxurious but its definitely of 4 star standard. The beds are AMAZINGLY comfortable. If you are looking for somewhere comfortable to stay that is near the city, Oxford Street etc then I highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very comfortable rooms and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Angel_star79
Reviews.Content: Staff were very helpful and welcoming. Good sized modern room with very comfortable king bed, big flat screen tv (no dvd player). Great location- monorail very close by and mall beside the hotel. No views but didn't bother me as it was to be expected located right in the city. Room was perfectly clean. A bit of street noise but didn't affect sleep quality. Room service was good- delicious food. Though surprised by additional charges there. The adjustable air con/heating was excellent. Overall a good stay and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, but few cons”
Reviews.Author: HappyHotelHopper
Reviews.Content: The bad stuff: no bath even though on every website it states every room has one checked in at night and the receptionist was a bit rude and unfriendly. the valet was good our room was adjoining and could hear everything from the next room (very unpleasant) smoking room! coffee is bad iron did not work The good stuff: clean housekeeping staff were wonderful on check out, the receptionist and valet were excellent giving 5 star service comfy bed Overall, it was good and I would return. The pros made up the negatives. just hope I get a better room next time!

Reviews.Title: “It was worth it...because it was a free Priority Guest Rewards night”
Reviews.Author: Shangel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one night....it was a free Priority Guest Rewards Night. We had our car so the first stop was at the front entrance of the hotel...my husband stayed in the car...because it is a no parking zone...and I went in to the Concierge desk...there was no one there...so I waited, waited. Eventually, four concierge staff walked around the corner...talking amongst themselves....not acknowledging my presence for at least a minute...eventually one asked, "Do you want something"...no greeting at all. The way I was treated was quite despicable...and I immediately did not want to be at this hotel. Our car was eventually taken off our hands ($45 for 24 hours parking)... Thank goodness the check in staff at reception did not have the same attitude as the concierge staff. We were welcomed and made to feel at home, check in was smooth and easy. Our room was fine, it had a balcony, separate bath and shower and it was clean and welcoming. It suited our needs perfectly. The price of the wine in the room is the cheapest I have ever seen at $14...and the price did not affect the taste at all. Overall the stay went well, I probably would not stay again however I would recommend the hotel to others....just don't take your car or use the concierge. The check out process was again smooth and easy and the gentleman who served us was very lovely. This hotel is right in the middle of everything that Sydney city is all about.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Service good at time but inconsistent and some hidden charges”
Reviews.Author: Ausmum_11
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with the location of the hotel, Staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The ironing board collapsed several times when I was first using it, however housekeeping did deliver one to us quickly when we mentioned it. When we arrived a prior guest had left a half eaten hamburger in a takeaway container in the fridge, we put this in the bin but did mention it to the reception briefly when having some room cards fixed in order to help with quality assurance, we got an immediate apology and were given some complimentary breakfasts, which was really lovely, we hadn't expected that and the breakfast food and service were impeccable. As women, it was disappointing that there was no provision for the disposal of feminine hygiene items, one of the girls I was with felt very uncomfortable putting her items into an open bin in the bathroom, even public toilets have more discretion and I hope this is something Rydges can look into. We stayed over the St Paddy's day weekend and the nightclubs/hotels are very loud and there was thumping music until the early hours of the morning each night. This isn't the hotel's fault but it is something you need to be aware of before staying there. We had used RPG points to book our stay and the surcharges were not made clear to us, ie whether the charge we were paying was per night or for the whole stay, so it was a little bit of a surprise to find out it was a per night thing and made the trip much more expensive than we had thought, but this was not necessarily the hotel's fault, but something as a consumer you would need to be more clear on. We did end up buying dinner one night at the bar, only to find out that RPG discounts didn't apply there for food, another thing I didn't feel was made clear. The food we purchased was utterly delicious, especially the hand cut chips with aioli, we enjoyed it so much that we decided to splurge and get a few serves of them delivered as room service as a treat on another night. The room service ones were $1 per serve more expensive at $8 each, so we thought that was reasonable, however when they arrived there was an additional $5 charge for the delivery. I wasn't particularly upset about the extra charge, however the quality of the food was disgusting and the polar opposite from the ones served downstairs, they were worse than what you would get in a food court and nothing like the ones we had gotten in the bar, which were crunchy and fresh and served in lovely baskets, the room service ones were soggy and thrown in a bowl. This was very disappointing as we had assumed they would be of the same quality and I assume cooked in the same kitchen. The tomato relish was also rancid/rotten. I did consider complaining about this, however I don't like having to constantly chase people to give consistent service. I think getting room service is one of those luxuries people want to experience and if done well it would be one of the highlights of a hotel stay, the girls I took were having their first ever hotel experience and so having room service at least once was something they had saved money for and sadly they probably wouldn't do it again. When we got home, I received a bill for $22 for a bottle of wine, a packet of chips and a tim tam bar. I am a teetotaller and was attending a christian women's conference where we were even given free tim tams in our conference packs. I was attending with two older teenagers who I was with at all times who had both worked in retail to pay for their own and my expenses and are extremely responsible. As we were on a budget we had gone to Coles directly under the hotel and purchased our own snacks and had such an abundance we bought two bags worth home. We were attending a conference the whole time so apart from getting ready in the morning and coming home to sleep we were not at the hotel, so I was more than a little surprised to receive a letter from the hotel some days after leaving telling us we had used the items from the minibar. This puts customers in a very difficult predicament, because even if I know for a fact that I didn't use the items and the hotel "forgives" the charge, I am made to feel as though they still suspect I am the one being deceitful and I don't like being made to feel that way. The letter states that in writing to me they are somehow better than other hotels that instantly charge you without consulting with you. To be honest this doesn't feel any different to me and if someone says you used it but doesn't end up charging you because you fight it, you don't really feel like you came out of it I feel that there should be an option to just not have anything in the minibar, we had no intention of using it and we know we didn't, but we have no way of proving that and the mere accusation of it is upsetting (even though it won't kill me to pay the money). This would definitely impact on my choice to use the hotel again and the fact that I got the letter some days after I got home has left a very sour taste in my mouth. I do feel as though there is an ability to rort this system, both by the hotel and staff, who could take things, or forget to put things in and then you pay the price. If you charged each guest an additonal $20 like this it would really add up. I will in future be asking any hotel I stay in to remove all minibar items, but I feel saddened that I have to do this and that I am made to feel as though it is my responsibility to protect my reputation against this sort of thing.

Reviews.Title: “Was ok, nothing to rave about”
Reviews.Author: MissA88
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in January, had requested early checkin but had not been advised that it would be a problem and were told upon arrival that there would be a 2 hour wait. Room was ok, exactly as pictured on the website. The staff were mostly wonderful minus a couple of guys at the reception desk who clearly discounted my partner and I due to our young age and one went so far as to roll his eyes when we stated that we had requested the early checkin. Room service was actually pretty good for dinner but the breakfast were an absolute RIP OFF! $25 for a continental breakfast that had the smallest croissants I've ever seen, cold coffee and a small travel pack of cereal. We ended up going out for brunch immediately after because we were still hungry. Internet is not free, and after agreeing to the ridiculous charge, found that the connection did not even work. It took 3 hours to have someone come to our room who tried the exact same things we did then suggested that we just tell reception it doesn't work and ask to have it removed from our bill (don't know why the staff member couldn't have done this for us at the time). The Sphere restaurant was fantastic, the waitress we had was incredibly attentive and the food was spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, very good location.”
Reviews.Author: Marcussss
Reviews.Content: First time in Sydney had choosen this hotel location is excellent, lots of shop and resturant around. china town only mintues away. Room is very comfortable, quiet and modern Staff are very friend during check in. Smile and greet, even offer help for luggage when he saw me two hand full of items. AAA+ Only downside is the cleaning of my room. Bed were made in rush, when i return to room. Bed sheet were not properly made and my leg can not go inside. Stuck in half and i need to remade the bed by myself after a long day meeting. the biscuit i drop on the corner from day 1 still there after 3 days i check out. Do they vaccum? thick dust on TV screen even can write something on it. I am very sensitive to dust, have very bad runny nose so i can feel the room very dusty. leave a message on the top of my bed if someone can change the light in bathroom as one is out, seems been ignore and put the paper back on my table..... Overall, good hotel, will recommmned for friend. But i was expected more customer care service since it is 4.5 stars?

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and Enthusiastic Staff”
Reviews.Author: oliver86
Reviews.Content: When we arrived on Saturday afternoon the hotel was in full swin with valet and reception staff checking in over fifty vistors. They handled themselves with great professional, even with guests who had problems with rooms still being serviced and therefore unavailable for check-in. As staff were honest and courteous, guests responded in kind. The room was all we needed - clean and close to the Sydney entertainment centre. The standout, however, was the staff. They were all so helpful, smiling and kind! At breakfast I ended up having a lovely chat with the F & B manager when he asked me how the food was. He suggested I join the Rydges the Priority club - which I did and I saved about 20% on the total bill which I was really grateful for. I don't mean to "sell" the hotel here, but to point out that staff were really on the ball with their tasks. I will be take!

Reviews.Title: “Nice & comfortable but lacking in cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: BettyBBoop
Reviews.Content: Nice and comfortable hotel with convenient location, close to the city centre and public transport. Hotel staff generally friendly & helpful. However a big let down with cleanliness of the room. Found hairs on the bathroom floor, smelly towel, black fluff on the bed linen, marks on the kettle and remnant of lipstick marks on a cup.

Reviews.Title: “Almost got 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: dselvan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights. Booked the room on the executive floor which gives you access to the executive lounge which has complimentary computers with internet and evening drinks and canapes. Note no free wifi and you have to pay for internet in your room otherwise. Had to email them to get a non smoking room before we arrived. Had emailed them to say we will be arriving early after 30 hours of flying and wanted to check in early if possible. they couldnt accomodate us since there were no rooms but then the check in girl said you can get a room only if paying for early check in which was a shame and check in girl didnt know what she was doing. Apart from that all staff were excellent. Concierge knowledgable and helpful. Breakfast was reasonable serve it your self buffet although if you want eggs, you can only have scrambled which i hated!!! Rooms excellent but dont expect any excellent views. Location excellent for all shops and walking to darling harbour. Trains and buses were 5 mins walk away. Check out was swift. Do recommend joining their priority guest programme which is free to join and you get lot of perks including cheaper rates. Overall excellent hotel and with a bit of change can get the 5 star TA rating.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, good location but a few let downs.”
Reviews.Author: geenes
Reviews.Content: We booked in to stay at the hotel last minute via their website. If you are going to do this, be sure to sign up to become a priorty guest before making any bookings. It is free to do so online on their website and means you then have access to cheaper room rates, so why wouldn't you! We got the first nights room at a rate of AUD $171. We first booked for only one night, then extended the stay to another night (this was all last minute due to heatwave in Sydney and needing a hotel with aircon!). The second night the best they could do for us was AUD $270, because they said the hotel was pretty full - apparently is an airline hotel, so occupied with airline staff a lot of the time. We were in a room on the 13th floor, at the end of the corridor which was nice and pretty quiet. View overlooked Pitt St, so just looking into office buildings and shops, nothing spectacular there. But we weren't there for a view. Got a little street noise at night, but nothing that affected sleep quality at all. Room was decent sized, nothing special... your standard hotel room with dated furniture - a desk, little table and one chair, flat screen TV - no DVD player or anything like that. Fridge, coffee and tea making facilities. We got a king room and the bed was good - firm and comfortable and allowed for a good nights sleep. Like other reviews, there was nothing parcitularly WRONG with the hotel, just not amazing or overly special...just comfortable. The location was great - right in world square which has a bunch of Asian inspired eateries and shops, George St just around the corner - so you are definitely in the hub of the city. The few gripes we did have were as follows: Bathroom cleanliness wasn't up to standard. Hairs on floor, found big clumps of hair and marks on supposedly clean fresh towels - had to call to get them replaced. We told them why we needed new ones, but they didn't seem to care. I kept finding stray hairs in different places, on the bed, sheets, etc. They called up to our room to say we hadn't signed something on check in, would I come down and do it - considering I had just got in to the room to relax in the aircon and was already undressed, etc - no I wasn't going to put everything back on to trek back downstairs for your error! The lady heard my hesitation and then said 'oh, I can come up to you"....which she did. When she arrived it was an exact copy of what I HAD already signed at reception. When I told her that, she apologised. Also a LOT of dust in the place, the bedside tables, bedhead, desk, lamps, etc etc. They overcharged us for room service and also charged us for a beer we hadn't removed from the minibar. This was recitifed on check out though. We ordered room service, which was not great. The mains - mac n cheese and a pizza were below average, just no flavour. The dessert - chocolate fondant was alright. It just seemed to miss the mark with the trimmings you would have expected, like...plates to eat off! They just sort of dumped the food on the tiny table in the room and left. So overall, I probably enjoyed this hotel more because we were desperarte to get into somewhere with airconditiong! But in conclusion - it was your average city hotel, in a good location, providing a decent sleep, definitely could be cleaner and staff more attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Ticked All the Boxes”
Reviews.Author: Baileybum
Reviews.Content: We have just completed a 3 day stay at Rydges World Square having accessed a deal via the Rydges website at an averaged $184 per night (with a Priority Guest discount). This was for an executive room and access to the associated club for breakfast and evening drinks. Having read some of the recent reviews, I was a little apprehensive but am pleased to say that, based on our stay, my concerns were certainly not justified. Service from start to finish was very good with efficient, professional and pleasant check in and checkout occurring at Reception. All staff members we encountered throughout the hotel were friendly and helpful whether they were cleaners, concierge staff or bar staff. Our room was a good size; the king bed was terrific for a good night's sleep after wandering about the city sights all day; supplied toiletries were replenished appropriately; and linen and towels were very clean. We returned each day to a well vacuumed, clean room and bathroom. Our room was right above a bar in the World Square precinct but we couldn't hear a peep with the balcony door closed. The executive club breakfast was fine and plentiful - cereals, fruit, toasts, pastries, boiled eggs, baby bacon and sausage servings, juices and coffee. This was plenty for us to start off our days' explorations and provided a relaxed environment to read the newspapers (although I would have liked to see ABC 24 Hour News on the TV). The location is good for both sightseeing and shopping. The Concierge advised us of the free 555 bus which leaves from nearby George Street and you can hop on, hop off at major points of interest. Alternatively, it's an interesting walk through the CBD to Circular Quay etc. There are ample shopping and dining options within World Square itself, including a Coles supermarket, or you can comfortably walk down to Chinatown and Darling Harbour. The hotel is probably due for refurbishment and there are certainly scuff marks, bumps and scrapes on hallway walls and skirting boards. But we didnâ€™t come to Sydney to carry out a â€˜house inspectionâ€™ and these are very minor quibbles. What was important to us was the location and facilities, cleanliness and staff attitude all of which met our expectations. If I have just one gripe, it is that perennial bane of travellers â€“ the lack of free internet access. Rydges World Square is not alone in charging for this; it seems to be a habit amongst many large hotel chains. Darned if I know why?! All in all, we enjoyed our stay here and thought the hotel was very good value, especially at the rate we paid. Iâ€™m not sure that I would pay rack rate until refurbishing is complete but I guess itâ€™s all relative when considering the cost of hotels in Sydney overall. I would certainly return for another stay at the right price.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and Central for Sydney”
Reviews.Author: TravelerMontreal
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel... very close to Central Busienss District.... as teh Aussies say the CBD. Close to Opera House and Harbour Bridge

Reviews.Title: “Good location near Museum Station, Chinatown, Darling Harbor”
Reviews.Author: iskating
Reviews.Content: Buy a MyMulti1 ticket to use any bus, all the ferries and the trains in zone 1. It is very easy to get to anywhere you want to go in Sydney. Rydges World Square is close to the train station and buses. Darling Harbor and Chinatown are within short walking distance. Rooms are very good size and clean. But do not expect to have a good view. Housekeeping was OK, we had a few minor issues that were quickly resolved. Concierge service was excellent. We used the concierge to make restaurant bookings. Jordan's Seafood gave us complimentary champagne because concierge made the booking. Register for Rydges Priority Guest membership. It's free and you get many good benefits, including Welcome Back drink at the bar. A few very good restaurant in the World Square complex. For breakfast, Kafe Kaz is a very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Hmm...just not right”
Reviews.Author: emmeh
Reviews.Content: I'll be honest - I'm torn about this hotel. It checks all the boxes easily; clean, centrally located, comfy beds, decent bathroom, prompt service....but it just didn't feel right to me. I couldn't wait to get out of there the next morning. Myself plus one stayed in there on a Friday night mid December 2010 as an alternative to forking out the same money (well..not really) for a taxi to get home after a big night out. Upon checking in, it seemed like the hotel couldn't decide if it wanted to be a business hotel or a leisure hotel. I'm fine with indecision, but it just felt off. As I said, the room was fine. But fine isn't really a compliment. They were clean. There was a bed which was comfy...but again, just not quite right. I did notice that the room was quite dark, even with the lights on-and it did have a funny shape, kind of like flat rectangle with it's leg sticking out. The location..again, fine. It's on Pitt St, there's lots of people around, it's a bit grubby but that is what Pitt street is. I'm not bothered by that at all. Actually, a great thing about being there was the monorail stop is right outside to whisk you down to Darling Harbour should you wish...and I wished! Look - if you can get a good price that you are happy with and you will be out partying nearby, give it a shot - otherwise, there are plenty of more-than-fine hotels nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel at a good location”
Reviews.Author: MikeB1981
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located a five minute walk from Darling Harbour (with plenty of restaurants) and about a 20 minute walk through the CBD to Circle Quay. If you fancy getting to Circle Quay more quickly there is a train station not too far away from the hotel that will get you there in about two stops. The room was perfectly nice with a big, comfortable bed. It became very dark at night with the curtains closed which was great for a good night's sleep. Our TV didn't work but we told reception the next morning and it was fixed very promptly afterwards. My only little gripe is that there was bottled water in the room but they charged 4 dollars for it - most of the other hotels we went to gave it to you for free. Still there's a 7-11 close by to get cheap water so it was no big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and not value for money!”
Reviews.Author: whatshappeningdu
Reviews.Content: I booked online asking for a non smoking room. After spending ages fighting through the traffic we got to our room finding it smelling of smoke, the room had not been vacuumed and not very well cleaned. The room was very outdated - definatley not value for money! We were then relocated to another room. This one didn't smell of smoke but was right next to the lift, we could hear people all night. Would defiantately not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Standard Hotel in Good Location”
Reviews.Author: gilp12
Reviews.Content: Pros: Good location - in the middle of the CBD with a monorial stop next door. Also only a few minutes walk from the Museum train station - so easy access to/from the airport. Good service - they allowed me to check in early without any issue Comfortable beds Cons: Rooms are outdated, except for the beds and lcd tv. The chairs look like they are 20 years old. Rooms are small - epecially the king size rooms. Hallways have a musty older hotel smell Gym is decent size but equipment is very outdated Internet is slow and highly priced Overall I would compare the Rydges World Square hotel to a Radisson in the US. Decent and adequate but no "wow" factor. Tips: Join the Rydges club (free to join) for discounted internet access and a free welcome drink.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: kenandkay
Reviews.Content: Our children organised a 2 night stay for our 50th wedding annivesary. Check in was quick and curteous and we were upgraded to a suite and there was a complementary bottle of bubbly on ice in the room. Decor of the lounge was a little dull but had a nice view down into the courtyard of the World Square shops. Bedroom great with crisp sheets and flat screen. Needed to ring housekeeping for more cups and then more milk which arrived fairly quickly. Breakfast supervisor was very helpful on our 1st morning and one could not fault the buffet breakfast, you could also order special cooked meals such as omelettes etc. The checkout was good and the young Spanish lass was a delight to deal with. All in all a lovely 2 days to celebrate our 50th.

Reviews.Title: “Good location in the city, nice standard of hotel”
Reviews.Author: julieroasts
Reviews.Content: Liked the locationj, the room sizes and all the necessary hotel facilities. Bit of traffic noise, but still slept well. Can easily walk to all the city shops

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but a little tired and badly let down by housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: spoza
Reviews.Content: Great location but badly let down by housekeeping. Stayed 5 days and on 3 occasions room not made up on return at the end of the day. Problem quickly resolved when reported but damage done. Otherwise felt hotel did not offer value for the money spent. Room a little spartan.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant, brilliant, brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: Angelpie123
Reviews.Content: I initially booked because of the excellent 20% off deal for Priority members. The price was excellent. I love good value and discounts so this really appealed to me! We arrived early in the day and so I made a call to recpetion to see if we could get an early check in. I was told by Anthony that he would do his best to ensure a room was cleaned within the hour and to come on down to the hotel. Upon our arrival at around 10 am the duty manager called house keeping to get the room inspected and we were in our room within 10 minutes with bags waiting for us. Just brilliant. We called for various things like help with Tv, to get a new robe and sewing kits etc... and our requests were always met very promtly and in a friendly manner. The room service was decently priced and absolutely delicious. The dream bed was amazing and we slept so well. The breakfast buffet is great value for priority members and the best I have had by far in a long time! The food tasted so good and the freshly squeezed juices were so good and a lovely touch. Upon checking out our feedback was welcomed in a friendly manner and we even got a discount from our bill for the tiny issues we experienced. I travel a lot with my business and I haven't had such an outstanding experience at a hotel in a very long time. thank you Rydges World Square, you are a brilliant establishment and I very much look forward to staying with you the very next time i'm in Sydney. Well done to all of your lovely staff and keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but very thin walls”
Reviews.Author: marsy86
Reviews.Content: Rydges is located on Pitt St - an awesome spot if you want to do a lot of shopping, there are plenty of restaurants around and public transport is closeby - highly recommend the small cafe below rydges for breaky. Couldn't fault the rooms, however had a very bad nights sleep for first night as the room next to us were up to all hours in the morning and as the walls are so thin you could hear everything.

Reviews.Title: “Not a hotel for a quiet and restful nights sleep”
Reviews.Author: jivory34
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for a number of reasons. Price, location and good standard of hotel. Never did I think that we would be kept awake until 5am with a night club located straight across the road from us. We had travelled to Sydney from NZ to have two nights away from the family and to catch up on some well earned sleep - there in lies the problem. After trying to resolved the problem with hotel front desk and not getting an assurance that the room we were being moved to was going to be quiet, we decided to check out and book in to another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Beds, fantastic pillows....no sleep”
Reviews.Author: Peter142
Reviews.Content: My reveiw is a a tail of what should be a nice hotels, but here are some warnings. First we asked for a non-smoking room and got one but it stunk of smoke. No big deal. In the scheme of things a minor annoyance. Having just flew back from Europe, we booked into town to sleep top avoid a drive home and here is the real warning. DO NOT STAY IN THIS HOTEL ON A SATURDAY NIGHT. We were given a room that faced a disco that THUMPED until 5 in the morning. From there it becomes a lesson in how not to conduct customer service. We were given a few vague assurances of upgrades should we come back but absolutely nothing done. To add insult to injury I received a letter from the hotel two days later. An acknowledgement of my complaint he thinks to himself. NO!!! A bill for minibar items that we had not consumed. One heated call later, still nothing but assurances of future upgrades. This should be a nice hotel. A pity I won't be taking up my future upgrades.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, fantastic beds”
Reviews.Author: Ekaterina_Sh
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very conveniently located. Almost in the center: on the border of CBD and Chinatown. Rydges is within walking distance to all attractions, including the Sydney Opera House, Sydney Tower is nearby. The rooms are fairly spacious - there is a place for everything you have with you. In the bathroom there is a bathtub and a shower, large mirror. Quality of cleaning could be better, but overall is quite bearable. The room has an iron and ironing board, hair dryer. Undoubted plus of the hotel is a bed, very soft and comfortable, you can fall asleep in a minute. In the room there is a big TV, minibar (extra charge), tea cups, tea bags, milk and sugar (it's free). Porters have left very good impression. They were always ready to help, gave excellent advice on sightseeing, helped to get a discount on the tour, gave a map of the city and various coupons for discounts. Directly from the hotel you can book tours, we really liked the trip to the Blue Mountains.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to be right in the middle of it all in Sydney, this is it!”
Reviews.Author: 7DC
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at the Rydges World Square and I had my family with me this time. Our 4 nights stay was incident free and its location is hard to beat. There's a monorail station right at the door. If you are hungry, day or night, you can practically find anything within 100m radius of the hotel, from fast food to Asian delights and fine dining. World Square has shops and restaurants on the ground floor and the basement. There is a Coles supermarket and a Chinese supermarket adjacent to it. I took my daughter for a swim one early morning at the Cook & Phillip Aquatic Centre which is a leisurely 10mins walk across Hyde Park. You can also walk across to Darling Harbour for a jog. If you're looking for something a bit unusual, try one of the eateries along Oxford Street. Gents, don't be surprised if you get wolf-whistle by another guy there. Just keep walking. :) Friday and Saturday nights around World Square can get a little bit rowdy and intimidating for young ones as there are two night clubs nearby. However, it's certainly not Kings Cross.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: stitchCheltenham
Reviews.Content: THe hotel is right in the centre of the buiness district close to both musuem and town hal stations. Its also less than 10 minutes to Darling Harbour and the botanical gardens which are fantastic. The rooms are very large as is the bathroom. We did not have breakfast at the hotel but there are some good cafes nearby. (kafe kaz). The hotel has a gym and also a guest laundry which was useful. The staff were polite, could check in at 1pm and everywhere was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Very Average - but value for money”
Reviews.Author: David K
Reviews.Content: Found the hotel to be clean and very average. Dissapointed no-one was able to help with luggage, we had to dreg it into the hotel and up to our room on our own. Naturally when we checked out we had to drag our stuff out to the car. Breakfast was very very basic and ordinary, would have been better out in one of the CBD cafes.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality hotel in a conveniant location”
Reviews.Author: shinok
Reviews.Content: All very good with the exception of the low lighting in the room and a bit of noise through the wall from the neighouring room. Best bed we've ever slept in. Location is very handy to everything. We chose this hotel from reviews on this website and weren't disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Rydges Sydney”
Reviews.Author: siax
Reviews.Content: Good service, really helpful staff. Executive bar is fairly basic, but whos complaining when theres free evening canapes and drinks?! Breakfast is available in there and is better than eating in the much busier main restaurant. Breakfast choice is ok, but hot food limited to 2 options - and quite unusual ones at that, such as boiled eggs and hash browns. Several pastries types. The only semi-complaint i would have is that their advertising is quite sneaky: i booked the room as it was going to be on 19-21st floors, so i thought i'd get a great view of sydney. The room was indeed on the 21st top floor - except the floors start at 12, so in reality i was only on the 9th. The first room had a brick wall as a view, so i moved to another with limited view but did have a balcony and was very big. The location is pretty good too, not right in the centre but only a few minutes walk to Town Hall station All in all a good hotel, but not quite up to the standards of others in central Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in Sydney....Commendable service”
Reviews.Author: slipey
Reviews.Content: The Location is central to a lot of the prime shopping locations in Sydney. It is also an excellent location to a large number of very good food places. Our room was very comfortable and quiet. What impressed us most about Rydges World Square is the way in which the resolved an issue we had with our shuttle bus (Airport Connect) which we had prebooked and paid for but they never turned up on time. We therefore had to catch a taxi to the airport. When we informed the hotel management they immediately took steps to make sure we were not out of pocket and we were very appreciative of that.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: JayneanneBrisbane
Reviews.Content: This is a good example of Rydges quality. Great hotel in a great location. Only negative was breakfast which was awful - poor service and poor food. But don't let that put you off staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in the City”
Reviews.Author: cLeo140878
Reviews.Content: I stayed recently at the hotel in the exec suite, for my birthday and loved it!!! Great service (special thanks to Ali), attention to detail, very high standard. Loved the complimentary champagne in our suite, comfortable big bed and a massive bathroom. Overall, it was a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Loved every minute”
Reviews.Author: swans_fanCanberra
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently and loved every minute. Check-in was efficient and staff were friendly and polite. Even though it was only 12 noon I was told the room was available immediately and also received a free upgrade to a suite. Room was spotlessly clean and bed very comfortable. Breakfast in the club lounge was delicious and included eggs and bacon. Staff at the Red Square bar were very friendly and coffee was great. I could not fault anything during my stay - staff even stood out on the road to find a taxi when I wanted to go to the SGC. Had a newspaper delivered outside the room and late 1pm checkout. Plenty of eateries and a supermarket nearby. The monorail was one minute away and could easily travel all around the city. I wanted a hotel close to Central station and it was a 15 minute walk. Loved my time at Rydges World Square and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel let down by minor niggles”
Reviews.Author: MollyFW
Reviews.Content: Good hotel in World Square area of Sydney, great if that's what you're looking for. Atmosphere seemed more aimed at leisure than business, eg loudish music in lobby area. Room was good size and very quiet but let down by minor maintenance issues, eg loose tap in bathroom, loose soap dish in shower, loose power point in room. Overall a bit expensive for what it provided

Reviews.Title: “No way this is 5 star”
Reviews.Author: LittleKiwiGal
Reviews.Content: The rooms are ok - fairly standard - but are certainly not anything like 5 star. There are no bath robes, no power points next to the bed and I didn't even have a hair dryer in my room. When I called housekeeping I was told that only guests on the top two floors got bathrobes. When I called about a hair dryer, the person on the other end of the phone struggled to understand me. In fact many of the staff I dealt with (other than the front desk) had what seemed to be a fairly limited grasp of the english language. If want a clean, fairly comfortable room - by all means stay here. If you want that plus good, friendly service, it's best that you stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Valet parking woes”
Reviews.Author: schoey_newcastle
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a good area of of the city for shopping and Theatres but quite a distance from the Harbour. The facilities are quite good eg. Restaurant, Gym, Executive Lounge and Shops. The rooms are spacious and have the modern facilities and are extremely clean. Only negative I have is the constant hassle when wanting to use Valet Parking. There is no assistance from the staff to inform you when they will attend to your vehicle so you are sitting in your car in a no standing zone risking a parking fine while you or your partner enters the hotel to locate a staff member to attend your vehicle. The noise from the Pitt St side of the hotel can be quite noisy on Friday and Saturday nights. Overall it was a pleasant hotel to stay at for a short trip to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Problems dealt with quickly”
Reviews.Author: ausmike_1968
Reviews.Content: On arrival I found the bathroom not properly cleaned, and the reception sent someone up to clean it. On going to bed that night I found the bed quite itchy. On inspection, I discovered hairs int he bed (not mine). I called the front desk the next morning, and complained. Within 30min the Manager called and apoloigised. I was moved to a suite that day, and found this to be clean and well presented. While I was disappointed with the cleanliness of my initial room, my complaint was dealt with promptly and I was impressed with the service. Maybe this was a once off problem?

Reviews.Title: “Never stay at another Rydges hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jphibbs
Reviews.Content: This hotel needs to put their staff through customer service training. The service I got was appalling. The staff were rude, condescending and not interested in being of any assistance.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast was good!”
Reviews.Author: Teka08
Reviews.Content: We stayed there only one night with two small kids. The location is very good. The breakfast was also very good. The room has more or less modern interior, however it looked a bit boring. The view from window was not good at all. We saw people working in an office or gathring in a meeting room. The other minus point was, that it took somehow quite long time to check in and check out. We had a feeling that staff didn't communicate between them well....

Reviews.Title: “Become a platinum member”
Reviews.Author: Bjings
Reviews.Content: We love rydges world square! We lov it so much we are now platinum members that gives us 50% off dinner in all rydges resturants. The resturant staff and food are first class check in always easy( they will store your bags if you r leaving late) beds are really dream beds! The location is perfect and the price is always value 4 money. Best value hotel in the city. You may even get to see vanessa amorrossi perform in the foyer.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great beds”
Reviews.Author: DizzyScot
