Reviews.Content: This hotel was really nice, and is possibly the comfiest bed I've ever slept in! The only downside for me is that it's a bit far from the opera house etc for my liking. Overall a great hotel though, we had no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything.”
Reviews.Author: wardclark
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Rydges World Square for a recent business trip. It was reasonably close to everything. There are no views from any of the rooms except onto our buildings. If you can get the excecutive package which includes access to a lounge for breakfast and pre-dinner drinks and nibbles.

Reviews.Title: “Second time there, very happy with the service and rooms”
Reviews.Author: poindexter11
Reviews.Content: This was my second time there, last time was post surgery, this time for business, very happy with standard of the room and staff, benefits from being a priority member are great, free drink on arrival (or when it suits) cheaper room, later checkout, all good things, this hotel is also very centrally located, and well positioned for bus train and walking to pretty much anywhere you would want to do in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed bag - good location, lovely staff, facilities not so good”
Reviews.Author: RachTheH
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights. Arrived 7pm on a Saturday night to be told room wasn't ready. Given drink vouchers for bar as would be ready in 10 mins. Not ready after 15, and so we went out for a meal without getting changed. But very nice receptionist gave us 2 complimentary breakfasts which was good compensation, as the breakfast was excellent. I'd echo what others have said - good location, lovely staff, but tired decor & fittings. Eg carpet not clean, wall had some splatters of chocolate? blood? who knows what. And a lamp stopped working after first night. But was replaced quickly. Also we paid for internet but it was really quite slow. Now in Auckland Quadrant, got free internet & it's loads faster. I would only recommend this if it's on a special rate.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Hotel”
Reviews.Author: revdec
Reviews.Content: I actually checked in this evening and am here for the next few nights. My room is fantastic and the staff couldn't be more welcoming and friendly if they tried. From now on when I'm coming to Sydney Rydges will be my hotel of choice!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: prettyarl212
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on two separate occasions, once in June 2010 and again in July 2010 and both experiences were wonderful. It starts with the people and managers at the reception. They are very respectful and accomodating and always try their best for you. When I was given a room near a lift, I requested a room in a quieter location and I was given one without any hassle. I also had an unusual request that required a great deal of follow-up that another manager (Mr. Gao) successfully fulfilled. The rooms that I stayed in on both occasions were very quiet. I could not hear anything from adjacent rooms, the hallway or people above me. The beds were truely 'dream beds'. They were soo comfortable. The matresses were firm but they had a thick layer of padding over them. The pillows were also very comfortable. The room is minimalist in that it really doesn't have much drawer space, but I found the shelves and closet adequeate to hold a whole month's worth of clothing. The bathrooms were modern. The water pressure in the shower was excellent. Once again the bathroom was minimalist and there is very little room to put cosmetics and toiletries (this could use some improvement) . The weak spot is the housekeeping. On my second stay, everyday I returned to my room to find something missing (no bath mat on 2 occasions, no towels on one occasion, the remote control on one occasion, etc). I was finally told that they changed their laundry provider and there were shortages. Since this didn't happen during my first stay I hope they have cleared up this problem. There was also a change in the resaurant from my first stay to the second stay with the food preparation going from 4 star to less than one star. The second chef just didn't know how to cook. Medium rare lamb chops came out well done and when I returned them and I asked for medium rare I was told that it could only be cooked medium because it was a thrid cut (whatever that means). I also had a problem with an omlette on the second stay. It came out runny and with so much salt and peepper that it burned my tongue. I hope that this will be addressed as the restauant on the first stay was really good and it was nice to have it in the hotel. It really pays to join the Priority club as the full buffet breakfast only costs $15 AUD for members and there is 20% off the dinners. The location is excellent. It is centrally located and there is a 555 bus that is free and goes along George St to the circular quay. It is also convenient to may other busses. There is also a 'mall' below the hotel that has many of the services that a traveler needs (drug store, newsstand, supermarket, restaurants and take away food places, clothing shops, dry cleaners, etc). I would definitely stay here again when I return to Sydney

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Paris1964
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the Rydges 3 days ago, after having booked directly with hotel on internet (and not having had a confirmation) and requested early check in twice by mail as arriving early from Japan. Not only room was not ready at 9am, but they told us they'd call as soon as it was clean. No need to say we didn't get call and came back at 2pm when we had to wait a bit more. That's understandable, but the worst thing is that the room was not clean. Dust everywhere, smelly toilet, things belonging to previous people on floor, sheets had been changed but I doubt a lot more was done to the room. I complained about dust and toilet, but nothing was done till I asked again, and still the toilet eventhough it looked clean, still smelt bad ( I suspect cleaner didn't put product under rim). I can confirm that the daily clean is more than superficialm as things (small bit of paper, elastic) dropped on the floor were still there 3 days lates. The hotel is dated, decor looks tired and cheap (maintenance guy for tv said normal things broke down as goods were cheap), toiletries are low range (and not enough for 3), even the pens didn't work. I'll stop there as the list is even longer... would not go back and regret trusting other comments and believe me, I have travelled the world and stayed in much cheaper hotels but have never had to complain (twice) about smelly toilets and having to do it myself at the end of the day. No need to say staff didn't offer anything to compensate (free coffee for instance might have appeased and angry customer). Staff is nice, and location is good (excellent Malaysian restaurant round the corner for lovely laksa) but staying in a place that does not feel clean is an unpleasant feeling especially when you pay 250 AUD a night for 5 nights !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, family room is fantastic”
Reviews.Author: SweetPea04
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights with two young children in a family room. Plenty of room for the kids to chill. Fantastic location amongst all the Korean restaurants and suopermarkets I was in heaven. Close to public transport and shops. Thai massage under the escalator was the best and very must needed after a busy day sightseeing. Will stay here again next time in Sydney

Reviews.Title: “Good room, Great Beds”
Reviews.Author: chuxtc
Reviews.Content: The room was good, the beds were great. We were handy to all public transport. The staff were pleasant and helpful. We had 5 in our 2 bedroom room. The cleaning staff must not have realised that, we would only get towels etc. for four. Check in was a breeze. I recommend becoming a priority guest. The hotel was in a handy location close to everything you need.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Great Staff - VERY comfy sleep - Central to everything!”
Reviews.Author: Mankiwi
Reviews.Content: Second stay @ Rydges World Sq in 3 months - Had a 1 bed suite this time (travelled solo last time) with rollout & sofabed for our 3 kids - Plenty of space. Staff are great & really helpful - central to every amenity & monorail. Ask the concierge for local tips - these guys are very clued-up. We stayed on the executive floor, which meant that we had complimentary breakfast and evening light meals - very handy for feeding the small animals :) Would definitely stay here again... amidst the hustle & bustle... but sometimes that's just what's required!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Discovery!”
Reviews.Author: BangkokBazza
Reviews.Content: No hotel is without it's problems, but it's how they deal with them that sets them apart. Rydges staff were not only helpful, but prompt and efficient. There's a lady in Spheres Restaurant called Karen who is just fantastic. She knew the menu thoroughly and was a font of information about Sydney, as well as being genuinely friendly. The room I had was large and the amenities were good. Also it's very easy to book everything on their website. As a resident of Asia, where hotels and service are legendary, I found Rydges on a par and will certainly choose them again!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hotel, clean and modern.”
Reviews.Author: TIersHasie
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a business trip there overnight. Staff is polite but not overly friendly. Room was very clean and did not seem old at all. Hotel itself was quiet which helped for a good sleep overnight. My room had the poorest view (almost none at all - facing another office building around 2m away, could probably jump out the window and touch the other building. Other than that, buffet breakfast at restaurant is good and of expected quality and selection for the Rydges chain. Dinner service can be a bit slow but ok value for money.

Reviews.Title: “A Professional Run Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hippo645
Reviews.Content: We just came back from Sydney with In-laws and young nephew. One of the many hotels we stayed in this trip is Rydges World Square and was impressed with a few incidents. I thought I would share for all to know. 1. We arrived very early in Sydney (6am). The flight from Singapore to Sydney was terrible. We had twin children in the cabin that cried throughout the 7 hrs. We had no sleep / rest at all. Reached the hotel at 7am. The front desk staff was not able to give us any room as the hotel was running full the night before. We went out for breakfast, however our older and younger folks were really exhausted from the flight and not able to do any other things else. We went back to the hotel at 10am hoping the rooms will be ready for us. The front desk empathize with our situation but can gave us a room. This was really good especially for our in-laws! 2. We checked out of the hotel the next day early morning to pick up the rental car for Jindabyne. Had the breakfast in the hotel. The staff advise us to register to be member as we will be able to enjoy brekky at $15 instead of $25. We did that and paid cash for the meal. Upon reaching home (8 days later) we saw a bill for the breakfast. Immediately I wrote to the hotel that evening and the very next day morning they rang (which I missed the call) and wrote an email. They apologised for the mixed up and will arrange for the refund. From the above incident, I am really impressed with their speed and efficiency to investigate and rectify the mix up. The staff are all trained and friendly to dish out beneficial advice to guests. The hotel is also very central to access to Chinatown, Darling Harbour and the major shopping places along George Street. The only little thing I could not comprehend is that why there is a need to charge 1.5% more for credit card payment. Don't all hotel absorb that fee?

Reviews.Title: “bad experience!!”
Reviews.Author: drrganesh
Reviews.Content: location apart we had a bad experience in this hotel . The air conditioning was not working and despite reminders nothing was done and we literally had to sweat it out for all 3 days we were there. This is my first instance of a hotel room NOT BEING SERVICED in the day(can u believe it). We had to report the same after we reached the room in the night dead tired, all we got was a set of fresh towels as we had to check out early next morning. Extermely disappointig to say the least!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value over New Year - get the executive lounge included!”
Reviews.Author: seamuscoolcat
Reviews.Content: We went to Australia in Dec / Jan - unfortunately our house was flooded with the bad weather when we were away and this is the first chance I've had to write review! The Rydges was fantastic - great location, right in the centre of everything. We got the executive lounge included - this was excellent value. For an extra Â£100 over 6 nights we got a buffet breakfast every morning and drinks and canapes in the afternoon - great value! The room was a decent size and extremely clean. I had room service once and this was both good quality and good value. We arrived really early morning and the girls on reception did everything the could to get us into room quickly. A good 4 * star choice and it worked out great value over New Year.

Reviews.Title: “Very good but strange experience”
Reviews.Author: Imanyakin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights with two very young children. We stayed in a two double bed room. The room was adequately spacious for four of us. It is clean and all the facilities you need in a hotel room with a cartoon channel which is always a big bonus for those who have young children. The big plus for me is the availability of 2 double bed in the same room. I actually surfing all night long to find such room. Another big plus is the location and of course value for money. Halal restaurants are also within walking distance from the hotel. The most strange experience in my life was when milk bottles of my children went missing at the third night. My wife was so worried as both of them still very hook to milk bottle especially when going to sleep. Fortunately around half an hour after calling the hotel staff and few visits from them, they eventually found all the milk bottles safely. What can I say? I think the management should look at the way the housekeeping do their cleaning and try to limit this kind of things happening. Overall, our experience staying there with two little children has been very good, apart from that incident. I would most likely stay there again, mainly because of its 2 double bed room, location and value for money.

Reviews.Title: “not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: topcat30
Reviews.Content: stayed here two nights, only one lift ,it was dirty,not much water .would not stay there again we payed good money to stay here thinking it was 4 star like it said and being part of ridges group .small dark rooms, shower not good not much water.$30 a night to have your car parked in car park next door

Reviews.Title: “Bargain for location & accomodation”
Reviews.Author: HRH29
Reviews.Content: Stayed in an Executive room with access to the lounge - if you stay here this is well worth it. The lounge is brilliantly supervised and provides continental breakfast (with hot choices too) and in the evening in affect a free bar with hot and cold canapes - plus access to free internet. Hotel is 10 minutes stroll to Darling Harbour and about 30-40 to Circular Quay. It is a very busy corner of the Spanish Quarter/Chinatown - but the price for what you'd pay for similar accomodation a block of two closer, would be exceedingly more. Sydney is fabulous, Darling Harbour and Sydney Harbour - fantastic! Go!!

Reviews.Title: “Expected more !”
Reviews.Author: Martina049
Reviews.Content: While previous travellers mostly wrote positive reviews about this hotel I was disappointed and the reality did not reflect the photos. My KIng Deluxe room on the 19th floor looked somewhat "run down". The carpets were badly stained. In the bathroom the towel hooks were barely hanging on and in the shower the soap dish was broken and no other shelf to place shampoo etc. I also would have appreciated a TV guide for current programs. The positives are the very convenient location (3 mins from airport train station) and very comfortable bed with beautiful linen. Also a very reasonable priced coffee shop right outside the front that sells great food.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pies1311
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed here (last time was in April 2009). Booked using a last minute hotel website and managed to get a very good rate. Both times I was impressed with place in terms of quality and value. King room is large, as is the bathroom which has a seperate bath and shower. Location is fine, closer to Darling Harbour and Chinatown rather than the Opera House and the Rocks (about 15-20 min walk away). While the hotel is on a really busy street corner, the room was surprisely quiet. Definitely recommend if you can get a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Nice business hotel in the city centre”
Reviews.Author: JUXPrague
Reviews.Content: I spent two weeks there on a business trip. The hotel is very good located, the only issue is that some of the rooms are quite dark as the sun doesn't have a chance to get there (especially the lower floors). But overall it has everything you need for a business trip Must appreciate the staff, as I arrived at Sydney airport around 5-6 am, got to the hotel at 7.30 am and they let me in the room although the check-in time is much later

Reviews.Title: “Excellent -hotel .”
Reviews.Author: Mqoasng100
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an excellent location within walking many attractions, including Darling Harbour and Chinatown, and it is located in a block of Museum train stations. The staff are generally helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Always great but some rough edges”
Reviews.Author: mikeanz
Reviews.Content: At this hotel for two nights and then a further one night this month. Always a pleasure (not my first visits). Well priced and nothing is too much trouble for the staff. Great location and all parts of the hotel are calm, quiet and relaxed. Very comfortable rooms. Excellent food (both room service and in bar and restaurant). The main area for improvement is the cleanliness in parts of the operation. A bugbear on all of my visits is the accumulation of rubbish on the flat, pebble covered roof areas that many of the rooms look out on. Food, clothing, and general rubbish end up there (as a result of lazy, disrespectful guests, not the staff). But they need faster clearing. This month my room on first stay on 12th floor had cigarette packets and other junk adjacent to the room balcony. Second stay (Room 1245) had old clothing, a tray of rotten meat product and other general rubbish on the roof area, right outside the window. Outside the bar area looking down on the Square an old pillow rotting away stuck on a glass canopy. Previous stays confirm the pattern - not a good look. But an excellent hotel otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “always a comfort to come back here”
Reviews.Author: agent_anonymous
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel fairly regularly and have yet to find something to complain about. Rooms are nice and clean. I love the fact that the windows open (I don't like sleeping with air conditiioners becuase ofsinus problems). Restaurant is nice with a good variet of food, though sometimes I think they need more service staff. The gym is big and open but doesnt contain a huge amount of equipment. Checkin is always quick and prompt, and I've always found all the hotel staff to be helpful and pleasant. One of my favourite things about this hotel is that they always seem to have specials on which they let you know about either when you check in or by some cards in your rooms. Half price drinks, Mini Bar specials, breakfast special etc. Makes you feel like you can get value for moeny at this hotel, considering what some other hotels in Sydney charge for minibar,drinks,breakfast or meals.

Reviews.Title: “Staff, at reception & especially dining room, & location excellent .Good deals for eating too.”
Reviews.Author: MikeThelma
Reviews.Content: Concierge staff very helpful to travellers giving good tips about the best use of ones' time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: MandMlondon1
Reviews.Content: Stopped at the Rydges for 1 night prior to a cruise vacation. We were attracted by the great rates the hotel offered and the central location. It is a good 4 star hotel - rooms are roomy, beds are very comfortable and the service (the little we had) was good. We arrived really early and our room was available straight away. Location is great, close to Darling Harbour and Circular Quay and close to the heart of China Town. We didn't eat at the hotel so can't comment on Food offer, but I would definitely recommend as a transit hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing outstanding, nothing terrible”
Reviews.Author: Curfrine
Reviews.Content: We booked this place for a few nights in Sydney in Dec 09. Location was central - we walked absolutely everywhere without getting on any public transport. In this respect the location was great however it was quite a touristy area(more or less in chinatown) which we found a little boring - would have preferred somewhere a bit edgier or with more character. The hotel itself was fine - everything I would expect in a reasonably priced mid-range hotel chain. Room clean and well equipped as you would expect. Only issue was the view, or lack of it, all you could see from the window was a high rise building about two feet away. Our rate didn't include breakfast so can't comment on food but I imagine there are better places to eat practically on the doorstep. All in all, if you are looking for somewhere to crash in a central location then this is a solid choice. If you are after something more you should probably look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, nice rooms, great breakfasts”
Reviews.Author: Grice-Fearing
Reviews.Content: The Rydges in Sydney is a modern, high rise hotel, offering the typical large hotel amenities: laundry room, fitness center, business center, etc. The rooms were average size, bathrooms good, service good. Breakfast was very good, with a huge selection from the buffet. The location is incredible -- right in the heart of downtown Sydney, within walking distance to Darling Harbour. Liked this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OK If You Can Get A Deal.”
Reviews.Author: Member From Shellharbour Australia
Reviews.Content: Yes, the location is excellent, but so are the 5 or 6 other hotels within a block or two of the Rydges. Got a good deal so stayed 1 night for a wedding in town and needed to check in as early as possible to get to afternoon wedding. On arrival, room not available yet, so got offered a drink coupon until room was ready. Nice thought by management , but would have rather gotten in as requested and arrive at wedding before bride. That aside, had no other major issues. Meriton has some properties in the area that are generally better priced and somewhat nicer than the Rydges, depending on the number in your party. Although a little further away, the Hyde Park Inn is usually better value for money (we tend to stay there if there are no other good deals going at the time). I would stay at Rydges again, but only if I got another deal too good to pass up.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it.”
Reviews.Author: Koala017
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about the hotel was its location. It was well located. When we inquired with the front desk about restaurants and other highlights of Sydney we were directed to the concierge. The knowledge between all 3 of them together was less than poor. They were 3 young boys who didnt know anything about Sydney. When asked for a recomendation for a good Italian rest. we were told there is only ONE Italian restaurant in all of Sydney which is in Darling Harbour. Needless to say this was not true. Our bedsheets were dirty on second night and housekeeping never changed it even though the dirty was clearly visible. We requested two dinner plates and two forks on the second night from Room service and received two small side plates and two knives instead. We requested two wake up calls and received none due to the fact that the phone had been turned off my previous user which housekeeping should have attended to. Overall this was a very disappointing stay and definitely not a 4 star experience- 2 star maybe!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Lynnesaur
Reviews.Content: Other than the fact that the hotel is located at a pretty central place, there's nothing really that stands out. Bed is comfortable, standard room size for a 3.5 star property, slightly larger than standard bathroom with shower and bathtub. You can catch the free wifi from the cafes nearby as internet from the hotel is chargeable. A variety of eating places nearby, directly above the subway and shopping centre and it's a nice 10 minute walk up towards QVB and the mall. The biggest gripe I have is the lack of service from their front office. Upon check-in, around 5pm, I was told the my room was being used for a site inspection and would be done soon. I was given a coupon for a free drink and told that I will be notified once the room is ready. An hour later, no one had come up to tell me and I was apologised to and told that my room was ready a half hour ago. The hot chocolate at the bar was yummy.

Reviews.Title: “Central hotel, highly recommended for business or pleasure”
Reviews.Author: stavanger85
Reviews.Content: The Rydges World Square Hotel is about the best value for money I have found in the Sydney CBD. This was my third stay and while it is true to say that room quality is a little variable, it is generally of a high standard. Report any problems immediately and they will be dealt with, such as I found with in-room broadband not functioning and so I was rapidly moved to another room. The restaurant serves very nice meals and the staff there are very professional. This hotel is centrally located and is within easy walking distance of all the major tourist and business hotspots. It is worth being a member of the rydges.com prioirity guest scheme for the discounts on room rate, meals and a free drink on the house. I have also found that booking well in advance often results in an even cheaper rate if you have the luxury of being able to do that. Reception staff do a terrific job attending to requests and have a very efficient and quick check-in and check-out process. After staying in a number of four and five star hotels in the Sydney CBD, this one definitely offers the best value for money for the standard of service and standard of room on offer - you are looking at paying at least another $100 per night for something better.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Mumofteens
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel - with simply incredible public areas - the most comfortable lounge chairs and lots of 'just looking at the passing crowds' viewing spots and bars. Super fast elevators - great signage throughout the hotel. Lightning speed checkin/checkout. The best breakfast I have had in a long time at a hotel - fresh and beautifully presented. Fabulous staff, friendly, efficient and nothing too much trouble. Management has obviously taken the time to train staff well and it shows. There was a general pleasant hum around the building - staff seemed to enjoy working there. Location - right on Pitt Street but never heard a thing in our room. Also the monorail right outside the hotel's door - also never heard a thing. A large wedding was held downstairs in one of the function rooms but again never heard a thing - so we slept like babies. Heaps of different places to eat within a couple of minutes walk - a foodies paradise. We went to celebrate my husband's birthday with some friends and staff kindly placed us all the same floor - "no problems we can do that". Late checkout - "No problems" can we checkout and leave the car while we do some sightseeing? again "no problems" and no extra charge either - it's the little things that keep customers coming back. Our friends were amazed at the level of service - they were certainly won over. There is one criticism of World Square and that is inadequate signage outside the hotel to indicate the Hotel and parking - not clear enough. Each of the 3 couples had to do a lap of the block before they found the place. The most obvious thing that made our stay so pleasurable was the staff. We will stay again - great place, great price and great people.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs Present”
Reviews.Author: sworder
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the this hotel last night and am still itching from the experience - I woke a 4.50 this morning covered in bites around my elbows and down my back - I called the reception and the housekeeper was sent to my room where it was confirmed there were bed bugs- my night stay was refunded but how can a world class chain of hotels manage tobe so disgusting - I would have much prefered to have a decent night sleep and not be covered in bites now and itching like hell and than get my money back

Reviews.Title: “Only if you can't afford anything else”
Reviews.Author: witwisAlex
Reviews.Content: Sorry to say we stayed at the Rydges World Square in Sydney. If you are from the US, this hotel is the equivelent of a Super8. Expect gloomy hallways filled with room service trays that never get picked up, dark rooms, showers full of mold, horrible concierge (made us miss our tour), management indifferent to problems, overpriced food. The only good thing I can say is the area has lots of low priced restaurants. It is also near the monorail system, which may be usefull for you. If you cannot afford anything better, it might be OK for a night. We stayed here after a fabulous 3 week trip thru Indonesia/Australia and I am sorry I chose this hotel to end our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Spottete
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel overnight as I was attending a conference there over two days. The conference facilities were very good, good rooms, equipment, lunch etc. The room i got however was average, the bed was great, big new TV, bathroom looked updated, the carpet however was the most disgusting I have ever seen anywhere. It looked like a grotty old pubs carpet that never got cleaned, there were stains everywhere and what looked like shoe polish all down one side of the bed. I did not take my shoes off unless i was in the bathroom. For $200 a night it wasn't good enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: fluffybundle
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally located for a stay in the centre of Sydney. It is within easy walking distance of all the wonderful shops, Darling Harbour and Circular Quay. We had a deluxe room which was wonderfully appointed with an absolutely fabulous bed for an absolute song. That may be because we booked quite a bit in advance via Rydges own site. Worked out at about Â£55 per night. Bargain! The only grumble, it has been mentioned by other reviewers, was the timed wi-fi that cost us a fair bit every day even with a 50% discount for being Rydges members. In this day and age you really do expect this to be part of the room price. But that is only a little grumble. Had trouble getting a table in Rydges restaurant but this worked in our favour as there are plenty of wonderful eateries close by.

Reviews.Title: “What a difference 40 years make”
Reviews.Author: JetsettingOzpatriot
Reviews.Content: It has been 40 years since I was last in Sydney and I was totally gobsmacked over the number of changes that had occurred since I last visited. Good Parts: The hotel is centrall;y located covering nearly a whole city block (George Street/Liverpool Street and Pitt Street. Staff were pleasant and helpful at all times. Rooms were nice and comfy and the king size bed was really nice to sleep on. Breakfast was good and catered for most tastes. The hotel is surrounded by pubs, cafes, restaurants, shopping arcades and is within walking distance to most of Sydney's attractions. There is a mono rail station located at World Square which is about one minute away and this services many of the attractions including Darling Harbour, China Town, Paddy's Markets, Convention Centre, PowerHouse Museum, Maritime Museum, Aquatic Centre and a few others. Town Hall Railway Station is about 300 metres away up George Street as is the Town Hall, Queen Victoria Building, City of Sydney RSL, Kristy Kreme Donuts as well as hundreds of other boutique stores, cafes, bars etc. The nearest internet cafe is in the shopping arcade next to the hotel (2 to choose from) and another 100 metres up George Street. Bad Parts: Check in time isn't until 2:00 pm and check out is 12:00 pm unless you want to pay an extra $50.00 to stay until 3:00 pm. Whilst the rooms were clean the hallways were musty. It took a long time to get the room made up each day, some times as late as 3:00 pm so it may be advisable to leave the "Please Make Up Room" sign on the door. The rooms facing Liverpool Street were a bit noisy especially when an ambulance or police car went by with sirens blaring which was quite often. At breakfast they did not have a dedicated egg station instead you had to order your eggs from the waiter and this was a bit difficult at times because many of them did not speak English all that well.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Functional, Great bed!"”
Reviews.Author: Britpop73
Reviews.Content: Clean, welcoming, got upgraded to a big family room as they had run out of non-smoking rooms! Gym is small but great for a quick workout before the business day starts - a few running and step machines, free weights and a few machines...good enough! Breakfast is good and well priced at $15 if you are a priority guest member - join before you book (free) and you save on rates and meals while staying. They also have a $5 toast and espresso express breakfast too! Room was modern, clean, comfy and the usual standard identikit room of most chains. Location was okay too! Basically, this place does everything you expect from a business class hotel. Not as flash as the Westin, not as basic as an Ibis...somewhere middle of the road and respectable.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great hotel to stay in”
Reviews.Author: fraserprincess
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay at Rydges World Square we stayed in Executive King, Beds are great , bar fridge not expensive, location is great, and must say we really enjoyed the breakfast buffet and the evening drinks and nibbles. Staff were very friendly and all we came in contact with seemed happy to be there. we will stay there again its very well run

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location and thats about it”
Reviews.Author: RTWTraveller2009
Reviews.Content: A memorable stay in Sydney over the New Year, more so because of the fantastic firework display at the harbour than the five days at the hotel. Whilst it ticked the boxes - close tpo the harbour and shops, clean, reasonable sized rooms, no booking in or checking out hassle, there was nothing especially memorable about this overpriced place. Particularly irksome were the timed internet charges. So many of the 50 odd places we have stayed at in the last 3 months offered a free internet service, yet the Rydges is still trying to squeeze that extra buck from what is now a basic facility.

Reviews.Title: “Refreshingly nice”
Reviews.Author: Reptonix
Reviews.Content: Checked in quickly, and went straight up to room. Unfortunately it smelled rather like an ashtray as it was a smoking room. There must have been millions of cigarettes in that room over the years. Receptionist kindly offered to move rooms and it was done quickly and efficiently. Rooms are nice enough, can be a long walk to them in the hotel itself. Service staff are friendly and FAST. Asked for new towels, had them 3 minutes later. The hotel is also in a good central location, and unlike nearby hotels/apartments, has plenty of elevators to go around. You don't need to wait 10 minutes just for an elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: thedarf
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at about 10am to register our bags as we were sure it was too early to check in. The very efficient and friendly team at the concierge's desk were very helpful. Even though they were very busy they still had time for a genuine 'Hello' to us not just some organisationally mandated greeting. Upstairs at check in Dominic was very helpful in seeing to our needs; we were unable to check in as our room wasn't ready. As we expected this, it was no big deal for us however Domonic did everything he could to try and get us a room even though we were quite happy to have a walk around (wet) Sydney and grab some lunch. Dominic put some valuables in the hotel safe for us and assured us our room would be ready on our return. He even said if we decided to return early he would make sure our room was ready if we phoned first. The concierge gave us some tips of where to go to eat and sight see, these proved to be spot on. On our return our room was ready so we went upstairs. The room was spotlessly clean and in immaculate condition. The bed was literally 'to die for' it was so comfortable. Everything during our stay was just great, from late night drinks in the Square Bar to breakfast in the Sphere Restaurant each morning. The eggs to order each morning was a delight and they made perfect poached eggs; soft and runny. Not like the tennis balls from other places. Even checkout was a breeze, we had late checkout and took full advantage of it.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Bumblebee30
Reviews.Content: Clean, spacious family room, staff were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast a little disappointing, little fruit, and some hot things werent that nice. Very convenient location, 2 min walk to monorail station. Had a great time, nice hotel to stay in. Beds very comfortable, great nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: Taniwha_Blue
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at Rydges World Square for a few days in December as a stopover between the UK and NZ to catch up with friends. We found the room to be very spacious with all the facilities we needed and the location easily walkable (if young and fit) from the harbour (perhaps 20 mins). Lots of eateries close by. The staff were very friendly and helpful. On the negative side the bathroom was a little worn, and there was an afternoon party held on the rooftop which I believe was part of the hotel. They had put a notice under our door to let us know and apologising for any inconvenience, but while jetlagged and wanting a bit of peace and quiet it was annoying. All in all a good stay and we'd probably stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty much an enjoyable stay, if only the carpet was cleaner”
Reviews.Author: asimplejazzlover
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Rydges World Square for 3 nights and I have to say it was one pleasant stay. I tried to check in earlier than the normal check in time since my flight arrived in Sydney at about 8AM but unfortunately I couldn't get the room earlier. The receptionists were all very friendly and they seemed to put the efforts to accommodate me with the room earlier, which eventually they couldn't!! But after all, I truly appreciated their efforts. Let's get started with the room. It is a clean modern room with decent space to "breathe" especially if you're traveling with partners. The bed is very much comfortable to sleep on, I had a deep sleep!! I love the pillow options too. The bathroom is fitted with a tub as well as amenities provided. I didn't use the facilities in this hotel so I can't really say much about it here. Talking about location, Rydges is a nice base to explore Sydney. It is located in the city centre so it is fairly easy to walk to almost everything. There are many restaurants outside the hotel, so I strongly suggest you to leave the restaurants in the hotel and go outside to try the local flavor. Juicy tips: Try Din Tai Fung restaurant just behind the hotel. They serve the world's best dumplings I've ever tasted. Succulent skin, thick juicy soup inside the dumpling and to top it off, dip in the vinegar sauce. The only drawback of this hotel is that the carpet is filthy! So many stains and I can smell the dust on the carpet! It is so sad to learn this issue because it can lever down the cleanliness standard of this hotel. If only the carpet was cleaner, the hotel would be much greater! The management really needs to look at this issue, like seriously. Other than that, I have nothing to argue.

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: Micib
Reviews.Content: We arrived on New Year's Eve and stayed 4 days. Everything was very comfortable. The hotel is in a good location - about 20 mins fast walk to the harbour. It's clean, has all the facilities you'd expect from a modern business hotel and the breakfast buffet is very good. The area around the hotel is very busy and you're about 5 mins walk from the start of the main shopping street. If I was returning to Sydney on business, I'd very happily stay here even though the area around the hotel was very busy and a bit untidy in one direction. However, I'd probably look around next time for an hotel which was a bit nearer to the harbour - when you're being a tourist in Sydney you spend a lot of time up there and might as well cut down the time spent walking through the city to get there.

Reviews.Title: “great room and location”
Reviews.Author: traveler54601
Reviews.Content: Fantastic family room with 2 en suite baths and adjoining rooms (1 king and 2 twins) perfectly accommodated for our family with 2 teens. Room was clean, housekeeping excellent, and bathrooms roomy. Linens and pillows were very comfortable. Excellent location in the Central Business District adjacent to the monorail. (Surprisingly, our cab driver did have a little trouble finding the place from the airport). Take the free 'green' bus to Circular Quay that runs on most days although we usually took the 20-30 minute walk. Front desk and concierge very attentive, organized, and helpful. Breakfast at the hotel restaurant was a bit pricey but excellent quality and selection. (Be sure to join Rydges Priority Club for discounts on room and at the hotel restaurants.) Very enjoyable and comfortable stay. My only recommendation would be to offer free wireless internet service as is found almost everywhere in the States. Sadly, the lack of complementary wireless service was not available anywhere we stayed in Australia or New Zealand. Sydney is fabulous with so much to do. Very pleasant weather in July (Winter). Enjoyed Darling Harbour, Botanical Gardens (see the Wollemi Pine), Opera House, and Sydney Harbour Bridge Climb (fantastic views, book ahead). The best variety and selection of Australian opals was found in Sydney as well. Easy connections with multiple tour outfitters for Day trip to the Blue mountains with pick-up at the hotel. Could not beat the location, quality, and amenities for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good rooms”
Reviews.Author: Birdistheword
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 days and were pleased. The hotel was well located and the rooms were clean and comfortable. The room rates weren't too bad either when we had booked them a few months earlier. Pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Far better hotels nearby”
Reviews.Author: Kuddles_the_Kat
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Rydges World square for 3 nights in November. The bill was picked up by my company so I didnt have to pay for it. The staff smiled a lot but ultimately didnt really seem to have much idea what was going on. I think most of them only had English as their second language. I was hoping to find a swimming pool at the hotel, when I asked the ever smiling asian girl behind the desk where the pool was located she kept smiling and said 'Olympic Park sir' Room itself was pretty comfortable and clean. Not much of a view from the window. Yes its a city centre hotel but I've stayed in others nearby and the views consisted of more than just an office block. Laundry facilites were very poor (and unlike most other hotels you had to pay for them) I think there was something wrong with the heat settings on the washer, I washed my Brisbane Broncos footy jumper (size XL) in there and by the time it came out it would have fitted GI Joe. Most of the clientele were cabin crew from Korean Air, the lack of actual paying guests seems to speak volumes. Very ordinary brekky, my piece of toast was well below the size of any other slices of toast I have ever had All in all I was stoked when it was time to check out. I have suggested to my company we use alternative hotels next time we are in Sydney. 4/10 for this one ..it would have been 3 but the bathroom was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay again”
Reviews.Author: Aussiemum2twins
Reviews.Content: The good : position , in the heart of Sydney. Breakfast is always good at Rydges but the best Rydges for breakfast is North Sydney. Staff do fix problems if requested. The Bad: Dirty rooms. They clean the bathroom surfaces and the sheets are clean but the rest is just filthy. They don't vacuum under furniture or under the beds. The carpet is filthy, the windows are filthy, the walls have thick layer of dust. There were used tissues and potato chips under furniture. Noisy room even though I requested a quiet room. Had no view at all , was placed right next to another building airconditioning units which sounded like a 747 all night. I sleep with the window open as I prefer fresh air from air conditioning but had to keep window shut due to noise. The valet parking is $35 a day and it is a bit of a nuisance having to get a check out to get to your car just to get something out of it. I really felt like I was in 3 star accomodation , it was very basic. Check in is a nightmare, you have children waiting for ages. Even though I was a "priority member" there is no such thing as fast check in at Rydges. Stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Best location for a Sydney stay”
Reviews.Author: Atreides77
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The service and staff were very efficient and friendly, always with a smile and courteous attitude which most other places do not offer. The lobby is extensive and inviting with excellent access to the city and local transport. We would highly recommend this hotel and look forward to our next stay here soon.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic---- Dont hesitate to stay here.....”
Reviews.Author: curatokid
Reviews.Content: A good location ten minutes walk Darling Harbour and so covenient for the whole city, staff very helpful, I sometimes think its the way that you speak to them that they respond to, shops under hotel include supermarket (Coles) and Off Licence together with loads cafes and restaurants, cab from airport about 30 dollars, dont mess about with shuttles that cost about 12 dollars each. the first room we were given was not very good and when I asked for another they immediately sent the porter to move my cases to another room which was excellant, Join the Rydges Club and get good rates at all Rydges Hotels, I would definately stay there again and would recomend it to anyone.......Enjoy your stay !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome again, have stayed before, would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: sall13h
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August 2009 and when we wanted to stay in Sydney again we did not hesitate to stay here. It is literally on a monorail station, 1 minutes walk from museum and is only a 5 mionute walk from Darling Harbour, the Queen Victoria Building and Central. We saw a show at the Capital Theatre while we were here, which is about a 3 minute walk which is very handy. The rooms are awesome, they are very clean and have everything you need. They are very modern and decorated nicely, with a chairs and table, desk, large bed and large flat screen tv. I will stay here everytime I come, as i can just leave my luggage and go around sydney and pick it up on departure. The staff are excellent, check in and out is so quick (we checked in at 11:30am as our room had already been cleaned) and the bar and restaurant are great. Most of all, it is the perfect location for all sydney attractions!

Reviews.Title: “Basic rooms close to many attractions”
Reviews.Author: jasmine05
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my partner in a king room for 2 nights. We were initially allocated a room which was right next to the monorail, so straight away we headed back to reception to ask for a room change. The man at reception dealt with us promptly with little fuss and allocated us to a room on a higher floor. The room was in a corner of the building and only had a small window facing other buildings, but it served it's purpose- the room was dark at night and since it didn't face onto the traffic it was very quiet. The room is very basic and you can tell the furnishings are quite old- the carpet had numerous stains & the bathroom is also quite tired looking - it was good that it had a separate shower and bath however. The tiles aren't spotless- there is some dirt/mould on the grout and the cleaning isn't that thorough. Overall the bathroom was a bit dirty/not really a nice relaxing environment... so I didn't even contemplate using the bath to soak in. Also I rang housekeeping at about 9pm to ask for some different pillows (as we found the feather pillows provided to be quite uncomfortable). Noone at housekeeping answered so reception answered- the lady didn't appear to know anything about the pillow menu available & said she would check with housekeeping- she then rang me back and advised that all the pillows had already been checked out by other customers. I found this to be very strange as there was 5 different pillows to choose from- surely they would have 1 left?! Not really sure if she actually did check for me. Apart from that, the bed was comfortable and the sheets appeared to be clean. We didn't eat at the hotel & didn't use any of their other facilities. Overall I would still recommend this hotel if you want basic accomodation & would like to be in the city centre close to attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: kaja2
Reviews.Content: Booked through hotels.com and specified a non-smoking room. When we checked in at 6pm we were told there was no non-smoking room available. Spoke to a manager at the desk, but got nowhere. They placed a smoke-removing machine in the room for an hour, but smoke smell remained. Thankfully we were only staying one night. They did give us a free pass to the "executive lounge," which had free internet and happy hour, but this was not much compensation. On the plus side, the bed was quite comfortable. However, we will not stay at any Rydges properties in the future.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: 2beeMerseyside
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel following a cruise, on a rival we were allocated our room even though we were early. We had a problem at reception regarding how we should pay, I found the receptionist very unhelpful and not prepared to listen, this was not the young lady that booked us in but her colleague, we were then past on to the assistant manager, what a difference this young man could not do a enough for us and sorted out the problem,we encountered a problem regarding our online check in, once again the young man saved the day. I would just like to thank Mr Jeremy Black the assistant manager for his help, and what turned out to be a very pleasant stay.This is the sort of young man you need at front of house to greet your guests I would recommend this hotel as it is in a excellent location for all the things Sydney as to offer. George Hunter

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: squidgybutt
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight mid week and couldn't be happier with the place. The staff were friendly and efficient, the rooms were well kept and clean, and the rates reasonable. Am a Rydges Priority Guest member, and booked online, and received a discount for both, so the room rate was good enough value, especially given the location, which is right in the heart of Sydney. Of course, being in the heart of Sydney means driving there was a pain, but the valet parking was a nice touch (even though we had to pay for the parking space which I kind of object to, if your staying in the hotel). The monorail stops right outside, which it makes it easy to get around, and it's a short walk to Darling Harbour. There was one glitch with the staff, albeit a minor one. The tv in the kids room didn't work, and when I told the lady behind the desk she said she would get someone to have a look at it. They never did turn up, but that was no big problem, the tv in the main bedroom worked ok, and we were there for only one night. Might have gotten annoying if it was a longer stay. Didn't eat in any of the restaurants, so couldn't tell you what they are like. One other thing to be aware of, this hotel does have a gym, but DOES NOT HAVE A POOL. Again, not a big problem, but it would have been nice for the kids. Overall, it was a very pleasant stay, and reasonable value. Would highly recommend this hotel, and will be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay in a brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: louisethegenie
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at Rydges at the beginning of December whilst staying in Sydney for a wedding. We chose it because it was conveniently located for most of the attractions in Sydney and was near train stations. It was also significantly cheaper than most of the other city centre hotels. We arrived at about 9am having flown in from the UK. This was well before check-in and check-out time but the lady on reception managed to get us a room within about half an hour and this was greatly appreciated. The room was very clean with a very comfortable king size bed. The only annoying things we found were that you had to pay extra for internet access and the bar in the hotel closed really early. These issues didn't affect our stay much though and we would certainly stay at Rydges again. It is a functional, city centre, hotel which serves its purpose very well.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, Service and Attention to Detail”
Reviews.Author: FLYPerth
Reviews.Content: My partner and I travel alot, and have seen all there is to be see in all different types of hotels. This was our first time at the Rydges World Square in Sydney, and we throughly enjoyed our stay. The beds are out of this world, was looking for a brand on the mattress, but couldnt find it! I want one for my own bedroom! Check in and Check out was conducted without a problem, the young gentleman at reception was very pleasant and very welcoming. The chief concierge was always very helpful and did not miss a beat in greeting everyone that walk passed him! The restaurant reccomendation was fabulous (even though he at first suggested us to go to the Hotel's Restaurant). We would stay here again in the future, and would like to recommend this hotel to any traveller - either business or pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Night in the Heart of the CIty”
Reviews.Author: sailormod
Reviews.Content: This was my first time at Rydges World Square, and I was very impressed. I stayed in the city because of a function I was attending, and didn't want to drive home, or catch a packed bus of Christmas revellers. Check in was seamless, the room was as neat as a pin, everyone was friendly, courteous and welcoming, and even though the hotel was in the heart of the city, for a Saturday night, it was very quiet. Breakfast was fine, and a late checkout - 11am, meant one didn't have to rush. I've got an early morning flight coming up in March, and I can see myself returning here pre flight. Thanks Rydges, your staff are world class, and the service overall was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “I want one of these beds!!”
Reviews.Author: caplet
Reviews.Content: We had 4 nights at the Rydges and thoughly enjoyed our stay. The beds are amazing, the best I have ever slept in. Location is excellent. Close to monorail, shops and a 5minute walk to train station. We had club room access and was slightly disappointed with this. The room is very small and not really relaxing. The range of drinks on offer was good but the snacks and breakfast choice was quite limited. The bar in the lobby sells really nice wines at good prices.

Reviews.Title: “great location, good service”
Reviews.Author: ernern
Reviews.Content: It's been only 2 days since i checked out.. so i guess the memory is still fresh on my mind. After reading a few reviews, i was quite puzzled about the bad experience some of you have encountered. Since we stepped into the hotel, the bell boy was more than willing to help us take our luggage, whilst we went upstairs to check on the room availability. We were early(9am), so both rooms were not ready. We were told that the rooms would be ready by 2pm. The only thing i'm not so happy about is that our family room is only ready at around 4pm, instead of the original 2pm as agreed. also internet access was quite confusing. If you had plugged in 2 different laptops in the same room, you'll be charged twice, but the reception waived the extra charges immediately when you notified them. If you are a priority member, you pay only AUD11 per day for internet access, which is pretty cool. On the whole we received good /warm services from all the staffs in the hotel, and one of my friends lost the card, which was replaced without charge. I would definitely go back, if i visit Sydney again. The location is great, near to supermarket, train station, monorail, eateries, etc... Price is very reasonable and hotel security is also quite good. I must really commend on the concierge ( different gentlemen for each days) ,who have helped in giving us great suggestions and directions on places that we want to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic bed, good location but POOR service”
Reviews.Author: forgot10
Reviews.Content: It was a 6-day-holiday with my wife in Sydney. Bad: It was my first booking with Rydges, so I also applied for the member card. When I made the booking, I was told by the website/email that I can collect my member card when I came in for my first stay. However when I checked in at the Hotel, staff told me that they didn't have any member card for customer to collect and customers don't need the card anyway. A little bit confusing. I still haven't had my card now anyway. I booked almost 3 months in advance and asked for one thing in the comments that I want a room that is away from the lifts. However when I came to the hotel, my room is the first room that you will see when you step out from the lifts. When I asked for change, I was refused by the easiest excuse "fully booked". Very very disappointed. I was invoiced for extra mini bar usage after a few days checked out. However I didn't use anything from the mini bar at all. When I called up to clarify, the staff agree to cancel the charge straight away without asking a thing, which makes me feel that's really dodgy. Good: We booked a King bed room. I have to say the bed is huge and very comfy. Location is good. Close the train station and bus. Close to Chinatown. Plenty of restaurants around. Supermarket, bakery, internet cafe, Asian shop are downstairs. However not in walking distance to waterfront. Pretty good price with the member deal.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel and location !!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dacougr32
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Rydges for 9 nights on our trip to Sydney in Nov. Great location and great price for a downtown hotel. The room was very nice, king bed, flat screen TV and the staff was very helpfull. Hotel is only 2 blocks from subway stop so we took subway from Airport directly to this hotel which worked great. An easy walk to Darling Harbor from hotel, Hyde Park etc.... There is a grocery store on-site so you can stock up on your snacks.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families, also good location”
Reviews.Author: SwedenBengt
Reviews.Content: Great hotels for families. Family rooms are very good value. BEDS ARE VERY COMFORTABLE and it is very nice to have a large separate room for the children with there own flat screen tv. Consider another hotel if you can find one even closer to circular kay with the same nice family rooms, otherwise choose Rydges World Square. Make sure to book the breakfast before arriving, will save you a lot of AUD. The same applies to all hotels in OZ as I understand it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family rooms”
Reviews.Author: Swissie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 nights with our teenage children. Booked a package directly with the hotel which included valet parking and breakfast for everyone. Recommend booking directly through the hotel website - I couldn't get this fantastic price through any other website. Very spacious rooms, king size bed in the main room and two single beds in the other room (off the main room). Bathroom was very spacious (bath and shower) off the main room. Only issue with room is that the bathroom could do with a good clean to get rid off the mould in the grout of the shower and floor tiles and around the shower recess. Apart from the that the room was clean. Beds were extremely comfortable! Breakfast was very nice, except for the coffee and tea (they used very poor quality coffee and there were no teabags supplied - just pre-made tea). Overall a great stay for very good value (as long as you get a package deal)!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for Asian Food”
Reviews.Author: penanghill
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel due its close location to a conference venue. It turned out to be ideally suited to our tastes, in particular the surrounding area is well stocked with some delicious asian food. We also enjoyed having the shopping centre located beneath the hotel, and we accessed a range of facilities and attractions in the nearby area as well. We booked via the website, with no hassles. We later changed our booking over the phone, this was fine as well. The taxi fare from the airport was around $30 in light traffic. There were no problems with our checkin. I was happy to pay upfront via credit card, and received my Rydges membership card when I checked in. This can be used for discounts in Sydney, including 10% off the monorail ticket price. Our room was #1919 (19th floor) which is a family suite located at the corner of the building and facing into the Liverpool / Pitt Streets intersection, overlooking the monorail. It contains a queen bed in the main bedroom, and two singles in the second bedroom. The rooms were in perfect condition, very clean, and the daily room service was excellent. The rooms do not contain any kind of kitchen facilities, however, we utilised the kettle, 4 cups, 2 glasses, and 4 teaspoons heavily! We ate our breakfast in our room based on supplies such as fruit from the supermarket, supplemented by early morning hot food purchases from the shops in Liverpool Street. We ate in Chinatown at Golden Century (expensive seafood, must book), at Wagaya in Harbour Street (Japanese with a TV screen waiter), at Din Tai Fung in World Square (twice for fantastic Taiwanese experience, must get there at opening time), and at Sea Bay in Pitt Street (very simple dumplings and soup, nothing special). The laundry is on the 12th floor. We needed 7 x $1 coins (1 for powder, 3 for the washer, 3 for the dryer). The gym is also on this level, and overlooks the Korean BBQ. We enjoyed hopping on the monorail, taking the 555 free bus to Circular Quay, walking in Hyde Park, walking to Queen Victoria Building and also to the Chinese Gardens (wonderful). We also ventured into Museum Station to access the train network. The condition of the hotel particularly good, its comfort and cleanliness could not be faulted throughout our five night stay. The staff were impeccable, and highly professional. We received the highest standard of service from the moment we arrived, till we got into our taxi for the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Good room, poor breakfast”
Reviews.Author: spudgt2
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great for a base to explore Sydney but is a 30min walk away from Circular Quay, Darling Harbour is closer. The hotel checked us in as soon as our room was free which was great as we arrived at 7am and were in our room by 10am (Which is good as check out is at that time so they must have cleaned the room fast!) The price was ok for what we got, the bathroom was ok and the bed was grand. Don't be fooled by the 'Priority' club as it is hardly priority as anyone can join and get the same benefits. We joined for the $15 buffet beakfast but I wouldn't have paid that for it. It was very mediocure and not very extensive! You are far better eating in the little cafe on Pitt Street to the right of the hotel entrance. It is far better quality, service and the food was amazing! Price comparable. The breakfast was the only down side to the hotel for us. I would stay again but only if the price was right (cheaper).

Reviews.Title: “Smelly and dirty carpet”
Reviews.Author: Bluering73
Reviews.Content: Hotel looks nice when you walk in, but as you go up to your room, your nose is filled with a strong bad carpet smell. The carpet looks old and dirty, looks like it has not been cleaned for a very long time. Bed room is roomy, bathroom is nice but again the carpet in the room is dirty and smelly. Bedroom does not get cleaned every day. We were there from Friday to Tuesday; we had to call reception to get the towels changed and get new soap and shampoo. Room was not cleaned on Sunday and Monday. On Tuesday, I had to call them and complain. A guy was sent to clean the bathroom, and change the bed sheets. To my horror he did not vacuum the room; he picked some tiny rubbish on the carpet with his fingers and walked away. So I am not surprised that the whole place stinks with that bad carpet smell and they do use vacuum much. Very disgusting and unhygienic for a room that we paid $176 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, love the Dream bed!”
Reviews.Author: Choccottie
Reviews.Content: This is our first trip to Sydney and I ended up choosing this hotel for our 3 nights stay after considering about the price and location. Upon arrival we were greeted promptly by the bellman. Check in was very smooth. Room was clean and tidy and love the bed! It is really really comfy! We had three great night's sleep after spending a long day outside. We are even thinking of getting one for our new bedroom. Location was superb too as plenty of food and shopping located just downstairs. We had dinner at the very popular Makoto sushi bar which is just around the corner. Plenty of convenience stores across the road, great place to buy supper and enjoy it back in the hotel :P Besides that, Darling Harbour, China Town, Paddy's Market is just a short stroll away. Definitely going back to this hotel again for our next trip to Sydney!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: k27672
Reviews.Content: we recently spent 3 nights at Rydges World Square, overall we found the location terrfic as were attending a function at Darling Harbour, however there were a few things that weren't up to other Rydges Hotel Standards. On arrival the valet parking area is very hard to locate and with Pitt Street being so busy we found that there isn't any assistance to get your lugage from your vehicle, off the street and into the hotel. The Concierge downstairs we found to be very abrupt and not at all friendly or helpful. Upon checking into the Hotel we found the girl at reception to be too busy to be bothered to answer our questions about directions or offer any help and it was as if we were an inconvience to her, which is a real disappointment as I have always found other staff at Rydges Hotels to be more than friendly and helpful. When we got to our room, the room absolutely stunk of cigarette smoke and was that thick you couldn't breath. I find difficult to beleive that the cleaning staff wouldn't have picked up on when they prepared the room given that the Hotel is supposedly smoke free. We requested another room and were told we would have to wait another 45-50mins for a room. After eventually receiving another room we were offered breakfast vouchers for our inconvenience. However after finally getting into our new room our lugage was not in our room as we had told it would be, after 2 phone calls to reception to ask where our lugage was, it finally arrived nearly an hour later. The beds are as you would expect having stayed at other Rydges Hotels and are very comfortable. We were on the 18th floor, and you could still hear the traffic noise. Overall the Hotel is in a great location with the monorail station nearly at your door and would probably stay here again only for the location.

Reviews.Title: “3 Nights @ The Rydges”
Reviews.Author: HelenH4
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my 12y/o son, unfortunately we were unaware this hotel was in Chinatown...as a non smoking traveller I find it uncomfortable to walk out of the hotel into a fug of cigarette smoke. They Hotel gym is on a smoking floor which you need an oxygen mask to get through. The room was fine, the bathroom and toiletries were minimal, not up to the standard I would expect. The bedding was very good and the beds comfortable. The room was a very generous size as well. We ate out of the hotel with a lot of food available very close by so I cant advise on the hotel restaurants. Because the public transport system is so good in Sydney we had no trouble getting nearby links. I would only recommend this hotel if I could discuss it with the traveller. As it may not be ideal for all people and all trips.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Start To Our Trip”
Reviews.Author: RICH1981
Reviews.Content: Hotel was awwsome - simple check in, spacious rooms and FANTASTIC LOCATION.. 10 mins from Central Station and Darling Harbour, and a brisk 25 min walk to the Opera House and Harbour Bridge. I would recommend the extra Â£15 per night to upgrade to an Excutive Room, with complimentary breakfast and evening drinks and snacks... this saved my partner and I A$150 OVER 4 NIGHTS!!! When I am next in Sydney, I will return here for sure

Reviews.Title: “Great value and great location”
Reviews.Author: mucky
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem. The rooms are great, the bed is so comfortable and the location is good too. The restaurant 'special' was good value and we both thoroughly enjoyed the great service and food. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “the family room was just what we needed...”
Reviews.Author: mandaofderry
Reviews.Content: When we took our kids to Sydney in July we stayed at Rydges World Square in a family room, so the kids had their own room with their own tv. It was very close to the Monorail, and walking distance to a lot of attractions. The room was very nice and clean. The food in the restaurant was also very good. Our only complaint was the time it took for the tv in our room to be fixed.

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE”
Reviews.Author: 11lucky
Reviews.Content: Great location very nice rooms very clean and great service. I stay using rydges tokens which made it a great deal also stayed at rydge lakeside and rydges melbourne both very nice

Reviews.Title: “Location Location!”
Reviews.Author: Ang H
Reviews.Content: Well having come from the sofitel this was a little step down but stood on its own. We got our rooms for a bargain by booking early and alsso opted for the $20 upgrade to the executive floor. The rooms are a bit old and dark as our window looked out upon another building but it was comfortable all the same. Bathroom was simple but spacey. The check in is a little difficult as you have to go up a floor or two for that as the hotel is on top of a shopping centre, but that is great in its own right! If you love shopping, darling harbour and plenty of great asian food this is the place to stay for you. I love it, you walk outside at night and its just a buz of people and aromas. Paddy's is just a short walk away as is the train station. Am staying here again for an9other girlie trip in November!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location, Brilliant service, a Brilliant Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Bailey12_9
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a year in Australia and spent my last 5days with Rydges world square Sydney and really felt like I had to come on here and say how great the hotel is. The rooms are kept beautifully clean and refreshed everyday and the staff (restaurant in particular) were very friendly and helpful! The hotel is situated in a great location, within walking distance to all major attractions and concierge went out of their way to suggest places of interest and assist us with our airport transfers. Sometimes in 4 * hotels the atmosphere can be a little stuffy however this hotel is a real exception, first class hospitality but a real warm and genuine approach to customers. The food in the restaurant was of a great standard and very reasonably priced, all in all a great stay and would not hestitate to stay again when visting Sydney again! Also the beds are amazing, most comfortable nights sleep I have ever had!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: AussiePaulw
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Rydges World square and found it to be very centrally located for most major attractions in Sydney. There is a monorail station located at the hotel that will take to locations like Darling Harbour and Paddy's Markets. Rooms were roomy and bed was comfortable. Valet parking was great as front of hotel is on busy Pitt St. Breakfast was OK. The usual was available Scrambled eggs, bacon , ceral and juice etc. Did have a little trouble getting a clean cup at the coffee stand and even when new cups arrived first cup I picked up had a large red lipstick stain on it. Overall we were happy with the hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and rude”
Reviews.Author: travel_guy666
Reviews.Content: My wife was given a two night stay as a gift - a mini break from the kids for a couple of days. We live in the Northern Beaches of Sydney so it was an easy 30 minute drive on a Sunday afternoon to the hotel. Checking in at 4pm we stood directly infront of a young staff member for some time before he raised his eyes to acknowlege us and announce he wouldn't be much longer, no 'hello' etc. We were then informed that half the hotel had no hot water but an amenities room had been setup on each floor and we just had to contact reception when we wanted to use it and would that be OK!!!! NO WAY - honestly I thought this guy was trying to be funny. I insisted that hot water something we had to have we were then told to take a seat to see what he could do, no apology, no comp drinks etc - surly and rude. Ten minutes later we were told he had found a room with hot water so off we went. Our King Deluxe room was a little shy of what you will see in any marketing material - really shame on you Rydges, shame. Stained lamp shades, tired and battered furnishings, old TV, shabby bathroom complete with lots on black in hard to clean places, opressive I could go on. (Great bed though). I travel a lot with my business, both domestically and internationally, and the prospect of two nights in a hotel in my home town wasn't inspiring in the first place. After walking into that room I was ready to head for home - my wife persuaded me otherwise. Maybe we were just unlucky - for Rydges sake I hope so.

Reviews.Title: “Good value central hotel that is close to everything.”
Reviews.Author: Scubagary
Reviews.Content: We were not looking for an expensive hotel in Sydney as with only 2 nights, we intended to be out sightseeing most of time. However, we still wanted something that provided a decent room but at a good cost. We were more than happy with this hotel as only paid about Â£75 per night. Location is great and you can walk to most of the sights are at worst, it is a very quick cheap taxi ride (Sydney taxis are cheap compared to London!!). We did not use any hotel faciities so cannot really comment in that respect but overall we were happy about all aspects of our limited stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not nearly as nice as the website makes it out to be”
Reviews.Author: gildat20
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed with this hotel. The website leads you to believe that the hotel is much nicer then it really is. Seriously, Iâ€™ve stayed in Motel 6â€™s nicer then this place. The good: Central location Large, comfy beds and pillows Large, flat-screen TV The bad: It is not a good place to stay on a Friday or Saturday night if you enjoy your rest, there were loud, annoying drunk kids choking the streets, downstairs bars/restaurants and hallways. Our room wasn't particularly noisy, but our friends in a room down the hall had to take sleeping pills and wear earplugs to drown out the weekend noise. There was no chest of drawers in the room, a luxury youâ€™d appreciate when staying in a hotel for a week (as we were) Our non-smoking room smelled like smoke. The hallways were even worse. The room was very dimly/depressingly lit. On certain days, we wouldnâ€™t be able to watch certain T.V. channels. They tried to charge us for internet that we didnâ€™t use and our friends for a $30 breakfast that they didnâ€™t order.

Reviews.Title: “Stay anytime tokens no good for singles or friends”
Reviews.Author: AninaBlueMountains
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here last week. I had purchased some Rydges Stay Anytime tokens for prepaid stays, and the publicity indicated that I would also be offered a room upgrade at time of arrival and a late checkout. The downside is that twin rooms cannot be purchased with these tokens- you have to pay an extra surcharge which was certainly NOT disclosed when I bought them. That is unfair for friends travelling together. No upgrade was offered and checkout was the normal time. When we got back later after the opera we found the TV did not work- who wants to wait around for repairs in the middle of the night! When we reported it the next morning and also asked for the morning paper we had been promised it took 1 hour for anyone to turn up. On the plus side the position is good, the beds are as good as everyone says, the room was small but clean and quiet. This could be a good deal for couples but don't expect anything more than a no frills place. Staff seemed very nice but did not follow through on promises. By the time you add on the surcharge there are better value places to stay for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and room”
Reviews.Author: jcaptain
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Rydges World Square for 3 days in July with spouse and 2 grandkids. We reserved a "Family Room" which was 2 connected rooms separate baths and it worked out well for us. The hotel itself is clean and modern and within walking distance of most of the attractions and close by the central train station. The beds are fantastic!! The front desk and concierge were very helpful with any questions. Be sure to join the priority guest club for the extra discounts available. As to the rating I've given, I find it very hard to give any hotel a "5" so consider it a strong "4". We would definitely book again!

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay!”
