Reviews.Author: Ade B
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at Rydges at a bargain rate picked up from a newspaper advert - Aus$95 a night. Log on and become a priority guest to get best deals. We had dinner there 2 nights to take advantage of the $25 2 two course meal with as much house wine as you wanted - a real bargain, as wine in restaurants is so expensive. We used public transport the whole time to get around. Got a $17 day ticket to use bus, train and ferries. Concierge supplied useful info on this too. Really easy and good value and the hotel is well placed for this too. Couldn't have had a better stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: SkywatcherAdelaide
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent three nights in this hotel after taking a 'Mystery Stay' on the 'needitnow' website. We couldnt' have been happier. The room was wonderful and the service from all staff - in particular your Concierge was fantastic. The value Dinner meal deal ($25 per head for two courses) was amazing value with top class cuisine. The bed was extremely comfortable and the option of your choice of pillow as an over the top luxury. Would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Hotmirchi
Reviews.Content: We had an exceptional stay and must thank everyone who helped us including the concierge reception and delightful Kara Conroy who was great and gave us that extra special treatment in making our stay the best of all of the hotels we stayed in Australia. Worth pre registering (free) as a Priority Member for extra benefits including a later check out. Room was clean and comfortable - nicely decorated and location is great as it is walking distance from the Opera Houses and the Bridge. Go to Paddy's Market which is open Thur - Sun for cheap souvenirs...you can haggle and get better prices for the same stuff sold in the shops! Darling Harbour is great for restaurants. If you go on the Blue Haze Mountains tour - TAKE WATERPROOF CLOTHING! Exceptional hotel, comfortable and clean rooms, delicious breakfasts, great location and fantastic staff. What more could you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and a pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: chris036
Reviews.Content: Rydges World Square is a perfect base for touring Sydney: from here you're never far from anything by foot (which is the best way to see the City) - Museum metro station 2min, Darling Harbour 10min, Hyde Park 5min, The Rocks & Opera House 20min. It's actually smack bang in the centre of the Japanese & Korean districts, which is no bad thing, you'll be spoilt for choice when it's dinner time!! This was my main consideration when booking, however I wasn't convinced the brand was anything special. Rest assured, when you stay here you'll be a happy bunny. Staff are professional and knowledgeable, rooms are functional, spacious, quiet and well appointed, breakfast is excellent and plentiful (I had exec breakfast on 21st floor, which was also very nice), room service is affordable and quick, and the entire hotel feels well looked after and, more importantly, secure. One thing, the hotel is not very high up, so the views are limited and mostly obscured, I managed a reasonable view from floor 21 (it's not 21 from the ground though, there are several numbers missing!!). Finally I couldn't finish without mentioning the bed, which is an absolute DREAM!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, friendly staff...will be back”
Reviews.Author: Kimboz
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at Rydges World Square. Great hotel, location is excellent, walking distance to most place, has a nightlife... Bar has an open beer garden which is nice and relaxing. Close to train stations, basically in the heart of the city which makes it nice and easy for shopping or eating out. Not far from the airport, approx 20 mins drive... should not cost you more than $20AUD. Hotel is clean and service is not too bad, a little slow at time (had problem with the door handle in room).. nothing major.. had a great 3 nights stay... will be back..

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable/quiet accomodation, towards southern end Sydney CBD”
Reviews.Author: gamain
Reviews.Content: I booked on-line and if you obtain a Priority Guest card if entitles you to a discount off the on-line rack rate. When again in Sydney I will happily return to stay at the Hotel. The room was spotlessly clear and well appointed. I found that the Hotel was within 200 meters of the George St., Cinema area of Sydney and a similar distance to the southern end of Hyde Park and the China Town area.

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: tonynannb
Reviews.Content: this hotel has the lot great rooms soft beds and comfy pillows top spot

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: howhardwasthis
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at this hotel. I chose it for the price and proximity to where I had a business meeting. I was pleasantly suprised with the whole experience. The check in / check out was prompt and friendly. The room was quiet and comfortable and the breakfast was very enjoyable. There are also a number of eating,drinking and shopping options within the world square complex which is very convenient. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy beds and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: ScotiaJen
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a five night stay at the Rydges World Square. We stayed in one of the executive club floor rooms and enjoyed the option of evening drinks and breakfast served in the lounge. The location was central and within walking distance to many sites and modes of transportation. It is a busy spot but we had no worries walking around at any time of day or night. The concierge desk was helpful and were able to help us out with all of our requests. My only complaint was a bill for almost $30 for a phone call to a local cell/mobile phone.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money. "Must" visit hotel”
Reviews.Author: MateoTraveler
Reviews.Content: great place, quiet room, very clean, great service. We came early morning with 22 months daughter after 27 hrs flight from Europe. We got room shortly after 8am, with no worries. Thank you very much for that!!!. Very good location, close to all major stations, walking distance to the Quay, Opera House and all major ferries. Surely if we come back one day to Sydney we'll stay again at Rydges WS. Mateo

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: DizzyLizzy80
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival (3 night stay) we were greated by the friendly receptionist who told us about the Rydges Priority Guest membership which entitled us to late check out and discounts. My husband signed up imediately and we arranged for a late check out. Which was perfect as our return flight wasn't until later on in the afternoon. The room was clean and comfortable and the bath tub was very generous in size. The location was fantastic, we walked to China Town, Darling Habour, caught the mono rail and took a ferry ride to Manly, no need for a car here. The only negative was the street noise that you could hear when you where in the room at night when you were trying to sleep. I will be returning in June 09, this time with my 2 children. Mrs Myers

Reviews.Title: “Embarressed!”
Reviews.Author: hmmcantdecide
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and i decided to stay here for my 20th birthday, we found a great deal on wotif and it was walking distance to everything. AT nights be careful walking around here, we felt unsafe walking out for dinner so we decided to stay in which i say is very expensive. My boyfriend ordered the wagyu beef ( $50 for approx 100grams) which he is a cattle farmer and was 100% sure it wasnt wagyu due to the poor marbling. When we checked in we were asked if our parents were with us and we had to show some ID to prove we were 18 which was very embarressing. We paid for breakfast however they didnt say we did on the computer so we were back and forward to the front desk, but the buffet was fabulous once we got it. The bath was a great size, but the view of another building wasnt great.

Reviews.Title: “Yes, do stay here, great stay”
Reviews.Author: Bindoon
Reviews.Content: We were thrilled with our stay at Rydges World Square and do recommend it. We booked through their own web site and got an executive floor room for two nights (a Saturday and Sunday) for $225 AUD average. We thought this was a great rate for an â€˜Executive Kingâ€™ room that gives the benefit of a light breakfast and drinks and canapÃ©s in the evening. We are Rydges Priority Members and this gave us an â€˜edgeâ€™ on their lowest internet rate. We had stayed at the Rydges World Square some years ago when it was the Avillion Hotel and liked the hotel then and the area. We flew into Sydney and come into the CBD on the rail system (easy). Got off at Museum Station and walked to the Castlereagh Street exit and the hotel is just down the hill. Our room (#2133) was modern, attractive and had a small balcony with table and chairs. It was located off a hallway with only three doors hence very quiet. The bathroom had bath and shower (minimal number of towels â€“ only negative), robes, a good size closet, desk/chair, one easy chair and ultra comfortable bed. Really the best bed of our three week holiday. The Concierge was helpful regarding where to buy a new suitcase. The drinks and canapÃ©s in the Executive Lounge was a surprise â€“ a lovely experience with a charming waiter, sparking wine (beers, red & white wines too) tasty, elegant canapÃ©s. Any â€˜freeâ€™ wine and cheese experience you have had before dims by comparison. Breakfast, also served in the E lounge was also very good.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Miss_kiwi_sydney
Reviews.Content: Rydges World Square is a fantastic hotel. We had absolutely no trouble our entire stay. The concierge and check-in staff were friendly, polite and informative. The rooms were immaculate, and the bath was big enough for my partner, who is over 6ft, to have a nice relaxing bath in! The dream beds gave me the best sleep I've had in months. The repairs and upgrades mentioned in previous comments have obviously been completed, because everything was perfect! The Buffet breakfast was huge, everything you can imagine for breakfast and everything was refilled as soon as it got low. This is by fair the nicest hotel I've stayed in and it definitely surpassed my expectations! I will stay here again many times in the future!

Reviews.Title: “No problem 2nd time "Excellent Location"”
Reviews.Author: Baba898
Reviews.Content: Came back to stay for another two nights and requested for a better room than what we had stayed in last time, The receptionist by the name (I believe Jimmy, I cannot recall), told me that the booking was done through Expedia and I need to either rebook the room or pay another US$100 per night. Before getting upset I just told him that this was not very professional response. I had not read the response to my first review yet, otherwise I would have asked for Tish "the General Manager". Room was cleaner this time but size was still small for the family of 4. Hotel is located in the midst of everything. It is walking distance to QVB, Pitt Street Mall and Darling Harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: hfba
Reviews.Content: We booked for a 3 night stay in an executive King room, and were very satisfied with the room. The added bonus was access to the executive club with an excellent complimentary breakfast served there and complimentary drinks and canapes in the evening. The staff could not be faulted in their efforts to make our stay comfortable. The location of the hotel right above a monorail station and just a short walk to the underground railway, and the fact that it is in walking diatance of shops and places like Chinatown make this an ideal base from which to explore Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here twice and will go back!”
Reviews.Author: Chakattack
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here in December 2008 and again in January 2009 when my family came to visit. We were impressed with our stay both times. The hotel has a great location within walking distance of many attractions, including Darling Harbour and Chinatown, and it is within a block of the Museum train station. The staff were generally helpful. We felt that the "Executive" rooms were well worth the extra money -- we stayed in a "Standard King" in December and an "Executive King" in January/February. For about $20-25 extra US Dollars per day, we got a continental breakfast each morning and snacks and drinks (including beer and wine) each evening in the "Executive Lounge" as part of the package. Overall, this saved us both money and time. However, even the regular room was great, with a fridge and hot pot in room, so that we could keep drinks and snacks in our room for a quick breakfast or snack. Of note, we found a cheaper rate than the Rydges Priority Guest rates advertised on the Rydges website by using the American site www.expedia.com. We were still allotted our Rydges Priority Guest benefits in the hotel (such as the welcome back beverage), but we could not earn points as we did not book through Rydges.com.

Reviews.Title: “Fanastic Location, excellent service and an oasis in a very busy area.”
Reviews.Author: justjanmky
Reviews.Content: We were very pleasant surprised with Rydges World Square from our first impression upon entering the reception area. Our King Executive room was very comfortable, quiet and we found the mini bar prices very comparable. We especially enjoyed relaxing in the comfy chairs at the bar at the end of a long day. It was very convenient especially to the monorail and also because of the close proximity to the World Square shopping centre and Capitol Theatre where we enjoyed seeing Guys & Dolls. We also found that as we were a Rydges Priority Guest, which we joined not long before our stay, that we received fast check-in and also 20% discount at the bar and late check-out. My husband also thought the fitness centre excellent. We look forward to staying there again soon.

Reviews.Title: “COMFORTABLE & PLEASANT”
Reviews.Author: Jackjan
Reviews.Content: I checked in using their Web check-in service done when booking made on line. I was able to get a room on the 19th floor without delay (well before check-in time of 2 pm). My luggage was delivered to the room very promptly. This is a 4* property located at the World Square development but still in (longish) walking distance of Circular Quay. The room facilities included the normal tea/coffee supplies, a small refrigerator, flat screen TV (the remote control button for volume was stuck - I called their housekeeping staff and a replacement remote arrived in less than 5 minutes). Internet connection VERY GOOD AIR CONDITIONING in the right place for me as I like to sleep in a 'fridge' rather than be too hot. The bed was firm and very comfortable, enough storage space, the bathroom had a normal size bath plus a separate shower with glass door. Hot water supply was excellent. Towels were absorbant and fluffy.My room looked on to other concrete buildings but we can't all have a view. There were 3 price range for breakfast, bakery $15.00 and the other 2 up to $30 odd. Some lower category properties nearby had a cooked breakfast for under $20. In the World Square area, just a few steps out the back door of hotel there are plenty of cafes serving breakfast. Even McDonald's and Hungry Jack's nearby which are open 24 hrs. When I made booking on line I was given a Rydges Priviledge card which has discount on meals whether in house or not. In the World Square there are plenty of 'normal' shops, supermarket not just high priced clothing shops. I have some 'photos but not smart enough to attach

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great accomdations!”
Reviews.Author: ktreptr
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Rydges Wold Square and had a wondeful experience. The hotel, accomodations and location were excellent. This is a wonderful place to stay in Sydney for value and convenience!

Reviews.Title: “worst bed ever”
Reviews.Author: Matt78Melbourne
Reviews.Content: After terrific 8 nights at the Rydges in Christchurch we decided to join the â€œRydges priority guestâ€™ program. Since then we stayed at the Rydges twice; once in Canberra and last weekend in Sydney. Both times the same experience: extremely old (big) rooms, stained carpets and everything but a â€œdream-bedâ€�!! The room did have a cheap flat-screen thoughâ€¦ The Rydges managemt Team should take some courses in customer loyalty. They can have my â€œpriority guest cardâ€� back.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Janesse
Reviews.Content: I had read a couple of reviews of the great beds in this hotel but that must only be in the executive suites because ours was horrible! Worst sleep of our entire holiday which was very unfortuante because I had specifically chosen this hotel to relax in and have a good sleep after travelling to Sydney from Canada. The rooms was dated and in need of a lift, particularly the bathroom. The location was decent enough, it's a bit of a walk to the Quay and the Rocks but that was fine for us. The hotel was just OK....if I was staying in Sydney again I would defintiely pick a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ideally located but unfortunate experience”
Reviews.Author: BongSerrano
Reviews.Content: What Rydges Dream Bed? There was no mention of it during our entire stay. There was no interest whatsoever in the fact that this was our first time in Sydney. (We could have spent more money in the city had we been engaged on our interests at all.) Reception is quite unfriendly and tight lipped. (Are they trained to be as such? If so, it has no semblance of "hospitality" whatsoever.) I would expect this with certain parts of Europe but not with Australians in Sydney, or so I thought. We stayed for 8 nights in a room with no view and cigarette burns on the carpet and writing table. Borrowing a power adapter from reception was difficult with the staff spending more time indicating the cost of $25.00 if were not to return it as opposed to presenting positively the opportunity to be of help. (We bought our own from the local dollar store for $10.00.) Housekeeping did not regularly stock the room with a complete set of amenities such as lotion and wash cloths. Using the laundry facility on the 12th floor is like using a sauna - There's no ventilation for the dryer and it floods the floor with discharged water! Reception did not have the information on how to call collect to North America from the room. (I ended up using my mobile phone to call North America.) We dined at the restaurant where there were only 3 customers being served. We got seated at a nice table in the middle of the restaurant and then asked to move to an obscure side next to the serving area - after having been seated already. We ordered medium rare steaks and medium steaks respectively but got medium and medium well instead. (Definitely not worth the $35.00 we paid each plus the bottle of Merlot that we enjoyed.) The server was quite disengaging when trying to make conversation. The hotel itself is ideally situated in the city but my overall experience above is quite unfortunate. It's good to be home in Canada!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptionally Well Trained Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Doug95B
Reviews.Content: My first time in Australia was made all the more memorable by my 10 night stay here. As a former manager in the hotel industry I like to think I have a descerning eye. I arrived at Rydges on a Sunday several hours before check-in, and only had to wait less than an hour to receive my room, a blessing after 17 hours of flying! I was very much impressed with the hotel and the room, although small, well appointed. I cannot say enough about the friendly professionalism of the staff, always greeting me with a smile and willing to assist whenever needed, even responding to leaving the daily newspaper (of my choice) outside my door! my first experience in Australia and with Rydges were indeed memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel close to everything”
Reviews.Author: yorbeb
Reviews.Content: After reading so many negative reviews it was with great trepidation that we booked a 2 night stay (based on price). We had advised that we would be arriving early and would appreciate a little earlier check-in, to our amazement we arrived at 10.30 and went straight to our room. I could not fault the staff they were particularly friendly. The rooms were relatively small but definitely clean and comfortable with a king size bed (what more do you need anyway?}. Location terrific, train from airport, station really close. We could walk everywhere, Darling harbour, Opera House, Rocks, Circular Quay etc, though train and monorail easy option as well for those less inclined to walk. I would definitely stay again, and would recommend to family and friends. Thank you Rydges for a great weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay and Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: hangar2jo
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at this hotel for the weekend. Nice 2 night stay. Hotel is in great location. We took the train from the airport and got off at the station nearest the hotel - only a 2 minute walk and there it was. Chinatown just down the road. Darling harbour just 5 minutes walk. Monorail right outside the door and train station 2 blocks away - what more could you want. We booked an executive room with access to executive lounge for breakfast and night time nibbles and drinks. Check in on arrival was fast and effiecient. The room was on the 19th floor and very quiet and had everything that is expected. The breakfast at the executive lounge was more than adequate with selection of drinks, toast, cereals, fruit, pastries etc.......and appears they have taken on board a previous review re waiting for cutlery etc as it is now on the table ready and waiting. The nibbles and drinks were also nice (although the first night the lounge was full - but we were directed straight down to the lobby bar, where on our arrival we were greeted and given drinks of our choice and nibbles). This was a good place to sit and people watch.......so we did not mind at all. The staff in all departments are friendly and the taxi we ordered the night before for a very early morning pick-up arrived on time. For location and value I would stay here again for sure. PS: The 'dream' bed - is 'dreamy', and the pillows are like sleeping on clouds.......

Reviews.Title: “Positively Average”
Reviews.Author: rafkam
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here for four nights over new year. For some stupid reason I left it until only 2-3 months before booking a hotel room: bad mistake! By then most hotels were either full or charging an exorbitant rate for that period. Enter the Rydges, which was the only central Sydney hotel offering fairly good rates over that period. So the choice was really made for us and we couldn't be picky. Having read about it, I signed up for Rydges Priority Club, which gives you discounts on the rates (and a few other perks, like free welcome drinks, late checkout and discounts on food and drinks at the hotel). We decided to pay a little extra for an executive room, which is on a higher floor and gives access to the executive lounge on the 20th floor, where you have a free light breakfast and free drinks and snacks between 5-7pm. We arrived early in the morning to hear that our room wasn't ready yet, and we should come back at 2pm. Whilst this was their standard policy, I thought they could have perhaps make an effort and try to get the room ready a little earlier. Nevermind, we left the bags with the concierge and went about our day. We came back later and were assigned a room on the 21st floor. Apart from this minor displeasure, the reception staff were always extremely friendly, courteous and helpful. The room was nice and spacious enough, and the "dream bed" really deserves its name, as it is positively sumptuous. There was a modern (and large) flatscreen TV and the bathroom was clean and spacious. However, we faced a concrete wall and consequently the room was very dark, even in the brightest days. The next day we asked to be moved and were attended by an extremely helpful trainee manager (Peter?), who not only changed the room, but also upgraded us to a suite! This was an extremely nice gesture, especially since we would have been quite happy with an equivalent room with a little more of a view! Top marks there. The executive lounge system, however, was a bit mesmerizing. The lounge is staffed by a single employee, and whilst the food is displayed in a buffet, there are no glasses, drinks, or cutlery on display. You have to sit, and wait for the extremely overworked waiter to come and set your table, then ask what you would like to drink, and finally, come back 5 minutes later with your drink. This system meant that we ended up spending twice as long as we wanted/needed to at the lounge (which, by the way, is also too small and becomes full at peak times). Here's a suggestion to management: have two employees there permanently, and lay out the drinks and glasses at the buffet. That way, the waiters can concentrate exclusively on setting and clearing the tables and getting people's room numbers. It was a bit sad and funny at the same time watching other guests piling up on the free food/drinks in the afternoon. It looked like some people were relying on that for their main meal! We had mixed feelings regarding the concierge desk too. It seemed like they were constantly busy (understaffed?) and I had the feeling they would gladly make bookings, but I wouldn't want to rely on their recommendations. On one occasion, a bell captain was filling in for the concierge and told us Cafe Sydney didn't take any bookings. The next day, we showed up at this restaurant and only got a table by luck, as it turns out reservations are actually essential there! And it's not like this is an unknown restaurant, on the contrary, it's probably one of the best known in Sydney and therefore the concierge (or his replacement) should have known this. Location wise, while this is not exactly like being on Circular Quay, it was still very good. There's a monorail station right under the hotel, and it's only 2 blocks to the bus stop from which you can catch buses to Bondi, Paddington, King's Cross, Watson's Bay... In the immediate vicinity of the hotel you will find many 24h convenience stores, a cinema and many (mostly Korean) so-so restaurants. The credit card surcharge (expecially hefty if you pay by Amex) is an unwelcome surprise at checkout. Are they trying to set a trend here? I hope not, as it gave me a downmarket feeling, as if I were booking a flight with a budget airline. It's worth staying here if you get a good rate, but I would rate this hotel more like a 3.5 star.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad, but could have been a LOT better! Don't pay the rack rate!!!”
Reviews.Author: Cris_P_Bacon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Rydges World Square Sydney for 4 nights. I got a decent rate by booking it through an extremely helpful friendly lady on a travellers helpdesk at Sydney Domestic Airport. She told me that the Rydges group had recently taken it over and pumped big bucks into it. She got me a good deal. I had previously looked at this hotel, both on the Rydges website and on wotif.com but found the prices to be a bit expensive, especially as this hotel is not really that close to the usual Sydney attractions of the Bridge, the Opera House and the Rocks. The hotel is on Pitt, one of the main routes through the CBD. It has a monorail station right outside and is also handy for places such as the Haymarket, Darling Harbour, China Town and Paddys Markets (open at weekends) I got a taxi from the airport to the hotel as I had some heavy luggage and the nearest rail station (Town Hall) is a 10 minute walk away. On arrival I eventually found the reception (upstairs on the first floor via the escalator) I didn't notice any signs, the concierge on the downstairs desk told me where it was. The nice lady at the airport told me that check in was at 2pm. I was early getting to the hotel (got there just before 1 pm) The hotel didnt seem overly busy and was a big place, so I was hopeful of getting to my room before 2pm and dumping my bags off. The reception staff were smiling and polite but sadly told me I couldnt check in early as 'My room wasn't ready'. However they told me I could leave my bags with the concierge who would take them straight up to my room as soon as it was ready. I made my way back down to the concierge on the ground floor, told them my name and room number and duly left my 3 suitcases with them, which they tagged up and gave me a receipt for. I then went for a walk around the surrounding streets. There were a myriad of pubs, restaurants (mostly Korean but a couple of Japanese) and plenty of convenience stores (most of which were open 24 hours and were well stocked) all within a couple of minutes from the hotel. I came back to the hotel about an hour later (bang on 2pm) and went up to reception. The same smiling Oriental receptionist lady that I had spoken to earlier told me that sadly my room still wasn't quite ready and to come back in about 15 minutes. 30 minutes later I came back and the same lady told me that my room was finally ready. I was on the 3rd floor. I had asked for a smoking room, and I got one. She rang concierge who said that my bags were on the way up. Lift access and room door activation are all controlled by card readers. I made my way up in the lift and followed signs to my room. I eventually managed to get in on the third attempt as my card didnt seem to work first time. this may have been error on my part as I didnt have any problems afterwards. On entering the room I was pleased to find it was a good size, nice and clean, King size bed, decent TV set and a nice ensuite bathroom with towels and complimentary soaps, shampoos etc etc I was less than impressed to find out that only 1 of my 3 items of luggage had made it to the room. I immediatley went down in the lift to ask the concierge where the other 2 were. We eventually found them locked up in a back room. I also quickly discovered that English wasn't this concierges first language. I took both my bags up to my room myself via the lift. Back in the room I decided to go outside on the balcony for a smoke. There were no chairs or tables outside and the balcony itself was very dirty. There were numerous discarded cigarette butts outside from the previous occupants, with lots of other garbage stuffed down the one drain hole in the middle of the balcony. The balcony itself was pretty grotty with a 'view' of the restaurant and down into a little alley that linked Pitt St with George St The room had the usual mini bar with the usual extortionate prices for bottles of water, beers etc etc, all crammed into a small fridge. I did what most people do, removed their items and replaced them with my own that I had bought from the local convenience store for about a quarter of the price, putting theirs back in unused on the morning of my departure. The room had a jug and complimentary tea and coffee. The room was serviced daily and all the items were replaced, together with fresh towels if required. There was a laundry room next to mine. This consisted of one old washer and one older dryer. Both these machines are coin operated. I think it was 3 bucks per wash and 3 bucks per drying cycle. There was a sign up to say not to use these machines after 8pm. I wasn't impressed with the washer and the dryer didnt give you long for your money. On the second day I just washed my stuff out in the sink or bath tub and rigged it up over the bath to dry out. (on one of those nifty retractable washing lines you only ever seem to find in Oz!) I can't comment on the food at the hotel as I didnt eat there. However each morning I noticed that most breakfast trays that were left outside peoples rooms for removal were largely untouched. Clientele at this hotel are a varied mix, from single travellers to couples, but by far the most usual guests seem to be cabin crew from Korean Air. Most mornings special buses would arrive to take them off to the airport, and bring others back later. General noise levels in my room were low, I had really good nights sleep and there was no real noise from traffic outside, drunks etc etc. The king size bed was really comfortable and the telly was excellent. The shower was hot and powerful (in a cubicle) and there was also a bath (which I washed my undies in) On the final morning of my stay I got up to see the bill shoved under my door for me to check before leaving. And what a good job I did check. I paid a cash deposit at the airport, this amount had not been taken off my final bill and they had charged me for 5 nights instead of 4. Once I pointed this out with reception they quickly amended it and I paid cash before checking out. To sum up.... I quite enjoyed staying here. However I have stayed in hotels in Sydney where the service has been much much better than the Rydges, the rooms have been better and the location much better for the Bridge, Opera House and the excellent Sydney Rail network. I would expect complimentary washers and dryers at least, (certainly if I paid the rack rate) although naturally I wouldn't mind providing my own laundry powder. Also I couldnt see any pool or spa at this hotel, I previously stayed at the excellent Meriton Apartments on Pitt St (just up the road) and it was heaps better than the Rydges. If you can get a good rate on wotif (or the lady at the Domestic terminal) then this place is probably worth a stay, otherwise try somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location at a Great Price”
Reviews.Author: TweetyKwong
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights in a double double room. There were 2 extremely comfy double beds in a reasonably size room for 2 adults and 2 kids, at a great price of $176 per night on average. The washroom was spotless with a bath tub and separate shower. The concierge staff, Serhan, made us feel right at home with his warm and friendly greetings every morning.The hotel may not have the 5-star quality of Hyatt or Shangri-la, but it is a well-deserving 4.5-star hotel. We were on the so-called 16th floor, but it was really 4 floors above street level. There was not much of a view, but we were lucky enough to have a window facing outside at the street with the monorail passing by below - great fun for the kids! Street noise was minimal. Location was great, great and great! Coles supermarket in the basement of World Square came in really handy. There were several fantastic breakfast places on the ground level next to the 2 hotel entrances. There were an even wider array of restaurants around World Square for dinner - very important after hectic day out with 2 kids on toll. Joining as Rydges Priority Guest not only gave us some hotel discounts, we were also entitled to discounts on certain day tours and the monorail. Definitely value for money! BTW, we paid by credit card and the staff did convey the fees very clearly to us before payment. No issues with that!

Reviews.Title: “Liked the Location”
Reviews.Author: tarun_rati Posted by a Cleartrip traveler
Reviews.Content: Rydges World Square is a nice place to be in. The location is gud... Monorail at ur doorstep, tourist spots like Hyde park, sydney tower, darling harbour at walking distance...I even walked up to the SCG....I checked in at World Sq after my 5day stay with another Rydges Hotel : Gold Coast Intnl....So I was expecting 4-5 star luxuries, and I must say that I wasnt disappointed...... Only thing I cud hav done better was to ensure that I get b/fast with my room......which I had in GCI but not at World Square...But that wasnt a problem as Coles (a supermart) and many many rest. are right besides the hOtel.... Final word: Go for it, superb value for money.

Reviews.Title: “So close to getting a reasonable review!!”
Reviews.Author: Tricolours
Reviews.Content: I had read some fairly negative reviews about this hotel along with a few good ones and they came so close to getting a good one from me but faultered in the last hour of my 24 hour stay. I found the hotel to be pretty good up until this point with a nice business style standard about the premises. I doubt I would rate it 5 star when I compare it to the Sheraton, Westin, Park Hyatt etc but I felt it deserved a good 4.5 rating. The rooms were modern & functional without being luxurious and the check in experience and concierge were above average. We had a deluxe king room that was comfortable. We had a drink in the bar which is quite nice with pleasant surrounds. So overall they were travelling pretty well. Then came the stumble. We arrived at breakfast at 9.25 (with the buffett advertised to go to 10.30) and of the 8 or so warming bowls offering an assortment of hot food 5 where completly empty. No great problem so we enquired with the staff and where treated with absolute indifference. Several other guests also pointed this out with the same response. We were in the dining area for 40 mins and in that whole time the only thing they topped up was some hash browns. I counted 9 staff running around but yet you had guests sitting there eating toast and nothing else and these staff treating paying guests with disdain. The GM of this hotel should kick their behinds and remind them that it is these very guests who pay their salaries! I wouldn't have cared if everything was empty if one of two things happened: a) They were polite and arranged things to be refreshed or b) they were polite and offered to have something cooked fresh from the kitchen. Notice the key here is POLITE. Unfortunately bad service and practices are a reflection of the management and the GM has to wear it has his/her responibility to either belt the apathy out of them or terminate them immediately. Here is an idea terminate half of them put a rocket up the rest and I guarantee you tomorrow the apathy will be gone. Then to the final stumble. I check out and pay with my Amex, and to my disbelief they hit me with a surcharge. Now I have stayed at hotels all round the world and have never been hit with this charge. I would have thought the sort of corporate/well heeled guest is what you are trying to attract and these are the sort of people who carry Amex, so what do you do, accomodate them?? One would have thought that would be a good idea but not at Rydges - they spit at the very people they are trying to attract. Once again disdain - see how it filters through the whole organisation Mr/Mrs GM. So with me they went from getting a pretty good review for a hotel that does most things adequately to going off my radar for the future. Sad really.

Reviews.Title: “Is this Fawlty Towers?”
Reviews.Author: Lupin4
Reviews.Content: This was a most unprofessional level of service for a supposedly quality hotel. Poor service ranged from rude waiters who would not serve, to attempts to charge for mini-bar items that were not consumed. Management seems indifferent to complaints. This review does not list other problems that occurred during my stay. I shall not return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Shocking post-stay service”
Reviews.Author: yellowskyblue
Reviews.Content: Stayed Fri and Saturday night last week - and paid $306 for both nights. For the price paid, I thoroughly enjoyed my stay. I have stayed at this hotel before (and previously when it was known as the Avillion) - and enjoy its convenience to Central Station and Cinatown. After checking out, this is when my nightmare began. Two days after staying at the property, I noticed an anomilie with my Credit Card - for $110. As I was advised at check in that there was a $10 authorisation (or imprint) - I immediately checked with my bank, who informed me that Rydges World Square had an outstanding authorisation for $110. I immediately rang the hotel (late at night), asking for answers as to why the figure was so large, and how it could be reversed quickly. I was not given an answer why there was an authorisation for $110 - but was told the quickest way to reverse it was to put on a charge - and have the charge immediately reversed. I was asked if I would approve a $10 charge to be refunded immediately - for which I agreed. After I hung up, I checked my online statement - and my available balance had returned to normal. However, the next day, it was thrown out again - this time by $100.09. After calling my bank - I was informed that Rydges World Square had charged this amount to my account. It appears that the clerk who I spoke to (and who I authorised the transaction) somehow changed $10 to $100.09. Five days post stay (and four telephone calls later) this problem was finally rectified. On each occasion I had to make contact with Rydges - however they did try and email me - to a misspelt email address (even though I updated it upon check-in). One Representative who I spoke to suggested to me Rydges was not to fault - and that I probably had forgotten about a purchase I had made on my credit card!!! I have asked for an investigation to take place, and for a Manager to contact me direct regarding these incorrect/unauthorised transactions. So far I have heard nothing. Such an incident is disapointing from a Hotel I have enjoyed staying at in the past. The whole suituation has made me question just how safe my personal details and financial details are kept - made even worse by the way in which it has been handled.

Reviews.Title: “my home away from home”
Reviews.Author: JulzE
Reviews.Content: I travel to Sydney frequently and Rydges World Square is currently my home away from home (until I get bored and need to mix it up a bit). Its good quality, reasonably priced and in a good lively location. My business finishes at about 9pm and so I like that I can check in then pop out for sushi or other light meal, get the feeling that I have been somewhere other than work, and then go to bed. If I finish a bit early I can even squeeze in a tiny bit of shopping in the plaza just under the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT STAY”
Reviews.Author: bigmumma60
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last Saturday night as we were going to a birthday dinner in Darling Harbour. 2 adults and 2 kids. The hotel was very nice and the room we had on the 16th floor was great, it was big enough for us and had a large plasma tv, the bathroom was big and very nice. The very pleasant and friendly young man that checked us in gave me a family pass to use on the monorail as I mentioned that we were going there that night for dinner. I especially liked that you could open the window slightly in the room and get some fresh air. I think the hotel is in a great spot for tourists to Sydney, as you have the monorail at your doorstep or just a short walk to the train station or buses.All in all we had a very enjoyable night and found everything with the hotel fine and would definetly stay at this hotel again. We used the valet parking which was very efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the beds”
Reviews.Author: Mark_L_8
Reviews.Content: The mattress in the room was dreadful â€“ a Dunlop mattress manufactured in 1998 â€“ Yes I checked! The Dream beds are great, but only if the room has one. Make sure you ask. (For the same money, try the Fraser Suites in Kent St)

Reviews.Title: “Dream Bed, NOT!!!”
Reviews.Author: moocam
Reviews.Content: We booked to stay 3 nights at this hotel. Check in went smoothly and the room seemed clean and quite nice. The first problem was everytime we turned on the on the air conditioning, it gave a loud rattling / banging noise for about 30 second, but eventually worked, until the 3rd night when it apparently "burnt out", so didn't work at all. The next problem, every afternoon when returning from our day of sightseeing we would try to reenter our room but were locked out, so had to go back down in the lift and get issued with a new card to get back in to our room. The biggest problem was the so called "Dream Bed", we were sleeping on springs. Housekeeping had forgotten to put the special thick matress protector on the bed. I called housekeeping and was "personally guarenteed" it would be rectified, when we returned to our room in the afternoon, again after being locked out, we discovered the bed was still just springs. So by 6pm on our last night in this hotel with no airconditioner and the bed from hell, we were offered another room, upgraded, so, we had to change our dinner plans to pack up our belongings and move rooms. This hotel has emailed us with a Post Stay Survey, would you believe, specifially asking us about the "Dream Bed" We have stayed at other Rydges without problems but this hotel was very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel close to China town”
Reviews.Author: BangkokNegotiator
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on my friend's recommendation. Cost me A$179 per night. We get a nice clean and comfortable room, although a bit small and no view even on 28th floor. We found the service to be very good and friendly. They are very helpful to our 'tourist' questions especially the concierge. We didn't eat in the hotel so we can't comment on the food. Location wise, its next to China town so there are a lot of Chinese and Korean community in the area as well as Thai's close-by. I find it a bit far from the habour and if I was to visit again, I would stay around The Rocks. There are a lot of oriental restaurants around. Internet cafe is right out side the door on the plaza side for A$3 per hour. If you wish to stay near China town, this is a good place to book.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best”
Reviews.Author: catandjules
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location - short walk to Darling Harbour, shops, restaurants etc. Building and rooms are extremely tired thought and the whole place needs a make-over. The carpets are stained and the interior is very poorly maintained. The buffet lunch was nice, but room service meal was apalling and once done tray and leftovers sat in the hallway for almost a full-day. There are many better choices in Sydney - probably less expensive too.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: malrose39
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights for a short break in Sydney. Hotel was good, clean and accommodating. We got a free upgrade to an executive room (19th floor). It was a huge bedroom, with good bathroom, separate shower. Dressing gowns/slippers and cuddly teddy bear all included!! A carton of fresh milk in the fridge for complimentary tea/coffee - none of your horrible creamer/sachets here, and this was topped up for us when required. We didn't have breakfast here, instead we ate every morning at CAFE LA ROSA, just outside the Liverpool Street entrance to the hotel. The food was excellent, staff so friendly and rates really good too. We didn't dare try anywhere else just in case it wasn't as good - "Manny's fruit special "is a must...... Mr & Mrs McNulty Yarm, North Yorkshire UK

Reviews.Title: “Bad reception - rooms quite good”
Reviews.Author: Adnansamir
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in Sep 2008. Although the location and the rooms are quite good the reception is pathetic. The staff there do not know proper english i am sorry to say. Also the staff at the reception lie a lot. We came to the hotel at 1300 Hrs and enquired if our 2 rooms were avaiable. Only one room was given to us which was acceptable as the normal check in time was 1400 Hrs. However the other room was not given to us till 1530 Hrs. And whenever we spoke to the reception the girl lied to us that the housekeeping staff has not cleaned the room. Actually they were unable to keep the room ready from the earlier passenger. alo once when i checked into the room a housekeeping staff just barged into my room. I was shocked. They still had to do some cleaning of the room which she did and left. Other than this experience the rooms were of OK standard and the location was close to China Town and Darling Harbour. I suggest you this hotel however just beaware of the reception.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: drusinator
Reviews.Content: I booked an Executive One Bedroom King Suite and it was better than I had imagined. The second bathroom was huge, but the ensuite was big enough to live out of. The lounge was spacious, the room was perfectly clean, the staff were lovely, and the valet parking was quick and easy. I have stayed at a few Rydges hotels before and this one is definitely at the top of my list. My only complaint is that the in-room movie system is outdated. You can't pause and restart the movie and it looks like it runs of a VCR or something. The movie system in other Rydges hotels is far superior, and I hope that World Square will catch up with the others soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: jessica_aus
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at Rydges for our 2nd anniversary this w/e for a night! We booked over the phone through the Rydges booking line. I asked for one of the better rooms and was put in the executive business suite. I asked if this included parking or breakfast and was told it didn't and therefore paid $20 pp for buffet breakfast. When we arrived we discovered there was an executive lounge and breakfast was provided. I am annoyed the lady didn't tell me this over the phone when I booked, and hence paid an extra $40. The room itself was lovely, the most comfortable bed I have ever stayed in (dream bed!), plasma tv, bath, high floors (19th), clean room and chockies, magazines and bathrobes! We visited the executive lounge for drinks before dinner and it was great! The service was wonderful and a fantastic variety of food and beverages! My only other complaint besides the breakfast was that our check in was 2pm and my partner arrived as I was shopping in the city and they wouldn't let him check in until I called up and added his name to the booking (annoying) then when I arrived half an hour later they wouldn't give me the room number or a room card. They then rang him and he had to come down and get me, even though the booking was in my name! (VERY ANNOYING!). Apart from that we had a lovely stay! The room was great, the restaurant and bar was great and the executive lounge was fantastic! Highly recommend staying in a room where you can enjoy the executive lounge!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and location”
Reviews.Author: Unhappy_with_sandals
Reviews.Content: Great location and staff! Hotel located near bus stops, Monorail station, good shopping, and terrific restaurants. Front desk staff helped us get checked in 7 hours early which was a huge relief after a 15 hour flight from the States. Then Jeremy, with the Concierge Desk, spent lots of time helping us book dinner and tour reservations. The bed was comfortable and the shower had good water pressure...we were very happy!

Reviews.Title: “Good price for a city hotel”
Reviews.Author: worldwidekaren
Reviews.Content: This was a very reasonably priced and well located hotel, considering it's in one of the world's prime cities. We paid Â£320 for 5 nights in a comfortable room, with two double beds. My sister found hers so comfortable, she was tempted to stay there and leave seeing the Sydney Opera House for another day! It was possible to walk to Circular Quay and the said Opera House, and there were plenty of places in the area to pick up something to eat. Being a Rydges Priority Guest also brings the bonus of cheaper internet access. We enjoyed our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “A decent hotel, but a little expensive”
Reviews.Author: chrissw
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business for just over a week. My first impressions were positive; I had just arrived in the early morning on a flight from London and I was very pleased that the checkin was so quick and painless. The room itself, while not particularly spacious, was quite comfortable and very clean. One wouldn't say that it was particularly opulent or outstandingly decorated but everything was in good condition and it was very easy to live with. There was a large LCD screen television as well, although the picture quality wasn't all that good. The bed was really very comfortable. The bathroom again was very clean and spacious, and everything worked well; I particularly liked the fact that there was a separate shower cubicle. The hotel provide toiletries on a daily basis which seemed to be of a good standard. The only thing which was slightly wrong with the room was that one of the catches on the window was slightly broken, meaning that the window let in a small amount of noise from the street. Being only two floors up from reception, and overlooking Pitt Street, there was sometimes a lot of noise outside. Besides that, the general colour scheme, particularly in the bathroom, looked a little bit tired. I used the hotel gym regularly. There is an adequate range of equipment, which, however, seemed to be little used by guests, so there was never any problem with using it. Breakfast was the only meal I took in the hotel. At weekends, this costs AU$18, which, I suppose, is a reasonable price for a capital city hotel, but this goes up to $32 for the full breakfast during the week, which to me seems like a lot. In any case, there is a good range of food available to suit most people. The only problem I had with breakfast was that it was sometimes difficult to get a first or second cup of coffee from the staff who walk the floor; they don't seem to notice some tables. Overall I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again, although if I was paying for it myself I would be tempted to find somewhere less expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Who gave this place 5 stars?”
Reviews.Author: Krissishi
Reviews.Content: We booked a mystery 5 star hotel through wotif for our stay in Sydney. We got this place. Upon arrival, my partner and I realised we had stayed in this joint before - but it used to be called something else. The lobby area is nice, the valet do their job, the reception area is SLOW and always seems to be busy or not have enough staff there. Between my friends and I we had 3 rooms. My husband and I were lucky to get the best room - we went and checked out the other two rooms and they were VERY average compared to ours - which was not that crash hot. The view from our room was not great - why put a window in if you are going to look out and see a brick wall? Also the furnishings are old fashioned. In our friends room their TV didnt work. It was also an OLD style TV - not what you would expect in Sydney for 5 star. Wouldnt recommend this place and I wont be staying again OR choosing any 5 star mystery deals on wotif again....although maybe thats the point of the mystery - trying to figure out how a hotel gets its stars...........

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Happy_Blot
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights to attend the Good Food and Wine Show at Darling Harbour. It was very convenient to walk to the event and we had the option of the monorail door to door. The room was clean, bed comfortable and as we had breakfast, late check out and parking included in the price as well as being able to use our Rydges Priority card - we found this hotel excellent value. The only things that were a bit disappointing was that the fridge and air conditioning were very noisy and you could hear movements and talk from the hall. Nothing from other rooms. Breakfast was excellent. Staff were helpful and I arrived at midday and was able to go directly to the room. For a Sydney Central Hotel - it is great!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: OntarioJackson
Reviews.Content: Rydges World Square Hotel in downtown Sydney was a wonderful, classy, comfortable hotel. The staff were excellent, the room well-appointed and it was located right downtown with many services nearby including a number of internet cafes so that you can catch up with happenings a world away. I would certainly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Whats the Problem? Great location”
Reviews.Author: CARRA23J
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the reviews of this hotel on here we seriously considered cancelling our booking but in the end decided to go for it. Were glad we did, dont know what all the fuss is about. The hotel is brilliantly located just a short walk from darling harbour. An easy walk to central station and the museum station. The bar and restaurant are nice and rooms are spacious. The staff pleasent and helpful (allowing us to check in early which was really helpful as we'd had an overnight flight. There is a shopping centre under the hotel and loads of bars around. We enjoyed our stay here and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Pefectly Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: samw951
Reviews.Content: This is not a 5 Star, blow-your-hair-back hotel, but you'll be happy to have stayed here. The rooms are nice sized and modern (flat panel TVs as an example), and the staff is kind and helpful. We arrived in at the hotel at 11am (after a LONG flight from the US), and they were happy to let us check in. The location allows for easy walks all over the city, and the Central Train Station is about a 5 minute walk from the front door. In addition to being a good hotel, the price was entirely reasonable for a big city hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not even close to being a 5 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sydney85
Reviews.Content: I booked and had confirmed a twin room for myself and elderly mum. 2 days before arriving, I checked the booking and they had changed it to a king bed room. I had to ring 3 times before they would change and confirm the room as a twin room. On getting to the hotel, the lobby was nice, but on our floor, it looked as though the sprinklers had gone off at some stage as the carpet was all water stained and not lying flat (which made it difficult with a wheel chair). I'm guessing all the floors were like that. On opening the room, there was a water stain at the door. The bathroom was quite a good size, but the rest of the room left alot to be desire. On there website there is a comment about their "large rooms" - this was not the case. They also mention about how comfortable their beds are. I'm sure it would have been softer if we had bricks to lie on. The room had a desk and chair and also a coffee table, but only one "comfortable chair". Twin means 2 not 1. I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: tanyatia
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights for business, this hotel is in a great location, close to Shopping & business district. Valet parking was easy & the hotel kept my car until the afternoon of the day I checked out so as I could attend a course close by, they also offered to store my luggage for the day. This was done at no extra charge which was great. Breakfasts were excellent with a wide variety of foods. Staff were helpful during the stay. There was only one thing that I was not happy with & this was the check in. I had organised web-check in & this was not ready when I arrived as they specify it will be. The person checking me in didn't tell me much at all just here is your room key. The room I had was a King room. It was spacious & had a small balcony. Clean tidy & bathroom had a bath & shower. Dream beds are the best beds ever. Would stay here again due to location & the beds.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with our choice”
Reviews.Author: EddieFGlasgow
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a total of 6 nights in March and April 2008. Had been a little bit nervous given some of the feedback on here but made the booking on a basis of a number of stays with Rydges in London but have no regrets at all. Room was spacious and clean and the staff throughout the hotel were always helpful. The hotel is within easy walking distance of Darling Harbour, the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House and very close to Museum Station which gives access to Sydney's rail network. We made use of the (independant) shuttle service to the airport which was seemed good value at 12AUD. I would suggest that anyone who is considering using Rydges Hotels register with them via their website as this gives access to significant reductions on room rates as well as a 20% discount on food / drink in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_travelling
Reviews.Content: My sister and I spent the past weekend at Rydges World Square. Got a great deal on the hotel website for an executive twin which included free canapes, drinks and continental breakfast in the Executive Lounge. Dinner in the hotel Avery's restaurant was excellent....while not a huge menu the food was cooked to perfection and not overly priced. The staff were efficient and friendly, which made for a great dining experience. Our king twin room was very clean, beds and pillows to die for! Check-in and out was extremely quick due to the very pleasant and efficient staff. Very central to all of Sydney's sights with the monorail right on the doorstep. Looking forward to returning soon.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with our stay at the rydges”
Reviews.Author: TeBe
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in March 2008. We are from Perth and had a wedding to go to in Sydney. After reading the reviews on tripadvisor we were a bit worried but the hotel was fine. The room was very big and the bathroom was also very large with a separate bath and shower. The hotel is in an excellent location, you can walk to everything, shops, restaurants etc. The room was clean and had a large flat screen tv. My only complaint is that on the saturday they did not come to make up our room til around 2.30pm and we were just about to leave for the wedding. I asked if they could come back in about 15 mins and they said this is my last room to clean, i said just give us 10 mins and we will be gone. When we got back from the wedding the room was not made up. I was very disappointed and rang reception who brought us up some clean towels.However bed was unmade and bathroom not mopped etc. Despite my one complaint I was very happy with this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Uncomfortable mattress, slippery floor in the bathroom”
Reviews.Author: HKAIR
Reviews.Content: We had a reservation with the Crowne Plaza Darling Harbour, but they were overbooked and the night manager told us that Crowne Plaza has arranged for us to stay in "a nice five star hotel" for the first night. So our luggage was transfered to Rydges and we stayed in room 1702. The hotel did not strike me as a five star one, but I guess the Crowne Plaza manager may misrepresented the details a bit. Rydges's 1702 room was a handicapped room and the bathroom was very poorly designed - the water did not drain properly and the tile floor was not cleaned after the last customers and it was very slippery, my husband almost fell twice and I actually had my flip flops on in the shower so I don't slip. The breakfast buffet was not good but the bellhops were very friendly and helpful. The room was clean, the mattress not so comfortable. I would not hurry back for the price.

Reviews.Title: “wouldn't recommend ...”
Reviews.Author: KeepTravelling76
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business not being able to get into anywhere else downtown. Whilst the service was friendly enough, the rooms weren't that clean. The bathroom was like something out of a country motel and pretty grotty. The hotel smelt of smoke and I had a lovely view into the building next door. This hotel seems to rate itself as a 4 or 5 star hotel, but it's far from it. It is also not located in the best part of the city, although close to the train station if that's helpful to you. I won't be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: shandy40
Reviews.Content: I was a little concerned about booking this hotel because of the very mixed reviews but the decision to go to Sydney was a last minute thing and because I definitely required three separate beds my options were very limited. I had also made a query re the website re transportation and had not received an answer prior to the morning of our leaving. However, just before heading off to the airport I received a phone call on my mobile from the manager who apologised for not having responded sooner. As I had booked through the Rydges worldwide site,my query had only been received by Rydges Sydney during the night. He was most helpful in answering my query on the phone and I am glad I took his advice. I booked a family room via they Rydges internet site a couple of days beforehand we left for a very reasonable rate. My understanding was that this gave us a master bedroom, a second room with two single beds and one shared bathroom. When we arrived mid-morning our room was not ready but that was fine. After all check in is not until 2pm. The staff took our luggage and we headed off to sightsee for the day. We didn't get back to the hotel again until late afternoon. When we finally got in to the room, we had been upgraded to a suite so had two very good size bedrooms, a sitting room and three bathrooms. It was all very nicely furnished and clean. The two main bathrooms were quite roomy, modern and clean. The third bathroom was rather smaller as it did not accommodate a bath as the other two did. On arriving we realized our luggage had not been brought up as promised, but a phone call to the desk saw it arrive within a couple of minutes. We found the staff to be helpful at all times. We didn't have a meal at the hotel so cannot comment on that. Don't expect any wonderful views but the location is within easy walking distance of central Sydney, but a decent stroll all the way down to Circular Quay - probably ,about 30 mins. I would certainly consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Dont book here!!!!”
Reviews.Author: globalgirlLondon
Reviews.Content: We thought we were getting a good deal at this 5 star hotel - unfortunately I dont know where they get their star rating from. The room was FILTHY. We had to request to be moved to a new room. The second room was slightly better but there was a bloodstain on the bathroom door and my pillowcase had a dirty smear on it. We complained to the manager who told us that it is a "lower standard" 5 star!! He did give us a bottle of wine to pacify us but that did not change my impression of the place. Do not stay here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Actually quite good.”
Reviews.Author: ChrisGrr
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews, i was nervous about this hotel. We got it through the secret hotel deal on Lastminute.com.au Well, it was fine. Obviously it's not the best 5 star hotel in the world, but the room was tidy and the location is really great. We ordered room service one evening and it came quickly and was actually quite good value. If you need a base in Sydney, got for it, it's not as bad as some people say.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: kevinpng
Reviews.Content: Rydges World Sqaure fails to satisfy on a number of fronts. Yes, the hotel is in a good location but it does not conform to what one might expect given it has a five star rating. The room I was allocated was tired and in need of upgrade. The hotel is not sound proof, and noise from outside easily carries through even on the 20th floor. While I found staff to be pleasant, reception staff were very inpersonal. There is no welcome - they just simply get your name and check you in, which is fine. But the property does claim a 5 star rating and for that you would expect staff to take that extra step by being warm and welcoming on arrival. To be frank I would not stay at this property again. Sydney has an abundance of high quality hotels in the same price range.

Reviews.Title: “The rooms need a makeover”
Reviews.Author: VoyagerRTW
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at this hotel since 2002, at least twice a year. Somewhere along the line the standards started slipping - most obviously in the bedrooms. On the first occasion the mattress was so out of shape that I was actually poked by springs â€“ I complained and was moved to another room. When it happened a second time, during another stay, I was flabbergasted. I knew that complaining about it would not help, due to the fact that virtually all hotel rooms in the city was full, because of special events e.g. Ashes Cricket, etc. The bed was in fact so uncomfortable that I slept on the floor when my back could not take it any more. In contrast with other world-class 4-and 5* hotels, the â€œoldâ€� television sets with limited channels remain in the bedrooms and it doesnâ€™t look as if there are plans to replace them with plasma, LCD or even good quality flat screen TV sets. Since my last stay at this hotel, I have since switched over to the SwissÃ´tel Sydney. I will not return until Rydges have sorted out the mess the previous management and owners created at the once wonderful Avillion hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not a 5 star”
Reviews.Author: Dougeli
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight back in August, the hotel is in an excellent location for business or shopping. Room was quiet and fairly clean (carpets could do with a steam clean) but overall it was small and dull. King sized bed was 2 singles pushed together and furnishings were very basic. Definitely not a 5 star hotel, more like a 3.5 - 4 star. Room was not too pricey but parking was $35 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: jhuang
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Rydges World Square from 5 - 7 September during the APEC conference in Sydney. Was not affected at all by this. After reading mostly bad reviews about the hotel here after I booked it, I was quite worried. These worries were unfounded as Rydges has obviously updated it since the other reviews were published. The hotel lobby area is in great shape and the room we had (two single beds) was in good condition, quite small, but the bathroom was nice and clean. Staff were a little lacklustre - some were better than others - but they were always polite. There's quite a distance between Reception and Concierge and this is quite annoying - but I found the Concierge staff were always more friendly and helpful than the reception staff. We asked for a newspaper during our stay and only received it on one of the mornings. Location of the hotel is good if you want to be around Darling Harbour - and only a few blocks walk away from the main CBD. Overall a solid hotel - we certainly enjoyed our stay and will be staying there again if we get the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Minor flaws”
Reviews.Author: cessnaWashington
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a long three weeks touring Australia. Having never been there I decided to go with a travel expert. She gave me a few hotels to choose from and I chose the Rydges World Square in Sydney for the location, but got a lot more. The location is in the heart of the CBD and has connections to just about anywhere you wanted to go. The front desk people were very professional and accomodating. Especially since I arrived in Sydney at 7:30 am only to find (understandably) that my reserved King room was not ready. I was SO tired that I asked the nice man behind the desk if I could upgrade to a suite for a few nights. He found me a suite but that room was not ready also. Later on we found out that the whole city was sold out because of a big concert, a few major rugby games plus it was student holiday! It was remarkable that they even found me a room. I checked my bags with conceirge and left for only one hour. I came back to find my bags checked into my room and was ready to go! The suites are beautiful except for the room I got has two bathrooms, which is great except the first one by the front door smelled SO badly that I had to close the door and not use it. It smelled like sewage. I don't know what the problem was but I was not going to complain, since there were no other rooms for me to go into. With your executive suite, you also get access to an executive lounge which twice a day would offer a complimentary breakfast and in the evening a happy hour with wine/beer and appetizers. It had to be the best deal in town. The food was excellent and the lounge was peaceful and quiet. Even when they were not open officially for happy hour, you were allowed to go into the room, with your hotel room key and they would leave snacks out for you, like cookies or fruit. That was a highlight of extra customer service and for a room that was not that much more. The only problem we had was one night there were loud kids at the dance bar across street that kept us up until 4 am. That was the only complaint. If you book a room ask for a room on the higher level floor. You won't hear so much street noise. I'd stay there again. WE were able to walk everywhere plus there is a shopping mall on a lower level right under the hotel. It has a small grocery store and liquor store, plus a japanese market and food booths if you didn't feel like going out. I would like to see Sydney in their summer next time.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and Basic”
Reviews.Author: FreqBusTraveller88
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this Rydges (previously Avillion) four times. The first 2 times I was in a small, basic room (for close to $AU200 per night) near noisy airconditioning machinery and I got some sleep. When I made my third reservation, I asked for a room away from the very noisy adjoining streets, and got a room on a noisy street opposite what sounded like an Irish pub. I was then moved to another room and this was above the railway station so it sounded like trains were rumbling through my room all through the night and I got very little sleep which does not help when one has a fullon business day the next day. On the morning f my second night of the stay, I spoke with the polite Duty Manager and was moved to a quiet room and had a great sleep. I booked into the hotel again (silly me you may say but the location is very convenient) and again asked for a quiet room. Guess what - I went through the exactly the same reservation and checkin process as above, even meeting with the same Duty Manager on day 2. Nothing had changed In addition to this, the bathrooms were basic. On 1 stay the showerhead was broken; on subsequent stays there were empty boxes, 2 of one product and none of another, no towel for the floor etc. The room service food, too, is horrible - don't order expensive room service. This is a noisy, expensive, basic hotel and my star rating for it would be 2 or 3 stars. I also get the impression that they do not listen to their customers and don't really care. I am booked to go to Sydney at the end of August and have booked into the Meriton Apartments near by.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Experience”
Reviews.Author: Britboyscott
Reviews.Content: I had used the Avillion to house myself and company staff (I buy about 5,000 room nights a year), so was happy to take my mother along for a stay on her way overseas. The room we were allocated was unlike any I had stayed in previously. Extremely small, dirty carpets, torn curtain, dusty with drainage problems. Here is an example of how important the front staff are to a hotel - when I called to see if there may a room in line with others I had stayed in on many occassions, the front desk member insisted that all rooms were the same size. I drew to his attention the fllorplan on the back of the door, but he insisted I had not stayed in premier room but a suite (I stay in hotels at least 8 months a year so know the difference). I did receive a call from the Rooms Division Manager who was very upset about it. I did say I would call next time I stayed which I haven't done Unfortunately as we were trying to sleep, at about 1am there was screaming outside the door by a drunk guest, then a 15 minute struggle with the police resulting in a very disturbed sleep. A cold, substandard breakfast followed the next morning. I detailed this in a hotel survey, but have not received a response. I think the Rooms Division Manager should perhaps become the GM! I have stayed for one night since in a better room, but noticed again stained carpets.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel needs to make an effort...”
Reviews.Author: bartybart8888
Reviews.Content: This is not a 5 star hotel. Needs refurbishement and staff need to be trained. Did not provide morning newspaper when asked 3 days in a row. Cleaning staff still knock on the door when the "DND" sign is out... Floors water stained on some floors. Tired, boring, 3 star hotel but well located.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: JuliaNewZealand
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel off the Wotif site as a mystery 5 star hotel- we knew it was a bargain for 5 stars but sadly it is nothing like a 5 star hotel. I suggest they call it a 3 star hotel. The staff were great , the service was superb, but the rooms and fittings were very average. It was clean enough but not spotless, the bathrooms could do with a good scrub. We did have a problem in the first room we were put into with the air conditioning noise and the duty manager dealt with that very promptly and willingly. The second room was much larger, cleaner, and more modern fittings but would still not be rated as a 5 star hotel. Location was handy to Darling Harbour and Central city. I would not stay there again and would probably not at Rydges again as I think they were dishonest with their marketing.

HotelInfo.Name: Rydges World Square Sydney Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 389 Pitt Street, Sydney, New South Wales 2000, Australia (Formerly Avillion Hotel)
